Allah will most certainly help those who will help Him. Verily Allah is Immensely Strong, Overwhelmingly Mighty.
Text2: As to those who disbelieve, perdition lies in store for them and Allah has reduced their works to nought.

Text1: those who were unjustly expelled from their homes for no other reason than their saying: "Allah is Our Lord." Allah will most certainly help those who will help Him. Verily Allah is Immensely Strong, Overwhelmingly Mighty.
Text2: We shall certainly test you until We know those of you who truly strive and remain steadfast, and will ascertain about you.

Allah will most certainly help those who will help Him. Verily Allah is Immensely Strong, Overwhelmingly Mighty.
Text2: Against these they had no grudge except that they believed in Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Praiseworthy,

Text1: and so did the dwellers of Midian, and Moses too was branded a liar. Initially I granted respite to the unbelievers for a while and then seized them. How dreadful was My punishment!
Text2: _—“I am the supreme lord of you all._—ù

Text1: How many towns have We destroyed because their people were steeped in iniquity: so they lie fallen down upon their turrets! How many wells lie deserted; and how many towering palaces lie in ruins!
Text2: Wherever you might be, death will overtake you even though you be in massive towers. And when some good happens to them, they say: 'This is from Allah'; whereas when some misfortune befalls them, they say: 'This is because of you'. Say: 'All is from Allah.' What has happened to this people that they seem to understand nothing?

Text1: whereas those who strive against Our Signs, seeking to profane them, they are the friends of the Fire!
Text2: Do they not see that We are advancing in the land, diminishing it by its borders on all sides? Allah judges, and no one has the power to reverse His judgement. He is swift in reckoning.

Text1: whereas those who strive against Our Signs, seeking to profane them, they are the friends of the Fire!
Text2: As for those who disbelieved and barred others from the way of Allah, We shall add further chastisement to their chastisement for all the mischief they did.

Text1: Never did We send a Messenger or a Prophet before you (O Muhammad), but that whenever he had a desire, Satan interfered with that desire. Allah eradicates the interference of Satan and strengthens His Signs. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
Text2: Then there are among them some un-lettered people who have no knowledge of the Book but depend upon empty hopes and are guided by mere conjecture and guess-work.

Text1: The unbelievers will not cease to be in doubt about it until the Hour suddenly comes upon them, or the chastisement of an ominous day overtakes them.
Text2: On that Day all sovereignty shall be Allah's and He will judge among them. Then those who believed and acted righteously shall be in Gardens of Bliss.

Text1: The unbelievers will not cease to be in doubt about it until the Hour suddenly comes upon them, or the chastisement of an ominous day overtakes them.
Text2: The real Kingdom on that Day will belong only to the Merciful, and it will be a very hard Day for the disbelievers.

Text1: A humiliating chastisement awaits those who disbelieved and denied Our Signs.
Text2: Your Lord said: _—“Pray to Me, and I will accept your prayers. Surely those who wax too proud to worship Me shall enter Hell, utterly abased._—ù

Text1: As for those who migrated in the way of Allah, whereafter they were slain, or died, Allah will certainly grant them a goodly provision. Indeed, Allah is the Best of all those who provide.
Text2: So if he is one of those who are near-stationed (to Allah),

Text1: As for those who migrated in the way of Allah, whereafter they were slain, or died, Allah will certainly grant them a goodly provision. Indeed, Allah is the Best of all those who provide.
Text2: then happiness and delight and Gardens of Bliss are his.

Text1: So shall it be because it is Allah Who causes the night to emerge out of the day and causes the day to emerge out of the night and Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
Text2: Say: 'O Allah, Lord of all dominion! You give dominion to whom You will, and take away dominion from whom You will, and You exalt whom You will, and abase whom You will. In Your Hand is all good. Surely You are All-Power-ful.

Text1: Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky whereby the earth turns green? Verily Allah is Subtle, All-Aware.
Text2: (Luqman said): _—“Son, Allah will bring forth everything even if it be as small as the grain of a mustard seed even though it be hidden inside a rock or (anywhere) in the heavens or earth. Allah is Most Subtle, All-Aware.

Text1: For every people We have prescribed a way of worship which they follow. So, (O Muhammad), let them not dispute with you concerning this, and call them to Your Lord. You are certainly on the Straight Way.
Text2: Everyone has a direction towards which he turns in Prayer: so try to excel one another in good works. Allah will find you wheresoever you be, for nothing is out of Allah's reach.

Text1: And if they dispute with you, say: "Allah knows well what you do.
Text2: And if they reject you as false, tell them: 'My deeds are for myself and your deeds for yourselves. You will not be held responsible for my deeds, nor I for your deeds.

Text1: And if they dispute with you, say: "Allah knows well what you do.
Text2: Do they claim that the Messenger himself has fabricated it? (If so), tell them: _—“If I have fabricated it, then you have no power to protect me from Allah's chastisement. He knows well the idle talk in which you indulge. He suffices as a witness between me and you. He is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful._—ù

Text1: When Our Signs are plainly recited to them, you will perceive utter repugnance on their faces and it all but seems as if they will soon pounce upon those who recite Our Signs to them. Say: "Shall I tell you what is worse than that? The Fire with which Allah has threatened those who disbelieve. That is truly an evil end."
Text2: it is an evil abode and an evil resting place":

Text1: They have not formed a true estimate of Allah. Indeed, Allah is All-Powerful, All-Mighty.
Text2: He it is Who creates for the first time and He it is Who will create again,

Text1: He knows all that is before them and that which is hidden from them. And it is to Allah that all affairs are returned.
Text2: O Messenger! Deliver what has been revealed to you from your Lord, for if you fail to do that, you have not fulfilled the task of His messengership. Allah will certainly protect you from the evil of men. Surely Allah will not guide the unbelievers (to succeed against you).

Text1: He knows all that is before them and that which is hidden from them. And it is to Allah that all affairs are returned.
Text2: other than to a Messenger whom He chooses (for the bestowal of any part of the knowledge of the Unseen), whereafter He appoints guards who go before him and behind him,

Text1: He knows all that is before them and that which is hidden from them. And it is to Allah that all affairs are returned.
Text2: so that He may know that they have delivered the messages of their Lord. He encompasses in His knowledge their surroundings and keeps a count of all things._—ù

Text1: Strive in the cause of Allah in a manner worthy of that striving. He has chosen you (for His task), and He has not laid upon you any hardship in religion. Keep to the faith of your father Abraham. Allah named you Muslims earlier and even in this (Book), that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and that you may be witnesses over all mankind. So establish Prayer, and pay Zakah, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protector. What an excellent Protector; what an excellent Helper!
Text2: O Mankind, submit to your Lord Who created you and those who were before you; in this way only you may expect to save yourselves.

Text1: who avoid whatever is vain and frivolous;
Text2: (And the servants of the Merciful are those:) who do not bear witness to falsehood and who; if they have ever to pass by what is vain, pass by like dignified people:

Text1: who observe Zakah;
Text2: He who purifies it will prosper,

Text1: who observe Zakah;
Text2: and he who suppresses it will be ruined.

Text1: then We made him into a drop of life-germ, then We placed it in a safe depository,
Text2: which We then placed in a secure repository

Text1: Thereafter you are destined to die,
Text2: Say: _—“Go about the earth and see how He created for the first time, and then Allah will recreate life._—ù Surely, Allah has power over everything.

Text1: We have indeed fashioned above you seven paths. Never were We unaware of the task of creation.
Text2: The seven heavens, the earth, and all that is within them give glory to Him. There is nothing but gives glory to Him with His praise, though you do not understand their hymns of praise. He is Most Forbearing, Exceedingly Forgiving."

Text1: and are carried on them and also on ships.
Text2: They derive a variety of benefits and drinks from them. Will they, then, not give thanks?

Text1: And then when you and those accompanying you are firmly seated in the Ark, say: "Thanks be to Allah Who has delivered us from the wrong-doing people."
Text2: He Who created these pairs, all of them, and provided you ships and cattle on which you ride,

Text1: And then when you and those accompanying you are firmly seated in the Ark, say: "Thanks be to Allah Who has delivered us from the wrong-doing people."
Text2: It is to our Lord that we shall eventually return._—ù

Text1: Then We sent Our Messengers in succession. Whenever a Messenger came to his people they rejected him, calling him a liar. Thereupon, We made each people to follow the other (to its doom), reducing them to mere tales (of the past). Scourged be the people who do not believe!
Text2: But they said: _—“Lord, make the stages of our journeys longer._—ù They wronged their own selves so We reduced them to bygone tales, and utterly tore them to pieces. Verily there are Signs in this for everyone who is steadfast and thankful.

Text1: And We made Mary's son, and his mother, a Sign, and We gave them refuge on a lofty ground, a peaceful site with springs flowing in it.
Text2: Thereupon the angel below her cried out: "Grieve not, for your Lord has caused a stream of water to flow beneath you.

Text1: We are busy lavishing on them all kinds of good? Nay, they do not perceive the reality of the matter.
Text2: Do not let the, unbelievers imagine that the respite We give them is good for them. We give them respite so that they may grow in wickedness. A humiliating chastisement lies in store for them.

Text1: We are busy lavishing on them all kinds of good? Nay, they do not perceive the reality of the matter.
Text2: Let neither their riches nor their children excite your admiration. Allah only wants to chastise them through these things in the present life, and to cause them to die while they are unbelievers.

Text1: We are busy lavishing on them all kinds of good? Nay, they do not perceive the reality of the matter.
Text2: They always said: _—“We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised._—ù

Text1: We are busy lavishing on them all kinds of good? Nay, they do not perceive the reality of the matter.
Text2: So leave Me, (O Prophet), to deal with him who gives the lie to this Discourse. We shall draw them little by little (to their undoing) in a way that they will not know.

Text1: We are busy lavishing on them all kinds of good? Nay, they do not perceive the reality of the matter.

Text1: until We seize with Our chastisement those of them that are given to luxuriant ways. They will then begin to groan.
Text2: Leave it to Me to deal with the affluent ones who give the lie (to the Truth), and bear with them for a while.

Text1: My Signs were rehearsed to you and you turned back on your heels and took to flight,
Text2: (They will be told): _—“(The cause of your present state is that) when Allah alone was invoked, you disbelieved; and when others instead of Him were invoked, you believed. Today all judgement lies with Allah, the Most High, the All-Great._—ù

Text1: Were the Truth to follow their desires, the order of the heavens and the earth and those who dwell in them would have been ruined. Nay, the fact is that We have brought to them their own remembrance; and yet it is from their own remembrance that they are turning away.
Text2: Have they any share in the dominion (of Allah)? Had that been so, they would never have granted people even as much as the speck on a date-stone.

Text1: Were the Truth to follow their desires, the order of the heavens and the earth and those who dwell in them would have been ruined. Nay, the fact is that We have brought to them their own remembrance; and yet it is from their own remembrance that they are turning away.
Text2: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Even if you owned the treasures of my Lord's Mercy you would have held them back for fear of spending them." Man is indeed ever niggardly.

Text1: Were the Truth to follow their desires, the order of the heavens and the earth and those who dwell in them would have been ruined. Nay, the fact is that We have brought to them their own remembrance; and yet it is from their own remembrance that they are turning away.
Text2: Is it they who distribute the Mercy of your Lord? It is We Who have distributed their livelihood among them in the life of this world, and have raised some above others in rank that some of them may harness others to their service. Your Lord's Mercy is better than all the treasures that they hoard.

Text1: Were We to be merciful to them and remove from them their present afflictions, they would persist in their transgression, blindly wandering on.
Text2: If you could but see when they shall be made to stand by the Fire! They will plead: 'Would that we were brought back to life? Then we would not give the lie to the signs of our Lord and would be among the believers.'

Text1: Were We to be merciful to them and remove from them their present afflictions, they would persist in their transgression, blindly wandering on.
Text2: They say now: 'There is nothing but the life of this world, and we shall not be raised from the dead.'

Text1: Were We to be merciful to them and remove from them their present afflictions, they would persist in their transgression, blindly wandering on.
Text2: And had Allah known in them any good He would surely, have made them hear; but (being as they, are) even if He made them hear, they would have surely turned away in aversion.

Text1: It is He Who gives life and causes death, and He holds mastery over the alternation of night and day. Do you not understand this?
Text2: Neither does it lie in the sun's power to overtake the moon nor can the night outstrip the day. All glide along, each in its own orbit.

Text1: We were promised such things and so were our forefathers before us. All these are no more than tales of the past."
Text2: Does man not see that We created him of a sperm drop, and lo! he is flagrantly contentious?

Text1: We were promised such things and so were our forefathers before us. All these are no more than tales of the past."

Text1: We were promised such things and so were our forefathers before us. All these are no more than tales of the past."
Text2: They say: _—“That will then be a return with a great loss!_—ù

Text1: Ask them: "Whose is the earth and those who are in it? Tell us if you know"
Text2: Lo, religion is exclusively devoted to Allah. Your religion is entirely consecrated to Him. As for those who have taken others than Allah for their guardians, (they say): _—“We worship them only that they may bring us nearer to Allah._—ù Allah will judge between them concerning what they differ about. Verily Allah does not guide anyone who is given to sheer lying, is an utter unbeliever.

Text1: Ask them: "Say, if you indeed know, to whom belongs the dominion over all things; (Who is it) that grants asylum, but against Whom no asylum is available?"
Text2: I have put my trust in Allah, Who is my Lord and your Lord. There is no moving creature which He does not hold by its forelock. Surely, My Lord is on the straight path.

Text1: that I have left behind. I am likely to do good." Nay, it is merely a word that he is uttering. There is a barrier behind all of them (who are dead) until the Day when they will be raised up.
Text2: (They will be told): _—“(The cause of your present state is that) when Allah alone was invoked, you disbelieved; and when others instead of Him were invoked, you believed. Today all judgement lies with Allah, the Most High, the All-Great._—ù

Text1: that I have left behind. I am likely to do good." Nay, it is merely a word that he is uttering. There is a barrier behind all of them (who are dead) until the Day when they will be raised up.
Text2: Hell is behind them. Their worldly earnings shall not avail them, nor those whom they took as protectors instead of Allah. An awesome chastisement lies in store for them.

Text1: that I have left behind. I am likely to do good." Nay, it is merely a word that he is uttering. There is a barrier behind all of them (who are dead) until the Day when they will be raised up.
Text2: But when a person's term comes to an end, Allah never grants any respite. Allah is well aware of all that you do.

Text1: And then no sooner the Trumpet is blown than there will remain no kinship among them that Day, nor will they ask one another.

Text1: Are you not those to whom My revelations were recited, and you dubbed them as lies?
Text2: These Messengers were sent as bearers of glad tidings and as warners so that after sending the Messengers people may have no plea against Allah. Allah is All-Mighty, All-Wise.

Text1: Are you not those to whom My revelations were recited, and you dubbed them as lies?
Text2: He who follows the Right Way shall do so to his own advantage; and he who strays shall incur his own loss. No one shall bear another's burden. And never do We punish any people until We send a Messenger (to make the Truth distinct from falsehood).

Text1: Are you not those to whom My revelations were recited, and you dubbed them as lies?
Text2: as though it will burst with rage. Every time a multitude is cast into it, its keepers will ask them: _—“Did no warner come to you?_—ù

Text1: Our Lord! Take us out of this. Then if we revert (to evil-doing) we shall indeed be wrongdoers."
Text2: (They will be told): _—“(The cause of your present state is that) when Allah alone was invoked, you disbelieved; and when others instead of Him were invoked, you believed. Today all judgement lies with Allah, the Most High, the All-Great._—ù

Text1: Our Lord! Take us out of this. Then if we revert (to evil-doing) we shall indeed be wrongdoers."
Text2: They will say: _—“Yes, a warner came to us, but we gave the lie to him and said: 'Allah has revealed nothing. You are surely in huge error.'

Text1: Our Lord! Take us out of this. Then if we revert (to evil-doing) we shall indeed be wrongdoers."

Text1: So, exalted be Allah, the True King! There is no god but He, the Lord of the Great Throne.
Text2: They did not recognise the true worth of Allah. (Such is Allah's power that) on the Day of Resurrection the whole earth will be in His grasp, and the heavens shall be folded up in His Right Hand. Glory be to Him! Exalted be He from all that they associate with Him.

Text1: A man guilty of adultery (or fornication) shall not marry any but the woman guilty of the same or a mushrik woman, and none shall marry a woman guilty of adultery (or fornication) but the man guilty of the same or a mushrik man: such marriages are forbidden to true believers.
Text2: And those of you who cannot afford to marry free, believing women (muhsanat), then marry such believing women whom your right hands possess. Allah knows all about your faith. All of you belong to one another. Marry them, then, with the leave of their guardians, and give them their bridal-due in a fair manner that they may live in the protection of wedlock rather than be either mere objects of unfettered lust or given to secret love affairs. Then if they become guilty of immoral conduct after they have entered into wedlock, they shall be liable to half the penalty to which free women (muhsanat) are liable. This relaxation is for those of you who fear to fall into sin by remaining unmarried. But if you persevere, it is better for you. Allah is All-Forgiving, All-Compassionate.

Text1: A man guilty of adultery (or fornication) shall not marry any but the woman guilty of the same or a mushrik woman, and none shall marry a woman guilty of adultery (or fornication) but the man guilty of the same or a mushrik man: such marriages are forbidden to true believers.
Text2: This day all good things have been made lawful to you. The food of the People of the Book is permitted to you, and your food is permitted to them. And permitted to you are chaste women, be they either from among the believers or from among those who have received the Book before you, provided you become their protectors in wedlock after paying them their bridal-due, rather than go around committing fornication and taking them as secret-companions. The work of he who refuses to follow the way of faith will go waste, and he will be among the utter losers in the Hereafter.

Text1: A man guilty of adultery (or fornication) shall not marry any but the woman guilty of the same or a mushrik woman, and none shall marry a woman guilty of adultery (or fornication) but the man guilty of the same or a mushrik man: such marriages are forbidden to true believers.
Text2: Arrange marriages between the single men and women among your and between your slave men and slave women, who are righteous,, if they be indigent, Allah will provide means for them out of His bounty: Allah has boundless resources and He is AllKnowing.

Text1: Those who have invented the slander, are some of your own people. You should not, however, regard this matter as evil for it has good in it for you. Whoso took any part in this, he earned his share of the sin accordingly, and the one, who had the greatest share of responsibility in it, shall have a terrible punishment.
Text2: And they brought Joseph's shirt, stained with false blood. Seeing this their father exclaimed: "Nay (this is not true); rather your evil souls have made it easy for you to commit a heinous act. So I will bear this patiently, and in good grace. It is Allah's help alone that I seek against your fabrication."

Text1: Those who have invented the slander, are some of your own people. You should not, however, regard this matter as evil for it has good in it for you. Whoso took any part in this, he earned his share of the sin accordingly, and the one, who had the greatest share of responsibility in it, shall have a terrible punishment.
Text2: Those among you, who are bountiful and persons of means, should not swear on oath that they would withhold their help from their relatives, the indigent and those who have left their homes for the cause of Allah: they should forgive and forbear. Do you not wish that Allah should forgive you? and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Text1: Why did the slanderers not bring four witnesses (to prove their charge)? Now that they have not brought witnesses, they themselves are liars in the sight of Allah.
Text2: Those who have invented the slander, are some of your own people. You should not, however, regard this matter as evil for it has good in it for you. Whoso took any part in this, he earned his share of the sin accordingly, and the one, who had the greatest share of responsibility in it, shall have a terrible punishment.

Text1: Those who charge with slander those Believing women, who are chaste but simple souls, are accursed in this world and in the Hereafter: there is a great punishment for them.
Text2: except those who repent and reform themselves; Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Text1: Those who charge with slander those Believing women, who are chaste but simple souls, are accursed in this world and in the Hereafter: there is a great punishment for them.
Text2: Impure women are for impure men and impure men for impure women, and pure women are for pure men and pure men for pure women. They are free from those scandals which the slanderers utter. There is forgiveness for them and honourable provision.

Text1: Those who charge with slander those Believing women, who are chaste but simple souls, are accursed in this world and in the Hereafter: there is a great punishment for them.
Text2: Verily those who cause annoyance to Allah and His Messenger - Allah has cursed them in this world and in the Hereafter and has prepared for them a humiliating chastisement.

Text1: And O Prophet, enjoin the Believing men to restrain their gaze and guard their private parts. This is a more righteous way for them: Allah has knowledge of what they do.
Text2: except in regard to their spouses and those whom their right hands possess, for in regard to them they are not reproachable,

Text1: Allah is the light of the heavens and the earth: His light (in the universe) may be likened (to the light of) a lamp in a niche: the lamp is in a glass shade: the glass shade is like a glittering star and lamp is lit with the olive oil of a blessed tree which is neither eastern nor western: its oil is (so fine) as if it were going to shine forth by itself though no fire touched it (as though all the means of increasing) light upon light (were provided); Allah guides to His light whomever He wills. He cites parables to make the Message clear to the people; He has perfect knowledge of everything.
Text2: Can it happen that he who takes his stand on a clear evidence from his Lord, subsequently followed by a witness from Him (in his support), and prior to that the Book of Moses was revealed as a guide and a mercy, (would even he deny the truth in the manner of those who adore the life of this world)? Rather, such men are bound to believe in it. The Fire shall be the promised resort of the groups that disbelieve. So be in no doubt about it for this indeed is the truth from your Lord although most people do not believe.

Text1: as are not diverted by trade and merchandise from remembering Him and from establishing Salat and paying Zakat, for they fear the Day when the hearts will be overturned and the eyes will become petrified.
Text2: we fear from our Lord a Day that shall be long and distressful._—ù

Text1: Or (their efforts may be likened to those of a man trying to swim in) a deep dark ocean, covered with billows, one over the other, and above it a cloud: darkness upon darkness: so much so that if he stretches out his hand, he cannot see it. There is no light for the one whom Allah does not give light.
Text2: For those whom Allah lets go astray, there is no guide; and He will leave them in their transgression to stumble blindly.

Text1: They (the hypocrites) solemnly swear by Allah and say, "If you order us, we will leave our homes." Say to them, "Do not swear oaths for your `obedience' is well known; Allah is fully aware of what you are doing. "
Text2: They will swear to you in order to please you. But even if you become pleased with them, Allah will not be pleased with such an evil-doing folk.

Text1: They (the hypocrites) solemnly swear by Allah and say, "If you order us, we will leave our homes." Say to them, "Do not swear oaths for your `obedience' is well known; Allah is fully aware of what you are doing. "
Text2: To be sure, if they are banished, they will not go with them and if war is waged against them, they will not aid them; and even if they provide any aid to them, they will still turn their backs, and thereafter no aid will be forthcoming to them.

Text1: They (the hypocrites) solemnly swear by Allah and say, "If you order us, we will leave our homes." Say to them, "Do not swear oaths for your `obedience' is well known; Allah is fully aware of what you are doing. "
Text2: They shelter behind their oath, and thus hinder their own selves and others from the Path of Allah. Evil indeed is what they do.

Text1: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, but if you turn away, you should note it well that the Messenger is responsible for the duty entrusted to him and you are responsible for the duty entrusted to you. If you obey him, you will be rightly guided, for the responsibility of the Messenger is only to convey the Message clearly to you.
Text2: So render good counsel, for you are simply required to counsel,

Text1: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, but if you turn away, you should note it well that the Messenger is responsible for the duty entrusted to him and you are responsible for the duty entrusted to you. If you obey him, you will be rightly guided, for the responsibility of the Messenger is only to convey the Message clearly to you.
Text2: and are not invested with the authority to compel them.

Text1: Allah has promised to those among you who believe and do righteous deeds, that He will make them successors in the land just as He made those who passed away before them, and that He will establish their religion, which He has approved for them, on strong foundations and will change their (present) state of fear into peace and security. Let them worship Me and associate none with Me; and the one who disbelieves after this," shall be of those who are perverse transgressors.
Text2: and to grant them power in the land, and make Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts see what they had feared.

Text1: O Believers, do not consider the summoning by the Messenger like the summoning among you by one another. Allah knows well those of you who steal away, concealing themselves behind others. Let those who disobey the order of the Messenger beware lest they should be involved in some affliction, or are visited by a woeful scourge.
Text2: O Believers, do not say. "Ra 'ina" but say, "Unzurna " and listen a to what is said; for the disbelievers deserve a painful punishment.

Text1: O Believers, do not consider the summoning by the Messenger like the summoning among you by one another. Allah knows well those of you who steal away, concealing themselves behind others. Let those who disobey the order of the Messenger beware lest they should be involved in some affliction, or are visited by a woeful scourge.
Text2: Surely most of those who call out to you, (O Prophet), from behind the apartments, are devoid of understanding.

Text1: O Believers, do not consider the summoning by the Messenger like the summoning among you by one another. Allah knows well those of you who steal away, concealing themselves behind others. Let those who disobey the order of the Messenger beware lest they should be involved in some affliction, or are visited by a woeful scourge.
Text2: If they were patient until you went out to them, that would have been better for them. Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

Text1: Beware! whatever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He knows whatever you are doing. On the Day you shall return to Him, He will let you know what you have. done: He has full knowledge of everything.
Text2: He has the keys to the realm that lies beyond the reach of human perception; none knows them but He. And He knows what is on the land and in the sea; there is not a leaf which falls that He does not know about and there is not a grain in the darkness of the earth or anything green or dry which has not been recorded in a Clear Book.

Text1: Beware! whatever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He knows whatever you are doing. On the Day you shall return to Him, He will let you know what you have. done: He has full knowledge of everything.
Text2: There is not a single moving creature on the earth but Allah is responsible for providing its sustenance. He knows where it dwells and where it will permanently rest. All this is recorded in a clear Book.

Text1: Beware! whatever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He knows whatever you are doing. On the Day you shall return to Him, He will let you know what you have. done: He has full knowledge of everything.
Text2: And then the Record of their deeds shall be placed before them and you will see the guilty full of fear for what it contains, and will say: "Woe to us! What a Record this is! It leaves nothing, big or small, but encompasses it." They will find their deeds confronting them. Your Lord wrongs no one.

Text1: Beware! whatever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He knows whatever you are doing. On the Day you shall return to Him, He will let you know what you have. done: He has full knowledge of everything.
Text2: O Believers, do not consider the summoning by the Messenger like the summoning among you by one another. Allah knows well those of you who steal away, concealing themselves behind others. Let those who disobey the order of the Messenger beware lest they should be involved in some affliction, or are visited by a woeful scourge.

Text1: Beware! whatever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He knows whatever you are doing. On the Day you shall return to Him, He will let you know what you have. done: He has full knowledge of everything.
Text2: and observes your movements among those who prostrate themselves.

Text1: Beware! whatever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He knows whatever you are doing. On the Day you shall return to Him, He will let you know what you have. done: He has full knowledge of everything.
Text2: He is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

Text1: Beware! whatever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He knows whatever you are doing. On the Day you shall return to Him, He will let you know what you have. done: He has full knowledge of everything.
Text2: Allah has surely heard the words of her who contends with you concerning her husband and complains to Allah. Allah hears what both of you say. Verily Allah is All- Hearing, All-Seeing.

Text1: Highly blessed is He, Who has sent down Al-Furqan, to His servant so that it may be a warner to all mankind:
Text2: Holy is He Who carried His servant by night from the Holy Mosque (in Makkah) to the farther Mosque (in Jerusalem) whose surroundings We have blessed that We might show him some of Our Signs. Indeed He alone is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

Text1: Highly blessed is He, Who has sent down Al-Furqan, to His servant so that it may be a warner to all mankind:
Text2: an unerringly Straight Book, meant to warn of a stern punishment from Allah, and to proclaim, to those who believe and work righteous deeds, the tiding that theirs shall be a good reward

Text1: Highly blessed is He, Who has sent down Al-Furqan, to His servant so that it may be a warner to all mankind:
Text2: The disbelievers say, "Why has not the entire Qur'an been sent down to this man all at nce?" -Well, this has been done to impress it deeply on your mind, and (for the same object) We have sent it down piecemeal by degrees.

Text1: Highly blessed is He, Who has sent down Al-Furqan, to His servant so that it may be a warner to all mankind:
Text2: And (there is another wisdom in this: whenever they brought to you an odd thing (or a strange question), We sent its right answer to you in time and explained it all in the best manner,

Text1: Highly blessed is He, Who has sent down Al-Furqan, to His servant so that it may be a warner to all mankind:
Text2: and when Allah's servant stood up to call on Him, they well-nigh swarmed him.

Text1: Yet the people have set up, besides Him, deities, who do not create anything but are themselves created: who can neither harm nor help even themselves: who have no power over life or death, nor can they raise up the dead.
Text2: To create all of you or to resurrect all of you is to Him like (creating or resurrecting) a single person. Verily Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

Text1: Yet the people have set up, besides Him, deities, who do not create anything but are themselves created: who can neither harm nor help even themselves: who have no power over life or death, nor can they raise up the dead.
Text2: There will be a single stern rebuff and lo, they will be observing with their own eyes (all that they had been warned against).

Text1: Yet the people have set up, besides Him, deities, who do not create anything but are themselves created: who can neither harm nor help even themselves: who have no power over life or death, nor can they raise up the dead.
Text2: Our command consists of only one Word which is carried out in the twinkling of an eye.

Text1: Yet the people have set up, besides Him, deities, who do not create anything but are themselves created: who can neither harm nor help even themselves: who have no power over life or death, nor can they raise up the dead.
Text2: Surely they will need no more than a single stern blast,

Text1: Yet the people have set up, besides Him, deities, who do not create anything but are themselves created: who can neither harm nor help even themselves: who have no power over life or death, nor can they raise up the dead.
Text2: and lo, they will all be in the open plain.

Text1: They say, "These things are the writings of the ancients which he has got copied down for himself, and then these are recited to him in the morning and evening.''
Text2: Just see how strange are the things they invent about you. They have altogether strayed, and are unable to find the right way.

Text1: O Muhammad, say to them, "This has been sent down by Him, Who knows the secret of the heavens and the earth." The fact is that He is very Forgiving and Merciful.
Text2: Those who said: 'Allah is one of the Three', certainly they disbelieved, for there is no god save the One God. And if they do not give up this claim, all who have disbelieved among them shall be subjected to painful chastisement.

Text1: O Muhammad, say to them, "This has been sent down by Him, Who knows the secret of the heavens and the earth." The fact is that He is very Forgiving and Merciful.
Text2: Will they not, then, turn to Allah in repentance, and ask for His forgiveness? Allah is All-Forgiving, All-Compassionate.

Text1: O Muhammad, say to them, "This has been sent down by Him, Who knows the secret of the heavens and the earth." The fact is that He is very Forgiving and Merciful.
Text2: Surely those who tormented the believing men and the believing women and then did not repent, theirs shall be the chastisement of Hell, and theirs shall be the chastisement of burning.

Text1: (Then it will be said to them:) "Do not call for one death today, but call for many deaths."
Text2: Moses replied: "You know well that no one but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent these as eye-opening proofs. I truly think, O Pharaoh, that you are indeed doomed."

Text1: And on that Day (your Lord will gather these people together as well as their deities, whom they worship besides AIlah. Then He will ask them, "Did you mislead these servants of Mine, or did they themselves go astray?"
Text2: I said to them nothing except what You commanded me, that is: 'Serve Allah, my Lord and your Lord.' I watched over them as long as I remained among them; and when You did recall me, then You Yourself became the Watcher over them. Indeed, You are Witness over everything.

Text1: They will answer, "Glory be to Thee! We dared not take anyguardian besides Thee: (they were misled because) Thou didst give them and their forefathers all the good things of life till they forgot the Admonition, and incurred the punishment. "
Text2: And on the Day when He will muster them all and will ask the angels: _—“Are they the ones who worshipped you?_—ù

Text1: Thus will your gods deny alI that you are professing today. Then you shall neither be able to repel your punishment nor shall get any help from anywhere; and whoso is guilty. of iniquity'' among you, We shall make him taste a severe torment.
Text2: Who is farther strayed from the Right Path than he who calls upon others than Allah that cannot answer his call till the Day of Resurrection, the while they are not even conscious that callers are calling upon them?

Text1: O Muhammad,, all the Messengers whom We sent before you also ate food and moved about in the streets. In fact, We have made you all a means of test for one another. Will you show patience? for your Lord sees everything.
Text2: Whenever there comes to them a sign from Allah, they say: 'We will not believe until we are given what was given to the Messengers of Allah.' Allah knows best where to place His message. Soon shall these wicked ones meet with humiliation and severe chastigement from Allah for all their evil plotting.

Text1: O Muhammad,, all the Messengers whom We sent before you also ate food and moved about in the streets. In fact, We have made you all a means of test for one another. Will you show patience? for your Lord sees everything.
Text2: The Messengers whom We raised before you, (O Muhammad), and to whom We sent down revelations, were only human beings, and were from among those living in earthly habitations. Have these people not travelled in the earth that they may observe the end of their predecessors? Certainly the abode of the Hereafter is much better for those (who accepted the call of the Messengers and) acted in a God-fearing manner. Will you still not act with good sense?

Text1: Those people, who have no fear of coming before Us, say, "Why should not the angels be sent down to us? Or else we should see our Lord. " Great arrogance have they assumed in regard to themselves, and have transgressed all limits in their rebellion.
Text2: or cause the sky to fall on us in pieces as you claimed, or bring Allah and the angels before us, face to face;

Text1: The Day, when they will see the angels, will not be a day of rejoicing for the criminals; they will cry out, "May Allah save us!"
Text2: Thus, through a firm word, Allah grants firmness to the believers both in this world and in the Hereafter. As for the wrong-doers, Allah lets them go astray. Allah does whatever He wills.

Text1: The Day, when they will see the angels, will not be a day of rejoicing for the criminals; they will cry out, "May Allah save us!"
Text2: We are your companions in this world and in the Hereafter. There you shall have all that you desire and all what you will ask for.

Text1: The Day, when they will see the angels, will not be a day of rejoicing for the criminals; they will cry out, "May Allah save us!"
Text2: This is by way of hospitality from Him Who is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful._—ù

Text1: (On the contrary) only those who have deserved the Garden, will have a good abode on that Day and a cool place for midday rest.
Text2: it is an evil abode and an evil resting place":

Text1: (On the contrary) only those who have deserved the Garden, will have a good abode on that Day and a cool place for midday rest.
Text2: Then their return will be to the same blazing Hell.

Text1: (On the contrary) only those who have deserved the Garden, will have a good abode on that Day and a cool place for midday rest.
Text2: Whoever is given the Record in his right hand

Text1: (On the contrary) only those who have deserved the Garden, will have a good abode on that Day and a cool place for midday rest.
Text2: shall be called to an easy accounting,

Text1: On that Day, a cloud will appear rending the sky and the angels will be senthi down rank after rank.
Text2: on that Day shall that indubitable event come to pass;

Text1: The real Kingdom on that Day will belong only to the Merciful, and it will be a very hard Day for the disbelievers.
Text2: The Hour of the Great Terror shall not grieve them, and the angels shall receive them saying: "This is your Day which you had been promised."

Text1: The real Kingdom on that Day will belong only to the Merciful, and it will be a very hard Day for the disbelievers.
Text2: by which the angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in one Day the duration of which is fifty thousand years.

Text1: The real Kingdom on that Day will belong only to the Merciful, and it will be a very hard Day for the disbelievers.
Text2: When the Trumpet shall be sounded,

Text1: The unjust man will bite at his hand and say, "Would that I had stood by the Messenger!
Text2: They will say: _—“Our Lord, we obeyed our chiefs and our great ones, and they turned us away from the Right Way.

Text1: The unjust man will bite at his hand and say, "Would that I had stood by the Messenger!
Text2: Our Lord, mete out to them a double chastisement and lay upon them a mighty curse._—ù

Text1: O Muhammad, in this very way We have made the criminals the enemies of every Prophet, but your Lord suffices for you as your Guide and Helper.
Text2: So that the hearts of those who do not believe in the Life to Come might incline towards this attractive delusion, and that they may be well pleased with it and might acquire the evils that they are bent on acquiring.

Text1: O Muhammad, in this very way We have made the criminals the enemies of every Prophet, but your Lord suffices for you as your Guide and Helper.
Text2: The deniers of the Truth say: _—“Do not give ear to the Qur'an and cause interruption when it is recited; thus perhaps you will gain the upper hand._—ù

Text1: And (there is another wisdom in this: whenever they brought to you an odd thing (or a strange question), We sent its right answer to you in time and explained it all in the best manner,
Text2: We have revealed the Qur'an in parts that you may recite it to people slowly and with deliberation; and (for that reason) We have revealed it gradually (to suit particular occasions).

Text1: The same was the case with the people of Noah when they charged the Messenger with imposture: We drowned them and made them a sign of warning for entire mankind, and We have prepared a painful chastisement for the unjust.
Text2: Verily when the water rose to great heights, We bore you upon a floating vessel (i.e. the Ark)

Text1: The same was the case with the people of Noah when they charged the Messenger with imposture: We drowned them and made them a sign of warning for entire mankind, and We have prepared a painful chastisement for the unjust.
Text2: so that We might make it an instructive event for you, and retentive ears might preserve its memory.

Text1: Likewise were destroyed the `Ad and the Thamud and the people of the Rass, and many a generation in between.
Text2: Then, after them, We brought forth other generations.

Text1: We admonished each one of them by citing the examples (of those who were destroyed before them) and ultimately annihilated all of them.
Text2: Many a generation has been destroyed by Our command since Noah's time. Your Lord is well aware and fully observant of the sins of His servants.

Text1: Surely, these people have passed by that habitation on which was rained an evil rain: have they not seen its ruins? But they do not expect another life in the Hereafter.
Text2: The place (where this occurred) lies along a known route.

Text1: Surely, these people have passed by that habitation on which was rained an evil rain: have they not seen its ruins? But they do not expect another life in the Hereafter.
Text2: So We chastised them. The desolate locations of both communities lie on a well-known highway.

Text1: Surely, these people have passed by that habitation on which was rained an evil rain: have they not seen its ruins? But they do not expect another life in the Hereafter.
Text2: You pass by their desolate habitations in the morning

Text1: Surely, these people have passed by that habitation on which was rained an evil rain: have they not seen its ruins? But they do not expect another life in the Hereafter.
Text2: and at night. Do you still not understand?

Text1: Have you ever considered the case of the person who has made his lust his god? Can you take the responsibility of guiding such a one aright?
Text2: (How awful is the straying of the person) for whom his evil deed has been embellished so that it looks fair to him? The fact is that Allah causes whomsoever He will to fall into error and shows the Right Way to whomsoever He will. So, (O Prophet), let not your life go to waste sorrowing over them. Allah is well aware of all that they do.

Text1: Had We willed, We would have raised up a separate Warner in each habitation.
Text2: Ask them: 'Whose testimony is the greatest?' Say: 'Allah is the witness between me and you; and this Qur'an was revealed to me that I should warn you thereby and also whomsoever it may reach.' Do you indeed testify that there are other gods with Allah? Say: 'I shall never testify such a thing.' Say: 'He is the One God and I am altogether averse to all that you associate with Him in His divinity.'

Text1: Had We willed, We would have raised up a separate Warner in each habitation.
Text2: (Like that Book) this too is a Book which We have revealed; full of blessing, confirming what was revealed before it so that you might warn the people of the Mother of Cities (Makka) and those around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and are evermindful of their Prayers.

Text1: Had We willed, We would have raised up a separate Warner in each habitation.
Text2: [Say, O Muhammad]: 'O men! I am Allah's Messenger to you all - of Him to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. There is no god but He. He grants life and deals death. Have faith then, in Allah and in His Messenger, the ummi Prophet who believes in Allah and His words; and follow him so that you may be guided aright.'

Text1: Had We willed, We would have raised up a separate Warner in each habitation.
Text2: Can it happen that he who takes his stand on a clear evidence from his Lord, subsequently followed by a witness from Him (in his support), and prior to that the Book of Moses was revealed as a guide and a mercy, (would even he deny the truth in the manner of those who adore the life of this world)? Rather, such men are bound to believe in it. The Fire shall be the promised resort of the groups that disbelieve. So be in no doubt about it for this indeed is the truth from your Lord although most people do not believe.

Text1: And it is He, Who has let loose the two seas, one palatable and sweet, the other bitter and saltish, and there is a partition between them, which is an insurmountable barrier.
Text2: and yet there is a barrier between them which they may not overstep.

Text1: Tell them, "I do not ask of you any recompense for this work: I only ask of the one, who will, to adopt the way of his Lord.
Text2: for everyone of you who wishes to follow the Straight Way;

Text1: O Muhammad trust in that Allah Who is Ever-Living and will never die' Glorify Him with His praise, for He alone is sufficient to be aware of the sins of His servants.
Text2: O Messenger! Deliver what has been revealed to you from your Lord, for if you fail to do that, you have not fulfilled the task of His messengership. Allah will certainly protect you from the evil of men. Surely Allah will not guide the unbelievers (to succeed against you).

Text1: O Muhammad trust in that Allah Who is Ever-Living and will never die' Glorify Him with His praise, for He alone is sufficient to be aware of the sins of His servants.
Text2: He is the First and the Last, and the Manifest and the Hidden, and He has knowledge of everything.

Text1: In six days He created the earth and the heavens and all that is between them; then He established Himself on the "Throne" (of the Kingdom of the uriverse). (He is) the Merciful: as to His Glory, ask the one who knows.
Text2: Believers! Text2: (O Messenger!) Let it not happen that you omit (to expound) a portion of what was revealed to you. And do not be distressed that they will say: 'Why was a treasure not bestowed upon him?' or 'Why did no angel accompany him?' For you are merely a warner, whereas Allah has control over everything.

Text1: and to recite the Qur'an." So, whosoever is guided, his guidance will be to his own good. As for those who stray, tell them: "I am none but a warner."
Text2: (O Prophet), whether We make you see a part of the punishment that We have threatened them with come to pass during your life-time, or We take you away before that happens, your duty is no more than to convey the Message, and it is for Us to make a reckoning.

Text1: We recount to you with truth some parts of the story of Moses and Pharaoh for the benefit of those who believe.
Text2: (O Muhammad), by revealing the Qur'an to you We narrate to you in the best manner the stories of the past although before this narration you were utterly unaware of them.

Text1: Thus did We restore Moses to his mother that her eyes might be comforted and she might not grieve, and realise that the promise of Allah was true. But most people are unaware of this.
Text2: You have been enjoined to go to war, and you dislike it; it may be that you dislike a thing and the same is good for you, and you love a thing and the same is bad for you: Allah knows but you do not.

Text1: Thus did We restore Moses to his mother that her eyes might be comforted and she might not grieve, and realise that the promise of Allah was true. But most people are unaware of this.
Text2: Believers! It is not lawful for you to become heirs to women against their will. It is not lawful that you should put constraint upon them that you may take away anything of what you have given them; (you may not put constraint upon them) unless they are guilty of brazenly immoral conduct. Live with your wives in a good manner. If you dislike them in any manner, it may be that you dislike something in which Allah has placed much good for you.

Text1: Moses replied: "So that is agreed between me and you. Whichever of the two terms I fulfil, I trust that I shall not be wronged. Allah is a witness over the covenant we are committing ourselves to."
Text2: So pass these few appointed days in remembering Allah; then there is nothing wrong if one hastens on (from Mina) after two days or stays there (a day) longer, " provided that he spends these days it piety. Do not disobey Him and remember that One Day you shall be mustered before Him.

Text1: He received the command: "Throw away your rod!" But when he saw the rod writhing as though it were a serpent, he turned back in retreat, and did not even look behind. (He was told): "O Moses, go ahead and have no fear. You are perfectly secure.
Text2: And what is in your right hand, O Moses?"

Text1: He received the command: "Throw away your rod!" But when he saw the rod writhing as though it were a serpent, he turned back in retreat, and did not even look behind. (He was told): "O Moses, go ahead and have no fear. You are perfectly secure.
Text2: Moses answered: "This is my staff. I lean on it (when I walk), and with it I beat down leaves for my flock, and I have many other uses for it."

Text1: My brother Aaron is more eloquent in speech than I: so send him with me as a helper to confirm my truthfulness for I fear that they will reject me as a liar."
Text2: so that they may understand my speech;

Text1: My brother Aaron is more eloquent in speech than I: so send him with me as a helper to confirm my truthfulness for I fear that they will reject me as a liar."
Text2: Aaron, my brother.

Text1: My brother Aaron is more eloquent in speech than I: so send him with me as a helper to confirm my truthfulness for I fear that they will reject me as a liar."
Text2: Strengthen me through him

Text1: My brother Aaron is more eloquent in speech than I: so send him with me as a helper to confirm my truthfulness for I fear that they will reject me as a liar."
Text2: and let him share my task

Text1: He said: "We will certainly strengthen you through your brother and will invest both of you with such power that they shall not be able to hurt you. With the help of Our Signs the two of you and your followers will prevail."
Text2: O Messenger! Deliver what has been revealed to you from your Lord, for if you fail to do that, you have not fulfilled the task of His messengership. Allah will certainly protect you from the evil of men. Surely Allah will not guide the unbelievers (to succeed against you).

Text1: He said: "We will certainly strengthen you through your brother and will invest both of you with such power that they shall not be able to hurt you. With the help of Our Signs the two of you and your followers will prevail."
Text2: and out of Our mercy We appointed his brother Aaron, a Prophet (that he may assist him).

Text1: He said: "We will certainly strengthen you through your brother and will invest both of you with such power that they shall not be able to hurt you. With the help of Our Signs the two of you and your followers will prevail."
Text2: He said: "Moses, your petition is granted.

Text1: He said: "We will certainly strengthen you through your brother and will invest both of you with such power that they shall not be able to hurt you. With the help of Our Signs the two of you and your followers will prevail."
Text2: (This is Allah's Way) regarding those who deliver the Messages of Allah and who fear Him, and fear no one else than Allah. Allah is Sufficient as a Reckoner.

Text1: He said: "We will certainly strengthen you through your brother and will invest both of you with such power that they shall not be able to hurt you. With the help of Our Signs the two of you and your followers will prevail."
Text2: Believers, do not be like those who distressed Moses and then Allah declared him quit of the ill they spoke about him; and he had a high standing with Allah.

Text1: He said: "We will certainly strengthen you through your brother and will invest both of you with such power that they shall not be able to hurt you. With the help of Our Signs the two of you and your followers will prevail."
Text2: Surely We shall help Our Messengers and the believers in the life of this world and on the Day when witnesses will rise to testify,

Text1: He said: "We will certainly strengthen you through your brother and will invest both of you with such power that they shall not be able to hurt you. With the help of Our Signs the two of you and your followers will prevail."
Text2: the Day when the excuses offered by the wrong-doers shall not avail them. They shall be victims of the curse and a woeful abode.

Text1: He said: "We will certainly strengthen you through your brother and will invest both of you with such power that they shall not be able to hurt you. With the help of Our Signs the two of you and your followers will prevail."
Text2: Allah has written: _—“Surely I will prevail; I and My Messengers._—ù Verily Allah is Most Strong, Most Mighty.

Text1: Pharaoh said: "O nobles, I do not know that you have any god beside myself. Haman, bake bricks out of clay and build a lofty palace for me so that I may mount up and be able to observe the god of Moses, even though I believe that Moses is a liar."
Text2: Pharaoh said: "If you take any god other than me, I will certainly make you one of those (who are rotting) in prison."

Text1: Pharaoh said: "O nobles, I do not know that you have any god beside myself. Haman, bake bricks out of clay and build a lofty palace for me so that I may mount up and be able to observe the god of Moses, even though I believe that Moses is a liar."
Text2: He incited his people to levity and they obeyed him. Surely they were an iniquitous people.

Text1: Pharaoh said: "O nobles, I do not know that you have any god beside myself. Haman, bake bricks out of clay and build a lofty palace for me so that I may mount up and be able to observe the god of Moses, even though I believe that Moses is a liar."
Text2: and gathered his people and declared:

Text1: Pharaoh said: "O nobles, I do not know that you have any god beside myself. Haman, bake bricks out of clay and build a lofty palace for me so that I may mount up and be able to observe the god of Moses, even though I believe that Moses is a liar."
Text2: _—“I am the supreme lord of you all._—ù

Text1: Pharaoh said: "O nobles, I do not know that you have any god beside myself. Haman, bake bricks out of clay and build a lofty palace for me so that I may mount up and be able to observe the god of Moses, even though I believe that Moses is a liar."
Text2: Thereupon Allah seized him for the chastisement of the World to Come as well as of the present.

Text1: Pharaoh said: "O nobles, I do not know that you have any god beside myself. Haman, bake bricks out of clay and build a lofty palace for me so that I may mount up and be able to observe the god of Moses, even though I believe that Moses is a liar."
Text2: Surely there is a great lesson in it for whoever would fear (Allah).

Text1: And he and his hosts waxed arrogant in the land without any right, believing that they will never have to return to Us!
Text2: Then their Lord unloosed upon them the lash of chastisement.

Text1: And he and his hosts waxed arrogant in the land without any right, believing that they will never have to return to Us!
Text2: Truly your Lord is ever watchful.

Text1: And We made them leaders who invite people to the Fire. On the Day of Judgement they shall not find help from any quarter.
Text2: (O Prophet), how many are the cities that had greater power than your city that drove you out? We destroyed them and there was none to protect them.

Text1: We have made a curse to pursue them in this world, and on the Day of Judgement they shall be among the despised.
Text2: Pharaoh said: "And who is this Lord of the Universe?"

Text1: We have made a curse to pursue them in this world, and on the Day of Judgement they shall be among the despised.
Text2: Pharaoh said: "If you take any god other than me, I will certainly make you one of those (who are rotting) in prison."

Text1: We have made a curse to pursue them in this world, and on the Day of Judgement they shall be among the despised.
Text2: Pharaoh said: _—“Haman, build for me a lofty tower that I may scale the highways --

Text1: We have made a curse to pursue them in this world, and on the Day of Judgement they shall be among the despised.
Text2: the highways to the heavens -- and have a look at the God of Moses, although I am certain that Moses is a liar._—ù Thus Pharaoh's evil deed was made to seem fair to him, and he was barred from the Right Path. Pharaoh's guile only led him to his own perdition.

Text1: After We had destroyed the earlier generations We bestowed the Book on Moses - a source of enlightenment for people and a guidance and mercy -- that they may take heed.
Text2: Pharaoh and those before him and the people of the overturned habitations all engaged in the same great sin.

Text1: After We had destroyed the earlier generations We bestowed the Book on Moses - a source of enlightenment for people and a guidance and mercy -- that they may take heed.
Text2: They did not follow the Messenger of their Lord, and so He seized them with a severe grip.

Text1: (We did so) lest a calamity might seize them because of the misdeeds they committed whereafter they would say: "Our Lord, why did you not send a Messenger to us that we follow Your revelation and become among those who believe?"
Text2: (You may no longer) say now that the Book was revealed only to two groups of people before Us and that we had indeed been unaware of what they read.

Text1: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Then do bring a Book from Allah which is a better guide than either of them, and I will follow it! Do so if you are truthful!"
Text2: Surely We revealed the Torah, wherein there is guidance and light. Thereby did Prophets - who had submitted themselves (to Allah) - judge for the Judaized folk; and so did the scholars and jurists. They judged by the Book of Allah for they had been entrusted to keep it, and bear witness to it. So (O Jews!) do not fear men but fear Me, and do not barter away My signs for a trivial gain. Those who do not judge by what Allah has revealed are indeed the unbelievers.

Text1: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Then do bring a Book from Allah which is a better guide than either of them, and I will follow it! Do so if you are truthful!"
Text2: They did not form any proper estimate of Allah when they said: 'Allah has not revealed anything to any man.' Ask them: 'The Book which Moses brought as a light and guidance for men and which you keep in bits and scraps, some of which you disclose while the rest you conceal, even though through it you were taught that which neither you nor your forefathers knew -who was it who revealed it?' Say: 'Allah!'- and then leave them to sport with their argumentation.

Text1: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Then do bring a Book from Allah which is a better guide than either of them, and I will follow it! Do so if you are truthful!"
Text2: (Like that Book) this too is a Book which We have revealed; full of blessing, confirming what was revealed before it so that you might warn the people of the Mother of Cities (Makka) and those around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and are evermindful of their Prayers.

Text1: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Then do bring a Book from Allah which is a better guide than either of them, and I will follow it! Do so if you are truthful!"
Text2: Then We gave to Moses the Book, completing the benediction of Allah upon the one who acts righteously, spelling out everything clearly, a guidance and a mercy; so that they may believe in their meeting with their Lord.

Text1: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Then do bring a Book from Allah which is a better guide than either of them, and I will follow it! Do so if you are truthful!"
Text2: And likewise We revealed this (Book) - a blessed one. Follow it, then, and become God-fearing; you may be shown mercy.

Text1: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Then do bring a Book from Allah which is a better guide than either of them, and I will follow it! Do so if you are truthful!"
Text2: They said: _—“Our people, We have heard a Scripture revealed after Moses, verifying the Scriptures revealed before it; it guides to the Truth and to the Straight Way.

Text1: Those on whom We bestowed the Book before do believe in this (to wit, the Qur'an).
Text2: and say: "Glory be to our Lord. Surely the promise of our Lord was bound to be fulfilled."

Text1: (O Prophet), you cannot grant guidance to whom you please. It is Allah Who guides those whom He will. He knows best who are amenable to guidance.
Text2: And most of the people, howsoever you might so desire, are not going to believe.

Text1: And how many a town did We destroy whose inhabitants exulted on account of their affluence. These are their dwellings in which very few dwelt after them. Eventually it is We Who inherited them.
Text2: Most certainly a Messenger came to them from among them; but they rejected him, calling him a liar. Therefore chastisement seized them while they engaged in wrong-doing.

Text1: Your Lord would not destroy a town until He had sent to its centre a Messenger who would recite to them Our verses. Nor would We destroy any town unless its inhabitants were iniquitous.
Text2: Ask them: 'Whose testimony is the greatest?' Say: 'Allah is the witness between me and you; and this Qur'an was revealed to me that I should warn you thereby and also whomsoever it may reach.' Do you indeed testify that there are other gods with Allah? Say: 'I shall never testify such a thing.' Say: 'He is the One God and I am altogether averse to all that you associate with Him in His divinity.'

Text1: Your Lord would not destroy a town until He had sent to its centre a Messenger who would recite to them Our verses. Nor would We destroy any town unless its inhabitants were iniquitous.
Text2: Can it happen that he who takes his stand on a clear evidence from his Lord, subsequently followed by a witness from Him (in his support), and prior to that the Book of Moses was revealed as a guide and a mercy, (would even he deny the truth in the manner of those who adore the life of this world)? Rather, such men are bound to believe in it. The Fire shall be the promised resort of the groups that disbelieve. So be in no doubt about it for this indeed is the truth from your Lord although most people do not believe.

Text1: Your Lord would not destroy a town until He had sent to its centre a Messenger who would recite to them Our verses. Nor would We destroy any town unless its inhabitants were iniquitous.
Text2: He who follows the Right Way shall do so to his own advantage; and he who strays shall incur his own loss. No one shall bear another's burden. And never do We punish any people until We send a Messenger (to make the Truth distinct from falsehood).

Text1: Your Lord would not destroy a town until He had sent to its centre a Messenger who would recite to them Our verses. Nor would We destroy any town unless its inhabitants were iniquitous.
Text2: And thus did We reveal this Arabic Qur'an to you that you may warn the people of the Mother of Cities (to wit, Makkah) and those who dwell around it; and warn them of the Day of Gathering concerning which there is no doubt: whereon some will be in Paradise, and some in the Blazing Fire.

Text1: Whatever you have been given is a provision for the life of this world and its glitter. But that which is with Allah is better and more enduring. Do you not use your intellect?
Text2: No; but you prefer the present life,

Text1: Those against whom the Word will be realised will say: "Our Lord, these are the ones whom we led astray just as we ourselves strayed. We absolve ourselves before You of all blame. It was not us that they worshipped."
Text2: Then those who followed them will say, "Would that we were given another chance to return to the world: then we will disown them just as they have disowned us today." Thus will Allah bring before them the deeds they did in the world in such a manner as to make them wring their hands in regret but they shall be unable to come out of the Fire.

Text1: Those against whom the Word will be realised will say: "Our Lord, these are the ones whom we led astray just as we ourselves strayed. We absolve ourselves before You of all blame. It was not us that they worshipped."
Text2: They have taken other gods instead of Allah that they may be a source of strength for them.

Text1: He replied: "All this has been given to me on account of a certain knowledge that I have." Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him those who were stronger in might than he and were more numerous in multitude? The wicked are not asked about their acts of sin.
Text2: O people, a parable is set forth: pay heed to it. Those who call upon aught other than Allah shall never be able to create even a fly, even if all of them were to come together to do that. And if the fly were to snatch away anything from them, they would not be able to recover that from it. Powerless is the supplicant; and powerless is he to whom he supplicates.

Text1: But those endowed with true knowledge said: "Woe to you. The reward of Allah is best for those who believe and act righteously. But none except those who are patient shall attain to this."
Text2: No one knows what delights of the eyes are kept hidden for them as a reward for their deeds.

Text1: (O Prophet), surely He Who has ordained the Qur'an on you will bring you to the best end. Say to them: "My Lord knows best who has brought true guidance and who is in clear error."
Text2: The Day when Allah will gather together the Messengers and say: 'What answer were you given?' They will reply: 'We have no real knowledge of it. You alone fully know all that lies beyond the reach of human perception.

Text1: (O Prophet), surely He Who has ordained the Qur'an on you will bring you to the best end. Say to them: "My Lord knows best who has brought true guidance and who is in clear error."
Text2: So We shall call to account those to whom Messengers were sent, and We shall call to account the Messengers (to see how dutifully they conveyed the Message, and how people responded to it).

Text1: (O Prophet), surely He Who has ordained the Qur'an on you will bring you to the best end. Say to them: "My Lord knows best who has brought true guidance and who is in clear error."
Text2: The earth shall shine with the light of its Lord, and the Scroll (of deeds) shall be set in place, and the Prophets and all witnesses shall be brought, and judgement shall be justly passed among them, and they shall not be wronged;

Text1: (O Prophet), surely He Who has ordained the Qur'an on you will bring you to the best end. Say to them: "My Lord knows best who has brought true guidance and who is in clear error."
Text2: When the help comes from Allah, and victory (is granted),

Text1: (O Prophet), surely He Who has ordained the Qur'an on you will bring you to the best end. Say to them: "My Lord knows best who has brought true guidance and who is in clear error."
Text2: and you see people entering Allah's religion in multitudes,

Text1: (O Prophet), surely He Who has ordained the Qur'an on you will bring you to the best end. Say to them: "My Lord knows best who has brought true guidance and who is in clear error."
Text2: then extol the praise of your Lord and pray to Him for forgiveness. For He indeed is ever disposed to accept repentance.

Text1: Among people there are some who say: _—“We believe in Allah._—ù But when such a person is made to endure suffering in Allah's cause, he reckons the persecution he suffers at the hands of people as though it is a chastisement from Allah. But if victory comes from your Lord, the same person will say _—“We were with you._—ù Does Allah not know whatever is in the hearts of the people of the world?
Text2: Indeed you see those afflicted with the disease of hypocrisy race towards them, saying: 'We fear lest some misfortune overtakes us. And it may happen that Allah will either bring you a decisive victory or bring about something else from Himself? and then they will feel remorseful at their hypocrisy which they have kept concealed in their breasts -

Text1: The unbelievers say to the believers: _—“Follow our way and we will carry the burden of your sins._—ù (They say so even though) they are not going to carry any part of their sins. Surely they are lying.
Text2: although they shall be within sight of one another. The guilty one would fain ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his children,

Text1: We did indeed send Noah to his people and he lived among them a thousand years save fifty. Eventually the Flood overtook them while they were engaged in wrongdoing.
Text2: Surely those against whom the word of your Lord has been fulfilled will not believed

Text1: We did indeed send Noah to his people and he lived among them a thousand years save fifty. Eventually the Flood overtook them while they were engaged in wrongdoing.
Text2: even if they witness every single sign that might come to them until they are face to face with the painful chastisement,

Text1: Then We rescued Noah together with the people in the Ark and made it (that is, the Ark) a lesson for all people.
Text2: We created man out of the extract of clay,

Text1: Then We rescued Noah together with the people in the Ark and made it (that is, the Ark) a lesson for all people.
Text2: then We made him into a drop of life-germ, then We placed it in a safe depository,

Text1: Then We rescued Noah together with the people in the Ark and made it (that is, the Ark) a lesson for all people.
Text2: and then created for them other vessels like those on which they ride.

Text1: Then We rescued Noah together with the people in the Ark and made it (that is, the Ark) a lesson for all people.
Text2: Should We so wish, We can drown them, and there will be none to heed their cries of distress, nor will they be rescued.

Text1: Then We rescued Noah together with the people in the Ark and made it (that is, the Ark) a lesson for all people.
Text2: We have adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and have made them a means to drive away the satans. We have prepared for them the chastisement of the Blazing Fire.

Text1: Then We rescued Noah together with the people in the Ark and made it (that is, the Ark) a lesson for all people.
Text2: so that We might make it an instructive event for you, and retentive ears might preserve its memory.

Text1: Those that you worship instead of Allah are merely idols, and you are simply inventing lies (about them). Indeed those whom you worship beside Allah have no power to provide you with any sustenance. So seek your sustenance from Allah and serve only Him and give thanks to Him alone. It is to Him that you will be sent back.
Text2: You alone do we worship, and You alone do we turn for help

Text1: Say: _—“Go about the earth and see how He created for the first time, and then Allah will recreate life._—ù Surely, Allah has power over everything.
Text2: Soon shall We show them Our Signs on the horizons and in their own beings until it becomes clear to them that it is the Truth. Is it not enough that your Lord is a witness over everything?

Text1: The people (of Abraham) had no other answer than to say: _—“Kill him or burn him._—ù But Allah delivered him from the fire. There are many Signs in this for those who believe.
Text2: They had contrived an evil plan against him, but We abased them all.

Text1: and We bestowed upon him (offspring like) Isaac and Jacob, and bestowed prophethood and the Book on his descendants and granted him his reward in this world; he will certainly be among the righteous in the Hereafter.
Text2: Indeed Abraham was a whole community by himself, obedient to Allah, exclusively devoted to Him. And he was never one of those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity.

Text1: and We bestowed upon him (offspring like) Isaac and Jacob, and bestowed prophethood and the Book on his descendants and granted him his reward in this world; he will certainly be among the righteous in the Hereafter.
Text2: He rendered thanks to Allah for His bounties so that Allah chose him (for His favours) and directed him to the Right Way.

Text1: And We have left a vestige of it in that city as a Clear Sign for a people who use their reason.
Text2: You pass by their desolate habitations in the morning

Text1: And We have left a vestige of it in that city as a Clear Sign for a people who use their reason.
Text2: and at night. Do you still not understand?

Text1: And We sent to Midian their brother Shuayb. He said: _—“My people, serve Allah and look forward to the Last Day and do not go about the earth committing mischief._—ù
Text2: Indeed there is a good example for you in them; a good example for anyone who looks forward to Allah and the Last Day. As for him who turns away, Allah is All-Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.

Text1: Argue not with the People of the Book except in the fairest manner, unless it be those of them that are utterly unjust. Say to them: _—“We believe in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to you. One is our God and your God; and we are those who submit ourselves to Him._—ù
Text2: and speak to him gently, perhaps he may take heed or fear (Allah)."

Text1: Argue not with the People of the Book except in the fairest manner, unless it be those of them that are utterly unjust. Say to them: _—“We believe in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to you. One is our God and your God; and we are those who submit ourselves to Him._—ù
Text2: Indeed We sent Our Messengers with Clear Signs, and sent down with them the Book and the Balance that people may uphold justice.
