And We sent down iron, wherein there is awesome power and many benefits for people, so that Allah may know who, without even having seen Him, helps Him and His Messengers. Surely Allah is Most Strong, Most Mighty.

Text1: (O Prophet), you did not recite any Book before, nor did you write it down with your hand; for then the votaries of falsehood would have had a cause for doubt.
Text2: There is no animal that crawls on the earth, no bird that flies with its two wings, but are communities like you. We have neglected nothing in the Book (of decree). Then to their Lord will they all be mustered.

Text1: (O Prophet), you did not recite any Book before, nor did you write it down with your hand; for then the votaries of falsehood would have had a cause for doubt.
Text2: They say, "These things are the writings of the ancients which he has got copied down for himself, and then these are recited to him in the morning and evening.''

Text1: (O Prophet), you did not recite any Book before, nor did you write it down with your hand; for then the votaries of falsehood would have had a cause for doubt.
Text2: O Muhammad, say to them, "This has been sent down by Him, Who knows the secret of the heavens and the earth." The fact is that He is very Forgiving and Merciful.

Text1: But it is a set of Clear Signs in the hearts of those who have been endowed with knowledge. None except the utterly unjust will deny Our Signs.
Text2: Surely those against whom the word of your Lord has been fulfilled will not believed

Text1: But it is a set of Clear Signs in the hearts of those who have been endowed with knowledge. None except the utterly unjust will deny Our Signs.
Text2: even if they witness every single sign that might come to them until they are face to face with the painful chastisement,

Text1: But it is a set of Clear Signs in the hearts of those who have been endowed with knowledge. None except the utterly unjust will deny Our Signs.
Text2: We have made this Qur'an easy as a reminder. Is there, then, any who will take heed?

Text1: They say: _—“Why were Signs from his Lord not sent down upon him?_—ù Say: _—“The Signs are only with Allah. As for me, I am no more than a plain warner._—ù
Text2: O Prophet, you are not responsible for their guidance; Allah Himself shows guidance to anyone He pleases. And whatever wealth you spend in charity, it is for your own good. As you spend of your wealth to win Allah's pleasure, you will be given full reward for whatever you spend and you will not be deprived in the least of your rightful due.

Text1: They say: _—“Why were Signs from his Lord not sent down upon him?_—ù Say: _—“The Signs are only with Allah. As for me, I am no more than a plain warner._—ù
Text2: Nothing hindered Us from sending Our Signs except that the people of olden times rejected them as lies. We publicly sent the she-camel to the Thamud to open their eyes but they wronged her. We never send Our Signs except to cause people to fear.

Text1: They say: _—“Why were Signs from his Lord not sent down upon him?_—ù Say: _—“The Signs are only with Allah. As for me, I am no more than a plain warner._—ù
Text2: Had you seen them in the Cave it would have appeared to you that when the sun rose, it moved away from their Cave to the right; and when it set, it turned away from them to the left, while they remained in a spacious hollow in the Cave. This is one of the Signs of Allah. Whomsoever Allah guides, he alone is led aright; and whomsoever Allah lets go astray, you will find for him no guardian to direct him.

Text1: Does it not suffice for them (as a Sign) that We revealed to you the Book that is recited to them? Surely there is mercy and good counsel in it for those who believe.
Text2: Is it not a Sign to them - (to wit, the Makkans) - that the learned men of the Children of Israel know that?

Text1: They ask you to hasten in bringing chastisement upon them. Had there not been an appointed term for it, the chastisement would have already visited them; in fact it will come down upon them all of a sudden (at its appointed time) while they will not be aware of it.
Text2: And also recall when they said: 'O Allah! If this indeed be the truth from You, then rain down stones upon us from heaven, or bring upon us a painful chastisement.'

Text1: (They will become aware of it) the Day when the chastisement will overwhelm them from above and from under their feet, and He will say to them: _—“Taste now the consequence of the deeds that you used to commit._—ù
Text2: On the Day when they shall be thrust into Hell with a violent thrust (and shall be told):

Text1: (They will become aware of it) the Day when the chastisement will overwhelm them from above and from under their feet, and He will say to them: _—“Taste now the consequence of the deeds that you used to commit._—ù
Text2: _—“This is the Hell which you used to give the lie to._—ù

Text1: (They will become aware of it) the Day when the chastisement will overwhelm them from above and from under their feet, and He will say to them: _—“Taste now the consequence of the deeds that you used to commit._—ù
Text2: Is this, then, any feat of magic or are you unable to see?

Text1: (They will become aware of it) the Day when the chastisement will overwhelm them from above and from under their feet, and He will say to them: _—“Taste now the consequence of the deeds that you used to commit._—ù
Text2: Go now and burn in it. It is all the same whether you bear it patiently or do not bear it with patience. You are only being recompensed for your deeds._—ù

Text1: that they may be ungrateful for the rescue that We granted them, and that they may revel in the pleasures (of the present life). Soon they shall come to know.
Text2: Then Pharaoh's household picked him up (from the river) that he may be their adversary and be a cause of sorrow to them. Surely Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts erred (in their scheming).

Text1: Do they not see that We have given them a sanctuary of safety whereas people around them are being snatched away? So, do they believe in falsehood and ungratefully deny Allah's bounties?
Text2: Did you not see those who have exchanged Allah's favour with ingratitude to Him, causing their people to be cast in the abode of utter perdition

Text1: Do they not see that We have given them a sanctuary of safety whereas people around them are being snatched away? So, do they believe in falsehood and ungratefully deny Allah's bounties?
Text2: Since the Quraysh became accustomed,

Text1: Do they not see that We have given them a sanctuary of safety whereas people around them are being snatched away? So, do they believe in falsehood and ungratefully deny Allah's bounties?
Text2: accustomed to the journey of winter and summer,

Text1: Do they not see that We have given them a sanctuary of safety whereas people around them are being snatched away? So, do they believe in falsehood and ungratefully deny Allah's bounties?
Text2: therefore, let them worship the Lord of this House;

Text1: All power belongs to Allah both before and after. On that day will the believers rejoice
Text2: at the victory granted by Allah. He grants victory to whomsoever He pleases. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Compassionate.

Text1: All power belongs to Allah both before and after. On that day will the believers rejoice
Text2: This is Allah's promise and He does not go back on His promise. But most people do not know.

Text1: All power belongs to Allah both before and after. On that day will the believers rejoice
Text2: Of all men you will find the Jews and those who associate others with Allah in His divinity to be the most hostile to those who believe; and you will surely find that of ail people they who say: 'We are Christians', are closest to feeling affection for those who believe. This is because there are worshipful priests and monks among them, and because they are not arrogant.

Text1: All power belongs to Allah both before and after. On that day will the believers rejoice
Text2: And when they hear what has been revealed to the Messenger you see that their eyes overflow with tears because of the Truth that they recognize and they say: 'Our Lord! We do believe; write us down, therefore, with those who bear witness (to the Truth).

Text1: Evil was the end of those evil-doers, for they gave the lie to Allah's Signs and scoffed at them.
Text2: Therefore, judge bet-ween them (O Muhammad!) by what Allah has revealed and do not follow their desires, and beware lest they tempt you away from anything of what Allah has revealed to you. And if they turn away, then know well that Allah has indeed decided to afflict them for some of their sins. For surely many of them are transgressors.

Text1: Evil was the end of those evil-doers, for they gave the lie to Allah's Signs and scoffed at them.
Text2: We are turning their hearts and eyes away from the Truth even as they did not believe in the first instance - and We leave them in their insurgence to stumble blindly.

Text1: Evil was the end of those evil-doers, for they gave the lie to Allah's Signs and scoffed at them.
Text2: And call to mind when Moses said to his people: _—“O my people, why do you torment me when you know well that I am Allah's Messenger to you?_—ù So when they deviated, Allah made their hearts deviant. Allah does not direct the evil-doers to the Right Way.

Text1: His is all praise in the heavens and in the earth; (and glorify Him) in the afternoon and when the sun begins to decline.
Text2: and by the day as it displays the sun's glory,

Text1: His is all praise in the heavens and in the earth; (and glorify Him) in the afternoon and when the sun begins to decline.
Text2: and by the night as it envelopes the sun;

Text1: His is all praise in the heavens and in the earth; (and glorify Him) in the afternoon and when the sun begins to decline.
Text2: By the night when it enshrouds,

Text1: His is all praise in the heavens and in the earth; (and glorify Him) in the afternoon and when the sun begins to decline.
Text2: and by the day when it breaks in its glory,

Text1: His is all praise in the heavens and in the earth; (and glorify Him) in the afternoon and when the sun begins to decline.
Text2: By the bright forenoon,

Text1: His is all praise in the heavens and in the earth; (and glorify Him) in the afternoon and when the sun begins to decline.
Text2: and by the night when it covers the world with peace:

Text1: He brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living, and revives the earth after it is dead. Likewise will you be raised to life (after you die).
Text2: We made in it gardens of date-palms and vines, and We caused springs to gush forth

Text1: And of His Signs is that the sky and the earth stand firm by His command. Then no sooner than He summons you out of the earth you will come forth.
Text2: Surely they will need no more than a single stern blast,

Text1: And of His Signs is that the sky and the earth stand firm by His command. Then no sooner than He summons you out of the earth you will come forth.
Text2: and lo, they will all be in the open plain.

Text1: It is He Who creates in the first instance and it is He Who will repeat the creation, and that is easier for Him. His is the loftiest attribute in the heavens and the earth. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.
Text2: The Originator of the heavens and the earth, He has appointed for you pairs of your own kind, and pairs also of cattle. Thus does He multiply you. Naught in the universe is like Him. He is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

Text1: Whatever you pay as interest so that it may increase the wealth of people does not increase in the sight of Allah. As for the Zakah that you give, seeking with it Allah's good pleasure, that is multiplied manifold.
Text2: and bestow not favour in order to seek from others a greater return,

Text1: But if We were to send a wind and then their tilth has become yellow, they would never cease to disbelieve.
Text2: that left nothing that it came upon without reducing it to rubble.

Text1: But if We were to send a wind and then their tilth has become yellow, they would never cease to disbelieve.
Text2: Have you considered the seeds you till?

Text1: But if We were to send a wind and then their tilth has become yellow, they would never cease to disbelieve.
Text2: Is it you or We Who make them grow?

Text1: But if We were to send a wind and then their tilth has become yellow, they would never cease to disbelieve.
Text2: If We so wished, We could have reduced your harvest to rubble, and you would have been left wonder-struck to exclaim:

Text1: But if We were to send a wind and then their tilth has become yellow, they would never cease to disbelieve.
Text2: _—“We have been penalised;

Text1: But if We were to send a wind and then their tilth has become yellow, they would never cease to disbelieve.
Text2: nay; we have been undone!_—ù

Text1: In the Qur'an We have explained things to people in myriad ways. But no matter what Sign you bring to them, those who are resolved upon denying the Truth will say: _—“You are given to falsehood._—ù
Text2: even if they witness every single sign that might come to them until they are face to face with the painful chastisement,

Text1: a guidance and mercy for the doers of good,
Text2: Allah has revealed the best teaching, a self-consistent Book which repeats its contents in manifold forms whereat shiver the skins of those that hold their Lord in awe, and then their skins and their hearts soften for Allah's remembrance. That is Allah's Guidance wherewith He guides whosoever He pleases. And he whom Allah does not guide to the Right Path has none to guide him.

Text1: We enjoined upon man to be dutiful to his parents. His mother bore him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning lasted two years. (We, therefore, enjoined upon him): _—“Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is your ultimate return.
Text2: and be humble and tender to them and say: "Lord, show mercy to them as they nurtured me when I was small."

Text1: Do not (contemptuously) turn your face away from people, nor tread haughtily upon earth. Allah does not love the arrogant and the vainglorious.
Text2: And when Moses decided to lay his violent hands on the man belonging to the enemy, he cried out: "Moses, do you intend to kill me as you killed a person yesterday?" You simply want to live in the land as a tyrant, and do not wish to set things right."

Text1: We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.
Text2: Tell them (O Muhammad!): 'Indeed those who invent lies against Allah will never prosper.

Text1: If all the trees on earth become pens, and the sea replenished by seven more seas were to supply them with ink, the Words of Allah would not be exhausted. Verily Allah is Most Mighty, Most Wise.
Text2: They ask you about "the spirit". Say: "The spirit descends by the command of my Lord, but you have been given only a little knowledge."

Text1: To create all of you or to resurrect all of you is to Him like (creating or resurrecting) a single person. Verily Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
Text2: Surely they will need no more than a single stern blast,

Text1: To create all of you or to resurrect all of you is to Him like (creating or resurrecting) a single person. Verily Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
Text2: and lo, they will all be in the open plain.

Text1: Do you not see that Allah makes the night phase into the day and makes the day phase into the night and has subjected the sun and the moon to His will so that each of them is pursuing its course till an appointed time? (Do you not know that) Allah is well aware of all that you do?
Text2: Are you not aware that Allah knows all that is in the heaven and the earth? Surely it is all preserved in a Book. Indeed that is easy with Allah.

Text1: Do you not see that Allah makes the night phase into the day and makes the day phase into the night and has subjected the sun and the moon to His will so that each of them is pursuing its course till an appointed time? (Do you not know that) Allah is well aware of all that you do?
Text2: Allah it is He Who created seven heavens, and, like them, the earth. His commandment descends among them. (All this is being stated so that you know) that Allah has power over everything, and that Allah encompasses all things in His knowledge.

Text1: When waves engulf them (in the sea) like canopies, they call upon Allah, consecrating their faith solely to Him. But when He delivers them safely to the land, some of them become lukewarm. None denies Our Signs except the perfidious, the ungrateful.
Text2: Then We bequeathed the Book to those of Our servants that We chose. Now, some of them wrong themselves and some follow the medium course; and some, by Allah's leave, vie with each other in acts of goodness. That is the great bounty.

Text1: He governs from the heaven to the earth and then the record (of this governance) goes up to Him in a day whose measure is a thousand years in your reckoning.
Text2: Allah it is He Who created seven heavens, and, like them, the earth. His commandment descends among them. (All this is being stated so that you know) that Allah has power over everything, and that Allah encompasses all things in His knowledge.

Text1: Would that you could see the guilty standing before their Lord with their heads downcast, (saying to Him): _—“Our Lord, we have now seen and heard, so send us back (to the world) that we might act righteously. For now we have come to have firm faith._—ù
Text2: No! They will say this merely because the Truth which they had concealed will become obvious to them; or else if they were sent back, they would still revert to what was forbidden to them. (So this plea of theirs would be a lie too) for they are just liars.

Text1: Would that you could see the guilty standing before their Lord with their heads downcast, (saying to Him): _—“Our Lord, we have now seen and heard, so send us back (to the world) that we might act righteously. For now we have come to have firm faith._—ù
Text2: They say now: 'There is nothing but the life of this world, and we shall not be raised from the dead.'

Text1: Would that you could see the guilty standing before their Lord with their heads downcast, (saying to Him): _—“Our Lord, we have now seen and heard, so send us back (to the world) that we might act righteously. For now we have come to have firm faith._—ù
Text2: How well shall they hear and how well shall they see on the Day they come to Us! But today the evil-doers are in manifest error.

Text1: Would that you could see the guilty standing before their Lord with their heads downcast, (saying to Him): _—“Our Lord, we have now seen and heard, so send us back (to the world) that we might act righteously. For now we have come to have firm faith._—ù
Text2: They will say: 'If we had only listened and understood, we would not be among the inmates of the Blazing Fire.'_—ù

Text1: So taste the chastisement on account of your forgetting the encounter of this Day. We, too, have forgotten you. Taste the eternal chastisement as a requital for your misdeeds._—ù
Text2: they shall taste in it no coolness, nor any pleasant drink

Text1: So taste the chastisement on account of your forgetting the encounter of this Day. We, too, have forgotten you. Taste the eternal chastisement as a requital for your misdeeds._—ù
Text2: save boiling water and wash of the wounds;

Text1: So taste the chastisement on account of your forgetting the encounter of this Day. We, too, have forgotten you. Taste the eternal chastisement as a requital for your misdeeds._—ù
Text2: a befitting recompense for their deeds.

Text1: So taste the chastisement on account of your forgetting the encounter of this Day. We, too, have forgotten you. Taste the eternal chastisement as a requital for your misdeeds._—ù
Text2: For indeed they did not look forward to any reckoning,

Text1: So taste the chastisement on account of your forgetting the encounter of this Day. We, too, have forgotten you. Taste the eternal chastisement as a requital for your misdeeds._—ù
Text2: and roundly denied Our Signs as false.

Text1: So taste the chastisement on account of your forgetting the encounter of this Day. We, too, have forgotten you. Taste the eternal chastisement as a requital for your misdeeds._—ù
Text2: And everything have We recorded in a Book.

Text1: No one knows what delights of the eyes are kept hidden for them as a reward for their deeds.
Text2: Such are those from whom We accept their best deeds and whose evil deeds We overlook. They will be among the people of Paradise in consonance with the true promise made to them.

Text1: and when they remained steadfast and firmly believed in Our Signs, We created among them leaders who guided people by Our command.
Text2: Indeed We endowed the Children of Israel with the Book and Wisdom and Prophethood, and provided them with good things as sustenance, and exalted them above the peoples of the whole world.

Text1: and when they remained steadfast and firmly believed in Our Signs, We created among them leaders who guided people by Our command.
Text2: We gave them clear directions in matters pertaining to religion. Yet they differed among themselves (not out of ignorance but) after knowledge had come to them; and they did so out of the desire to commit excesses against one another. On the Day of Resurrection Allah will judge among them regarding what they had differed.

Text1: Did (these historical events) not make them realise that We destroyed many nations before them amidst whose dwellings they now move about? Surely there are many Signs in this. Are they unable to hear?
Text2: Those who had charged Shu'ayb with lying became as though-they had never lived there; it is they who became utter losers.

Text1: Did (these historical events) not make them realise that We destroyed many nations before them amidst whose dwellings they now move about? Surely there are many Signs in this. Are they unable to hear?
Text2: Have they not journeyed in the land that their hearts might understand and their ears might listen? For indeed it is not the eyes that are blinded; it is rather the hearts in the breasts that are rendered blind.

Text1: Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?
Text2: In the ultimate, We shall reduce all that is on the earth to a barren plain.

Text1: Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?
Text2: We made in it gardens of date-palms and vines, and We caused springs to gush forth

Text1: Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?
Text2: that they might eat of its fruits. It was not their hands that made them. Will they not, then, give thanks?

Text1: Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?
Text2: So let man just consider his food:

Text1: Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?
Text2: We poured water, pouring it in great abundance,

Text1: Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?
Text2: and cleaved the earth, cleaving it asunder;

Text1: Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?
Text2: then caused the grain to grow out of it,

Text1: Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?
Text2: together with grapes and vegetables,

Text1: Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?
Text2: and olives and palms,

Text1: Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?
Text2: and dense orchards,

Text1: Have they not seen that We drive water to the parched land, thereby bringing forth crops which they and their cattle eat? Are they unable to see?
Text2: and fruits and pastures _—–

Text1: Tell them: _—“If the unbelievers were to believe on the Day of Judgement that will not avail them. For then they will be granted no respite._—ù
Text2: And how are they behaving now towards a Book which has come to them from Allah? Inspite of the fact that it confirms the Scriptures which they already possessed. and, inspite of the fact that, before it came, they used to pray for a signal victory over the disbelievers, they rejected it when it came, although they recognized it. May Allah's curse be upon such disbelievers!

Text1: Tell them: _—“If the unbelievers were to believe on the Day of Judgement that will not avail them. For then they will be granted no respite._—ù
Text2: When their Messengers came to them with Clear Signs, they arrogantly exulted in whatever knowledge they had. They were then encompassed by what they had mocked.

Text1: So (leave them to themselves and) turn away from them and wait; they too are waiting.
Text2: Or do they say: _—“He is a poet for whom we await an adverse turn of fortune._—ù

Text1: Allah has never put two hearts within one person's body; nor has He made your wives, whom you compare to your mothers' backs (to divorce them), your true mothers; nor has He made those whom you adopt as sons your own sons. These are only words that you utter with your mouths. But Allah proclaims the Truth and directs you to the Right Path.
Text2: Those among you who divorce their wives by declaring them to be their mothers, such are not their mothers; none are their mothers except those who gave birth to them. Indeed what they say is highly contemptible and false. Verily Allah is Most Pardoning, Most Forgiving.

Text1: Call your adopted sons after their true fathers; that is more equitable in the sight of Allah. But if you do not know their true fathers, then regard them as your brethren in faith and as allies. You will not be taken to task for your mistaken utterances, but you will be taken to task for what you say deliberately. Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.
Text2: Forbidden to you are your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your father's sisters and your mother's sisters, your brother's daughters and your sister's daughters, your milk-mothers, your milk-sisters, the mothers of your wives, and the stepdaughters - who are your foster-children, born of your wives with whom you have consummated the marriage; but if you have not consummated the marriage with them, there will be no blame upon you (if you marry their daughters). It is also forbidden for you to take the wives of the sons who have sprung from your loins and to take two sisters together in marriage, although what is past is past. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, All-Compassionate.

Text1: Surely the Prophet has a greater claim over the believers than they have over each other, and his wives are their mothers. According to the Book of Allah, blood relatives have greater claim over each other than the rest of the believers and the Emigrants (in the cause of Allah), except that you may do some good to your allies (if you so wish). This is inscribed in the Book of Allah.
Text2: But no, by your Lord, they cannot become true be-lievers until they seek your arbitration in all matters on which they disagree among themselves, and then find not the least vexation in their hearts over what you have decided, and accept it in willing submission.

Text1: Surely the Prophet has a greater claim over the believers than they have over each other, and his wives are their mothers. According to the Book of Allah, blood relatives have greater claim over each other than the rest of the believers and the Emigrants (in the cause of Allah), except that you may do some good to your allies (if you so wish). This is inscribed in the Book of Allah.
Text2: Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but he is the Messenger of Allah and the seal of the Prophets. Allah has full knowledge of everything.

Text1: If the enemy were to enter the town from various directions, and they were summoned to act treacherously, they would have succumbed to it and would have shown little reluctance in doing so.
Text2: And when a section of them said: _—“(O people of Yathrib), now there is no place for you to stay, so turn back._—ù (And call to mind) when a section of them was seeking permission from the Prophet to leave, saying: _—“Our houses are exposed (to attack),_—ù although they were not exposed (to attack); they only wished to flee (from the battle-front).

Text1: (O Prophet), tell them: _—“If you run away from death or slaying, this flight will not avail you. You will have little time after that to enjoy (the pleasures of life)._—ù
Text2: Have you not seen those who were told: 'Restrain you hands, and establish the Prayer, and pay the Zakah'? But when fighting was enjoined upon them some of them feared men as one should fear Allah, or even more, and said: 'Our Lord, why have You ordained fighting for us? Why did You not grant us a little more respite?' Say to them: 'There is little enjoyment in this world. The World to Come is much better for the God-fearing. And you shall not be wronged even to the extent of the husk of a date-stone.

Text1: As for the true believers, when they saw the invading confederates, they cried out: _—“This is what Allah and His Messenger had promised us, and what Allah and His Messenger said was absolutely true._—ù This only increased their faith and submission.
Text2: Do you think that you will enter Paradise without undergoing such trials as were experienced by the believers before you? They met with adversity and affliction and were so shaken by trials that the Prophet of the time and his followers cried out: "When will Allah's help come"? (Then they were comforted with the good tidings): "Yes, Allah's help is near."

Text1: Among the believers there are those who have remained true to the covenant they made with Allah. Among those some of them have fulfilled their vow and others await the appointed time. They have not changed in the least.
Text2: And when a section of them said: _—“(O people of Yathrib), now there is no place for you to stay, so turn back._—ù (And call to mind) when a section of them was seeking permission from the Prophet to leave, saying: _—“Our houses are exposed (to attack),_—ù although they were not exposed (to attack); they only wished to flee (from the battle-front).

Text1: Among the believers there are those who have remained true to the covenant they made with Allah. Among those some of them have fulfilled their vow and others await the appointed time. They have not changed in the least.
Text2: They had earlier covenanted with Allah that they would not turn their backs in flight. And a covenant made with Allah must needs be answered for.

Text1: (All this is) in order that Allah may reward the truthful for their truthfulness, and either punish the hypocrites or, if He so wills, accept their repentance. Verily Allah is Most Pardoning, Most Compassionate.
Text2: Allah will not let the believers stay in the state they are: He will set the wicked apart from the good. Allah is not going to disclose to you what is hidden in the realm beyond the reach of perception, but He chooses from among His Messengers whom He wills (to intimate such knowledge). Believe, then, in Allah and in His Messengers; and if you believe and be come God-fearing, yours will be a great reward.

Text1: Allah brought down from their fortresses those People of the Book who had supported the invading confederates and cast such terror into their hearts that some of them you kill and some of them you take captive.
Text2: And how are they behaving now towards a Book which has come to them from Allah? Inspite of the fact that it confirms the Scriptures which they already possessed. and, inspite of the fact that, before it came, they used to pray for a signal victory over the disbelievers, they rejected it when it came, although they recognized it. May Allah's curse be upon such disbelievers!

Text1: Allah made you inherit their land, their dwellings, and their goods, and a piece of land on which you had not yet trodden. Verily Allah has power over all things.
Text2: Muhammad is Allah's Messenger, and those who are with him are firm with the unbelievers but compassionate with one another. You see them occupied in bowing and prostrating and in seeking Allah's bounty and good pleasure. They are distinguished from others by the marks of prostration on their faces. Thus are they described in the Torah. And their parable in the Gospel is that of a tilth that puts forth its shoot, then strengthens it so that it becomes stout and stands firmly on its stem. This is a sight pleasing to the sowers and one by which the unbelievers will be enraged. As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, Allah has promised them forgiveness and a great reward.

Text1: But if you seek Allah and His Messenger and the Abode of the Hereafter, then surely Allah has prepared a great reward for those of you who do good._—ù
Text2: (O Prophet), call to mind when you said to him whom Allah had favoured and you had favoured: _—“Cleave to your wife and fear Allah,_—ù and you concealed within yourself for fear of people what Allah was to reveal, although Allah has greater right that you fear Him. So when Zayd had accomplished what he would of her, We gave her in marriage to you so that there should not be any constraint for the believers regarding the wives of their adopted sons after they had accomplished whatever they would of them. And Allah's command was bound to be accomplished.

Text1: Wives of the Prophet, if any of you commit flagrant indecency, her chastisement shall be doubled. That is easy for Allah.
Text2: That is Allah's guidance wherewith He guides those of His servants whom He wills. But if they ever associated others with Allah in His divinity, then all that they had done would have gone to waste.

Text1: Wives of the Prophet, if any of you commit flagrant indecency, her chastisement shall be doubled. That is easy for Allah.
Text2: If Allah had wanted to take to Himself a son, He could have chosen anyone He wanted out of those whom He creates. Glory be to Him (that He should have a son). He is Allah: the One, the Overpowering.

Text1: Wives of the Prophet, if any of you commit flagrant indecency, her chastisement shall be doubled. That is easy for Allah.
Text2: (Tell them clearly that) it was revealed to you and to all Prophets before you: _—“If you associate any others with Allah in His Divinity, your works will surely come to naught and you will certainly be among the losers._—ù

Text1: Wives of the Prophet, if any of you commit flagrant indecency, her chastisement shall be doubled. That is easy for Allah.
Text2: Say: _—“If the Merciful One had a son, I would have been the first one to worship him._—ù

Text1: Surely the men who submit (to Allah) and the women who submit (to Allah), the men who have faith and the women who have faith, the men who are obedient and the women who are obedient, the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful; the men who are steadfast and the women who are steadfast, the men who humble themselves (to Allah) and the women who humble themselves (to Allah), the men who give alms and the women who give alms, the men who fast and the women who fast, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity, the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much: for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and a mighty reward.
Text2: Take great care of your Prayers, especially of a Prayer that has excellent qualities of Salat and stand before Allah like devoted servants.

Text1: Surely the men who submit (to Allah) and the women who submit (to Allah), the men who have faith and the women who have faith, the men who are obedient and the women who are obedient, the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful; the men who are steadfast and the women who are steadfast, the men who humble themselves (to Allah) and the women who humble themselves (to Allah), the men who give alms and the women who give alms, the men who fast and the women who fast, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity, the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much: for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and a mighty reward.
Text2: O Mary! Remain devout to your Lord, and prostrate yourself in worship, and bow with those who bow (before Him).'

Text1: Surely the men who submit (to Allah) and the women who submit (to Allah), the men who have faith and the women who have faith, the men who are obedient and the women who are obedient, the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful; the men who are steadfast and the women who are steadfast, the men who humble themselves (to Allah) and the women who humble themselves (to Allah), the men who give alms and the women who give alms, the men who fast and the women who fast, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity, the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much: for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and a mighty reward.
Text2: save from their wives, or those whom their right hands possess; for with regard to them they are free from blame "

Text1: Surely the men who submit (to Allah) and the women who submit (to Allah), the men who have faith and the women who have faith, the men who are obedient and the women who are obedient, the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful; the men who are steadfast and the women who are steadfast, the men who humble themselves (to Allah) and the women who humble themselves (to Allah), the men who give alms and the women who give alms, the men who fast and the women who fast, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity, the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much: for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and a mighty reward.
Text2: As for those who seek beyond that, they are transgressors"

Text1: Surely the men who submit (to Allah) and the women who submit (to Allah), the men who have faith and the women who have faith, the men who are obedient and the women who are obedient, the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful; the men who are steadfast and the women who are steadfast, the men who humble themselves (to Allah) and the women who humble themselves (to Allah), the men who give alms and the women who give alms, the men who fast and the women who fast, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity, the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much: for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and a mighty reward.
Text2: To Him belong all who are in the heavens and all who are on the earth. All are in obedience to Him.

Text1: Surely the men who submit (to Allah) and the women who submit (to Allah), the men who have faith and the women who have faith, the men who are obedient and the women who are obedient, the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful; the men who are steadfast and the women who are steadfast, the men who humble themselves (to Allah) and the women who humble themselves (to Allah), the men who give alms and the women who give alms, the men who fast and the women who fast, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity, the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much: for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and a mighty reward.
Text2: and glorify Him morning and evening.

Text1: Surely the men who submit (to Allah) and the women who submit (to Allah), the men who have faith and the women who have faith, the men who are obedient and the women who are obedient, the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful; the men who are steadfast and the women who are steadfast, the men who humble themselves (to Allah) and the women who humble themselves (to Allah), the men who give alms and the women who give alms, the men who fast and the women who fast, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity, the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much: for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and a mighty reward.
Text2: Is such a person (preferable or he) who is obedient, and prostrates himself in the watches of the night, stands (in Prayer), is fearful of the Hereafter, and looks forward to the mercy of His Lord? Ask them: _—“Are those who know equal to those who do not know?_—ù Only those endowed with understanding take heed.

Text1: Surely the men who submit (to Allah) and the women who submit (to Allah), the men who have faith and the women who have faith, the men who are obedient and the women who are obedient, the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful; the men who are steadfast and the women who are steadfast, the men who humble themselves (to Allah) and the women who humble themselves (to Allah), the men who give alms and the women who give alms, the men who fast and the women who fast, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity, the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much: for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and a mighty reward.
Text2: The Bedouins say: _—“We believe._—ù (O Prophet), say to them: _—“You do not believe; you should rather say: 'We have submitted'_—ù; for belief has not yet entered your hearts. If you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not diminish anything from the reward of any of your deeds. Surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

Text1: Surely the men who submit (to Allah) and the women who submit (to Allah), the men who have faith and the women who have faith, the men who are obedient and the women who are obedient, the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful; the men who are steadfast and the women who are steadfast, the men who humble themselves (to Allah) and the women who humble themselves (to Allah), the men who give alms and the women who give alms, the men who fast and the women who fast, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity, the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much: for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and a mighty reward.
Text2: So hold Allah in awe as much as you can, and listen and obey, and be charitable. This is for your own good. And whoever remains safe from his own greediness, it is such that will prosper.

Text1: It does not behove a believer, male or female, that when Allah and His Messenger have decided an affair they should exercise their choice. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has strayed to manifest error.
Text2: O Believers, do not consider the summoning by the Messenger like the summoning among you by one another. Allah knows well those of you who steal away, concealing themselves behind others. Let those who disobey the order of the Messenger beware lest they should be involved in some affliction, or are visited by a woeful scourge.

Text1: (O Prophet), call to mind when you said to him whom Allah had favoured and you had favoured: _—“Cleave to your wife and fear Allah,_—ù and you concealed within yourself for fear of people what Allah was to reveal, although Allah has greater right that you fear Him. So when Zayd had accomplished what he would of her, We gave her in marriage to you so that there should not be any constraint for the believers regarding the wives of their adopted sons after they had accomplished whatever they would of them. And Allah's command was bound to be accomplished.
Text2: Forbidden to you are your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your father's sisters and your mother's sisters, your brother's daughters and your sister's daughters, your milk-mothers, your milk-sisters, the mothers of your wives, and the stepdaughters - who are your foster-children, born of your wives with whom you have consummated the marriage; but if you have not consummated the marriage with them, there will be no blame upon you (if you marry their daughters). It is also forbidden for you to take the wives of the sons who have sprung from your loins and to take two sisters together in marriage, although what is past is past. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, All-Compassionate.

Text1: (O Prophet), call to mind when you said to him whom Allah had favoured and you had favoured: _—“Cleave to your wife and fear Allah,_—ù and you concealed within yourself for fear of people what Allah was to reveal, although Allah has greater right that you fear Him. So when Zayd had accomplished what he would of her, We gave her in marriage to you so that there should not be any constraint for the believers regarding the wives of their adopted sons after they had accomplished whatever they would of them. And Allah's command was bound to be accomplished.
Text2: Allah has never put two hearts within one person's body; nor has He made your wives, whom you compare to your mothers' backs (to divorce them), your true mothers; nor has He made those whom you adopt as sons your own sons. These are only words that you utter with your mouths. But Allah proclaims the Truth and directs you to the Right Path.

Text1: (O Prophet), call to mind when you said to him whom Allah had favoured and you had favoured: _—“Cleave to your wife and fear Allah,_—ù and you concealed within yourself for fear of people what Allah was to reveal, although Allah has greater right that you fear Him. So when Zayd had accomplished what he would of her, We gave her in marriage to you so that there should not be any constraint for the believers regarding the wives of their adopted sons after they had accomplished whatever they would of them. And Allah's command was bound to be accomplished.
Text2: Call your adopted sons after their true fathers; that is more equitable in the sight of Allah. But if you do not know their true fathers, then regard them as your brethren in faith and as allies. You will not be taken to task for your mistaken utterances, but you will be taken to task for what you say deliberately. Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

Text1: (O Prophet), call to mind when you said to him whom Allah had favoured and you had favoured: _—“Cleave to your wife and fear Allah,_—ù and you concealed within yourself for fear of people what Allah was to reveal, although Allah has greater right that you fear Him. So when Zayd had accomplished what he would of her, We gave her in marriage to you so that there should not be any constraint for the believers regarding the wives of their adopted sons after they had accomplished whatever they would of them. And Allah's command was bound to be accomplished.
Text2: Believers, enter not the houses of the Prophet without his permission, nor wait for a meal to be prepared; instead enter when you are invited to eat, and when you have had the meal, disperse. Do not linger in idle talk. That is hurtful to the Prophet but he does not express it out of shyness; but Allah is not ashamed of speaking out the Truth. And if you were to ask the wives of the Prophet for something, ask from behind a curtain. That is more apt for the cleanness of your hearts and theirs. It is not lawful for you to cause hurt to Allah's Messenger, nor to ever marry his wives after him. Surely that would be an enormous sin in Allah's sight.

Text1: Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but he is the Messenger of Allah and the seal of the Prophets. Allah has full knowledge of everything.
Text2: Whenever there comes to them a sign from Allah, they say: 'We will not believe until we are given what was given to the Messengers of Allah.' Allah knows best where to place His message. Soon shall these wicked ones meet with humiliation and severe chastigement from Allah for all their evil plotting.

Text1: Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but he is the Messenger of Allah and the seal of the Prophets. Allah has full knowledge of everything.
Text2: O people, shall I tell you on whom it is that satans descend?

Text1: Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but he is the Messenger of Allah and the seal of the Prophets. Allah has full knowledge of everything.
Text2: They descend on every forgerer steeped in sin,

Text1: and glorify Him morning and evening.
Text2: His is all praise in the heavens and in the earth; (and glorify Him) in the afternoon and when the sun begins to decline.

Text1: It is He Who lavishes His blessings on you and His angels invoke blessings on you that He may lead you out of darkness into light. He is Most Compassionate to the believers.
Text2: just as (you have found from this: that) We sent the Messenger to you from among you, who recites to you Our Revelations; who purifies your lives; who instructs you in the Book and in Wisdom and teaches you those things that you did not know.

Text1: It is He Who lavishes His blessings on you and His angels invoke blessings on you that He may lead you out of darkness into light. He is Most Compassionate to the believers.
Text2: So remember Me and I will remember you, and give thanks to Me and be not ungrateful.

Text1: It is He Who lavishes His blessings on you and His angels invoke blessings on you that He may lead you out of darkness into light. He is Most Compassionate to the believers.
Text2: Their Lord will bestow great blessings and mercy upon them; such are the people who are rightly guided.

Text1: It is He Who lavishes His blessings on you and His angels invoke blessings on you that He may lead you out of darkness into light. He is Most Compassionate to the believers.
Text2: Our Lord, admit them to the everlasting Gardens You have promised them and those of their fathers and spouses and progeny that were righteous. Surely You alone are Most Mighty, Most Wise;

Text1: It is He Who lavishes His blessings on you and His angels invoke blessings on you that He may lead you out of darkness into light. He is Most Compassionate to the believers.
Text2: and guard them against all ills. He whom You guard against ills on that Day, to him You have surely been Most Merciful. That is the great triumph._—ù

Text1: Believers, when you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, you may not require them to observe a waiting period that you might reckon against them. So make provision for them and release them in an honourable manner.
Text2: In case you fixed a dower for them and then divorced them before you touched them, you should pay half of the fixed dower. But there is no harm if the woman agrees to forego it or the man, in whose hands is the marriage tie, is generous enough (to pay the dower in full). And if you (men) act generously, it is akin to piety. Do not forget to show generosity in your dealings with one another for Allah sees what you do.

Text1: Thereafter women will not be lawful for you, and it will not be lawful for you to take other wives in place of them, even though their beauty might please you, unless they be those whom your right hand owns. Allah is watchful over everything.
Text2: If a woman fears either ill-treatment or aversion from her husband it is not wrong for the husband and wife to bring about reconciliation among themselves (by compromising on their rights), for settlement is better. Man's soul is always prone to selfishness, but if you do good and are God-fearing, then surely Allah is aware of the things you do.

Text1: Thereafter women will not be lawful for you, and it will not be lawful for you to take other wives in place of them, even though their beauty might please you, unless they be those whom your right hand owns. Allah is watchful over everything.
Text2: O Prophet, We have made lawful for you your wives whose bridal dues you have paid, and the slave-girls you possess from among the prisoners of war, and the daughters of your paternal uncles and paternal aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncles and maternal aunts who have migrated with you, and a believing woman who gives herself to the Prophet and whom he wants to take in marriage. (O Prophet), this privilege is yours alone to the exclusion of other believers. We know well what restrictions We have imposed upon them as regards their wives and those whom their right hands possess, (and have exempted you from those restrictions) that there may be no constraint upon you. Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

Text1: Thereafter women will not be lawful for you, and it will not be lawful for you to take other wives in place of them, even though their beauty might please you, unless they be those whom your right hand owns. Allah is watchful over everything.
Text2: Of them you may put off any of them you wish, and you may take any of them whom you wish, and you may call back any of those whom you had (temporarily) set aside: there will be no blame on you (on this account). It is likelier that they will thus be comforted, and will not grieve, and every one of them will be well-pleased with what you give them. Allah knows what is in your hearts. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Forbearing.

Text1: Believers, enter not the houses of the Prophet without his permission, nor wait for a meal to be prepared; instead enter when you are invited to eat, and when you have had the meal, disperse. Do not linger in idle talk. That is hurtful to the Prophet but he does not express it out of shyness; but Allah is not ashamed of speaking out the Truth. And if you were to ask the wives of the Prophet for something, ask from behind a curtain. That is more apt for the cleanness of your hearts and theirs. It is not lawful for you to cause hurt to Allah's Messenger, nor to ever marry his wives after him. Surely that would be an enormous sin in Allah's sight.
Text2: (O Prophet), call to mind when you said to him whom Allah had favoured and you had favoured: _—“Cleave to your wife and fear Allah,_—ù and you concealed within yourself for fear of people what Allah was to reveal, although Allah has greater right that you fear Him. So when Zayd had accomplished what he would of her, We gave her in marriage to you so that there should not be any constraint for the believers regarding the wives of their adopted sons after they had accomplished whatever they would of them. And Allah's command was bound to be accomplished.

Text1: Believers, enter not the houses of the Prophet without his permission, nor wait for a meal to be prepared; instead enter when you are invited to eat, and when you have had the meal, disperse. Do not linger in idle talk. That is hurtful to the Prophet but he does not express it out of shyness; but Allah is not ashamed of speaking out the Truth. And if you were to ask the wives of the Prophet for something, ask from behind a curtain. That is more apt for the cleanness of your hearts and theirs. It is not lawful for you to cause hurt to Allah's Messenger, nor to ever marry his wives after him. Surely that would be an enormous sin in Allah's sight.
Text2: Maybe if he were to divorce you, your Lord might grant him in exchange wives better than you _—– those who truly submit to Allah, are full of faith, obedient, disposed to repentance, and given to worship and fasting _—– both previously wedded ones and virgins.

Text1: (It does not matter) whether you disclose something or conceal it, for Allah certainly knows everything.
Text2: He knows even the most stealthy glance of the eyes and all the secrets that hearts conceal.

Text1: Allah and His angels bless the Prophet. Believers, invoke blessings and peace on him.
Text2: Believers, remember Allah much

Text1: Allah and His angels bless the Prophet. Believers, invoke blessings and peace on him.
Text2: and glorify Him morning and evening.

Text1: Allah and His angels bless the Prophet. Believers, invoke blessings and peace on him.
Text2: And did We not exalt your fame?

Text1: On that Day when their faces shall be turned around in the Fire, they will say: _—“Would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger._—ù
Text2: For it was he, who had deluded me to reject the Admonition which had come to me. Satan has proved very treacherous to man. "

Text1: Believers, do not be like those who distressed Moses and then Allah declared him quit of the ill they spoke about him; and he had a high standing with Allah.
Text2: and out of Our mercy We appointed his brother Aaron, a Prophet (that he may assist him).

Text1: As for those who worked against Our Signs in order to frustrate them, they shall suffer a painful chastisement.
Text2: Shall We then treat alike those that believe and act righteously and those that create mischief on earth? Or treat alike the God-fearing and the wicked?

Text1: As for those who worked against Our Signs in order to frustrate them, they shall suffer a painful chastisement.
Text2: Those destined for the Fire and those destined for Paradise cannot be alike. Verily it is those destined for Paradise who shall triumph.

Text1: (O Prophet), those who have knowledge see clearly that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the Truth and directs to the Way of the Most Mighty, the Immensely Praiseworthy Lord.
Text2: But those who had been endowed with knowledge and faith shall say: _—“According to Allah's Record you have stayed till the Day of Resurrection. Now, this is the Day of Resurrection. But you did not know._—ù

Text1: (O Prophet), those who have knowledge see clearly that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the Truth and directs to the Way of the Most Mighty, the Immensely Praiseworthy Lord.
Text2: (nervously) exclaiming. _—“Alas for us! Who roused us out of our sleeping-place?_—ù _—“This is what the Merciful One had promised, and what (His) Messengers had said was true._—ù

Text1: Do they not see how the heavens and the earth encompass them from the front and the rear? We could, if We so wished, cause the earth to swallow them or let fragments of the sky fall upon them. Verily there is a Sign in this for every servant (of Allah) who penitently turns to Him.
Text2: Has He Who created the heavens and the earth no power to create the likes of them? Yes, indeed, He is the Superb Creator.

Text1: Do they not see how the heavens and the earth encompass them from the front and the rear? We could, if We so wished, cause the earth to swallow them or let fragments of the sky fall upon them. Verily there is a Sign in this for every servant (of Allah) who penitently turns to Him.
Text2: Surely the creation of the heavens and the earth is a greater act than the creation of human beings. But most people do not know.

Text1: Do they not see how the heavens and the earth encompass them from the front and the rear? We could, if We so wished, cause the earth to swallow them or let fragments of the sky fall upon them. Verily there is a Sign in this for every servant (of Allah) who penitently turns to Him.
Text2: And heaven _—– We made it with Our Own Power and We have the Power to do so.

Text1: Do they not see how the heavens and the earth encompass them from the front and the rear? We could, if We so wished, cause the earth to swallow them or let fragments of the sky fall upon them. Verily there is a Sign in this for every servant (of Allah) who penitently turns to Him.
Text2: And the earth _—– We spread it out, and how well have We smoothed it!

Text1: But they turned away and so We let loose upon them a devastating flood that swept away the dams and replaced their gardens by two others bearing bitter fruits, tamarisks, and a few lote trees.
Text2: Not before long the hoopoe came up and said: "I have obtained a knowledge which you could not. I have brought for you sure news about Sheba.

Text1: But they turned away and so We let loose upon them a devastating flood that swept away the dams and replaced their gardens by two others bearing bitter fruits, tamarisks, and a few lote trees.
Text2: I found there a woman ruling over them, one who has been endowed with all things and has a mighty throne.

Text1: But they turned away and so We let loose upon them a devastating flood that swept away the dams and replaced their gardens by two others bearing bitter fruits, tamarisks, and a few lote trees.
Text2: I found that she and her people prostrate themselves before the sun rather than Allah. " Satan has made their deeds appear attractive to them and has, thus, debarred them from the Right Path so they do not find true guidance

Text1: But they said: _—“Lord, make the stages of our journeys longer._—ù They wronged their own selves so We reduced them to bygone tales, and utterly tore them to pieces. Verily there are Signs in this for everyone who is steadfast and thankful.
Text2: Remember: You grumbled: "O Moses, we cannot endure one and the same sort of food. Pray your Lord to bring for us the products of the earth green herbs, vegetables, corn, garlic, onions, pulses and the like." Moses replied: "What! would you exchange that which is meaner for that which is nobler? Well, go and live in a town and you will get there what you demand." By and by, they became so degraded that disgrace and humiliation, misery and wretchedness were stamped upon them and they incurred Allah's wrath. That was because they began to reject the Revelations of Allah and kill His Messengers without any just cause; that was the consequence of their disobedience and their persistent transgression against the Law.

Text1: But they said: _—“Lord, make the stages of our journeys longer._—ù They wronged their own selves so We reduced them to bygone tales, and utterly tore them to pieces. Verily there are Signs in this for everyone who is steadfast and thankful.
Text2: For Sheba there was also a Sign in their dwelling place: the two gardens to the right and to the left. _—“Eat of your Lord's provision, and render thanks to Him. Most pleasant is your land and Most Forgiving is your Lord._—ù

Text1: But they said: _—“Lord, make the stages of our journeys longer._—ù They wronged their own selves so We reduced them to bygone tales, and utterly tore them to pieces. Verily there are Signs in this for everyone who is steadfast and thankful.
Text2: But they turned away and so We let loose upon them a devastating flood that swept away the dams and replaced their gardens by two others bearing bitter fruits, tamarisks, and a few lote trees.

Text1: Iblis found his estimate of them to be true, and they followed him, except a party of the believers.
Text2: Then I will come upon them from the front and from the rear, and from their right and from their left. And You will not find most of them thankful.'

Text1: Iblis found his estimate of them to be true, and they followed him, except a party of the believers.
Text2: He then continued: "Look! This is he whom You have exalted above me! If you will grant me respite till the Day of Resurrection I shall uproot the whole of his progeny except only a few."

Text1: Tell them: _—“You will not be called to account about the guilt we committed, nor will we be called to account for what you did._—ù
Text2: And if they reject you as false, tell them: 'My deeds are for myself and your deeds for yourselves. You will not be held responsible for my deeds, nor I for your deeds.

Text1: Tell them: _—“You will not be called to account about the guilt we committed, nor will we be called to account for what you did._—ù
Text2: Say: _—“O unbelievers!_—ù

Text1: Tell them: _—“You will not be called to account about the guilt we committed, nor will we be called to account for what you did._—ù
Text2: I do not worship those that you worship

Text1: Tell them: _—“You will not be called to account about the guilt we committed, nor will we be called to account for what you did._—ù
Text2: neither do you worship Him Whom I worship;

Text1: Tell them: _—“You will not be called to account about the guilt we committed, nor will we be called to account for what you did._—ù
Text2: nor will I worship those whom you have worshipped;

Text1: Tell them: _—“You will not be called to account about the guilt we committed, nor will we be called to account for what you did._—ù
Text2: nor are you going to worship Him Whom I worship.

Text1: Tell them: _—“You will not be called to account about the guilt we committed, nor will we be called to account for what you did._—ù
Text2: To you is your religion, and to me, my religion.

Text1: Say: _—“Our Lord will bring us together and then He will rightly judge between us. He is the Great Judge, the All-Knowing._—ù
Text2: On that Day when the Hour will come to pass, people will be split into groups.

Text1: Say: _—“Our Lord will bring us together and then He will rightly judge between us. He is the Great Judge, the All-Knowing._—ù
Text2: Then those who believed and acted righteously will be placed in a Garden and will be happy and jubilant.

Text1: Say: _—“Our Lord will bring us together and then He will rightly judge between us. He is the Great Judge, the All-Knowing._—ù
Text2: As for those who disbelieved and gave the lie to Our Signs and to the encounter of the Hereafter, they will be arraigned for chastisement.

Text1: (O Prophet), We have not sent you forth but as a herald of good news and a warner for all mankind. But most people do not know.
Text2: Never have We sent a Messenger but he has addressed his people in their language that he may fully expound his Message to them. (And after the Message is expounded), Allah lets go astray whomsoever He wills, and guides to the Right Way whomsoever He wills. He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

Text1: Say: _—“Your day is appointed, you can neither hold back its coming by an hour, nor hasten it by an hour._—ù
Text2: Nor shall We withhold it except till an appointed term.

Text1: Say: _—“Your day is appointed, you can neither hold back its coming by an hour, nor hasten it by an hour._—ù
Text2: And when the appointed Day comes, no one shall even dare to speak except by the leave of Allah. Then some will be declared wretched, others blessed.

Text1: Say: _—“Your day is appointed, you can neither hold back its coming by an hour, nor hasten it by an hour._—ù
Text2: He will forgive your sins and will grant you respite until an appointed term. Indeed when Allah's appointed term comes, it cannot be deferred; if you only knew!_—ù

Text1: We never sent a warner to any town but its wealthy ones said: _—“We disbelieve in the Message you have brought._—ù
Text2: Thus We have made some of them a means for testing others so that they should say: 'Are these theones among us upon whom Allah has bestowed His favour?' Yes, does Allah not know well who are the thankful?

Text1: We never sent a warner to any town but its wealthy ones said: _—“We disbelieve in the Message you have brought._—ù
Text2: The haughty elders of his people said to those believers who had been oppressed: 'Do you know that Salih is one sent forth with a message from his Lord?' They, replied: 'Surely we believe in the message with which he has been sent.'

Text1: We never sent a warner to any town but its wealthy ones said: _—“We disbelieve in the Message you have brought._—ù
Text2: The haughty ones remarked. 'Most certainly we disbelieve in that which you believe.'

Text1: We never sent a warner to any town but its wealthy ones said: _—“We disbelieve in the Message you have brought._—ù
Text2: The notables among Noah's own people, who had refused to follow him, responded: 'We merely consider you a human being like ourselves. Nor do we find among those who follow you except the lowliest of our folk, the men who follow you without any proper reason. We see nothing in you to suggest that you are any better than us. Rather, we believe you to be liars.'

Text1: We never sent a warner to any town but its wealthy ones said: _—“We disbelieve in the Message you have brought._—ù
Text2: They answered: "Shall we accept you even though it is the meanest of people who follow you?"

Text1: They always said: _—“We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised._—ù
Text2: Do they fancy that Our continuing to give them wealth and children (means) that

Text1: They always said: _—“We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised._—ù
Text2: We are busy lavishing on them all kinds of good? Nay, they do not perceive the reality of the matter.

Text1: They always said: _—“We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised._—ù
Text2: Leave Me with him whom I alone have created,

Text1: They always said: _—“We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised._—ù
Text2: whom I have endowed with abundant riches,

Text1: They always said: _—“We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised._—ù
Text2: and sons ever present with him,

Text1: They always said: _—“We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised._—ù
Text2: and for whom I have smoothed the way (to power and riches),

Text1: They always said: _—“We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised._—ù
Text2: and who still greedily desires that I should bestow upon him more.

Text1: They always said: _—“We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised._—ù
Text2: By no means; he is stubbornly opposed to Our Signs.

Text1: They always said: _—“We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised._—ù
Text2: I shall soon constrain him to a hard ascent.

Text1: Say, (O Prophet): _—“Verily, my Lord grants provision abundantly to whomsoever He pleases and straitens it for whomsoever He pleases. Whatever you spend, He will replace it. He is the Best of all Providers._—ù
Text2: See, how We have exalted some above others in this world, and in the Life to Come they will have higher ranks and greater degrees of excellence over others.

Text1: And on the Day when He will muster them all and will ask the angels: _—“Are they the ones who worshipped you?_—ù
Text2: And imagine when thereafter Allah will say: 'Jesus, son of Mary, did you say to people: "Take me and my mother for gods beside Allah?" and he will answer: "Glory to You! It was not for me to say what I had no right to. Had I said so, You would surely have known it. You know all what is within my mind whereas I do not know what is within Yours. You, indeed You, know fully all that is beyond the reach of human perception.

Text1: They will reply: _—“Glory to You! You are our Protector, not they. Nay, they rather used to worship the jinn. Most of them believe in them._—ù
Text2: Rather than call upon Him, they call upon goddesses, and call upon a rebellious Satan

Text1: Those who went before them also denounced (Allah's Messengers) as liars. They have not attained even a tenth of what We had given them. But when they rejected My Messengers, calling them liars, how terrible was My chastisement!
Text2: Did they not journey in the land that they may behold the end of those who had gone before them? They were more numerous and greater in strength and left behind more splendid traces in the land. Yet their attainments did not avail them.

Text1: Those who went before them also denounced (Allah's Messengers) as liars. They have not attained even a tenth of what We had given them. But when they rejected My Messengers, calling them liars, how terrible was My chastisement!
Text2: We had established them firmly in a manner We have not established you. We had given them ears and eyes and hearts. But nothing availed them -- neither their ears, nor their eyes, nor their hearts, for they denied the Signs of Allah. Then what they had mocked at encompassed them.

Text1: Say to them, (O Prophet): _—“I give you but one counsel: stand up (for heaven's sake), singly and in pairs, and then think: what is it in your companion (to wit, Muhammad) that could be deemed as madness?_—ù He is nothing but a warner, warning you before the coming of a grevious chastisement.
Text2: and warn your nearest kinsmen;

Text1: Say to them, (O Prophet): _—“I give you but one counsel: stand up (for heaven's sake), singly and in pairs, and then think: what is it in your companion (to wit, Muhammad) that could be deemed as madness?_—ù He is nothing but a warner, warning you before the coming of a grevious chastisement.
Text2: Destroyed were the hands of Abu Lahab, and he lay utterly doomed.

Text1: Say to them: _—“My Lord hurls down the Truth (upon me). He knows fully all that lies beyond the range of perception._—ù
Text2: Exalted in Rank, Lord of the Throne: He causes the spirit to descend on whomsoever of His servants He pleases so as to warn them of the Day of Encounter;

Text1: If you could only see when the unbelievers will go about in a state of terror. They will have no escape and will be seized from a place near at hand.
Text2: Would that you could see the guilty standing before their Lord with their heads downcast, (saying to Him): _—“Our Lord, we have now seen and heard, so send us back (to the world) that we might act righteously. For now we have come to have firm faith._—ù

Text1: They disbelieved in it before and indulged in conjectures from far away.
Text2: Some will say concerning them: "They were three and their dog, the fourth"; and some will say: "They were five, and their dog, the sixth" -- all this being merely guesswork; and still others will say: "They were seven, and their dog, the eighth." Say: "My Lord knows their number best. Only a few know their correct number. So do not dispute concerning their number, but stick to what is evident, and do not question anyone about them."

Text1: They disbelieved in it before and indulged in conjectures from far away.
Text2: And when it was said to them: _—“Surely Allah's promise is true, and there is no doubt regarding the Hour of Resurrection,_—ù you were wont to say: _—“We do not know what the Hour (of Resurrection) is. We are simply making conjectures and are not at all certain._—ù

Text1: A barrier will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done with the likes of them before. Surely they were in a disquieting doubt.
Text2: When they saw Our chastisement, they said: _—“We have come to believe in Allah, the Only One, and we reject all what we had associated (with Allah in His Divinity)._—ù

Text1: A barrier will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done with the likes of them before. Surely they were in a disquieting doubt.
Text2: But their believing after they had seen Our chastisement did not avail them. That has been Allah's Way concerning His servants. And the unbelievers courted utter loss, then and there.

Text1: Whatever Mercy Allah accords to people, none can withhold; and whatever He withholds, no other will be able to release after Him. He is Most Mighty, Most Wise.
Text2: If Allah afflicts you with any hardship, none other than He can remove it; and if He wills any good for you, none can avert His bounty. He bestows good upon whomsoever of His servants He wills. He is AllForgiving, All-Merciful.'

Text1: O people, assuredly Allah's promise is true. So let the life of the world not delude you, and let not the Deluder delude you concerning Allah.
Text2: On that Day the hypocrites, both men and women, shall say to the believers: _—“Look at us that we may extract some light from your light._—ù They will be told: _—“Go back and seek light for yourselves elsewhere._—ù Then a wall shall be erected between them with a door in it. On the inside of it there will be mercy, and on the outside of it there will be chastisement.

Text1: He who seeks glory, let him know that all glory belongs to Allah alone. To Him do good words go up, and righteous action uplifts them. But those who contrive evil deeds, a severe punishment lies in store for them, and their contriving will come to naught.
Text2: Behold, the hypocrites seek to deceive Allah, but it is they who are being deluded by Him. When they rise to Prayer, they rise reluctantly, and only to be seen by men. They remember Allah but little.

Text1: Allah created you from dust, then from a drop of sperm, then He made you into pairs. No female conceives, nor delivers (a child) except with His knowledge. None is given a long life nor is any diminished in his life but it is written in a Book. Surely that is quite easy for Allah.
Text2: He knows both what is hidden and what is manifest. He is the Supreme One, the Most High.

Text1: The two masses of water are not alike. The one is sweet, sates thirst, and is pleasant to drink from, while the other is salt, bitter on the tongue. Yet from both you eat fresh meat, and extract from it ornaments that you wear; and you see ships cruising through it that you may seek of His Bounty and be thankful to Him.
Text2: From these seas come forth pearls and coral.

Text1: If you call upon them, they cannot hear your prayer. And if they hear it, they cannot answer it. On the Day of Resurrection they will disown you for associating others with Allah in His Divinity. No one can inform you of the truth save the All-Aware.
Text2: They have taken other gods instead of Allah that they may be a source of strength for them.

Text1: No one can bear another's burden. If a heavily laden one should call another to carry his load, none of it shall be carried by the other, even though he be a near of kin. (O Prophet), you can warn only those who fear their Lord without seeing Him and establish Prayer. Whoever purifies himself does so to his own good. To Allah is the final return.
Text2: and his mother and his father;

Text1: No one can bear another's burden. If a heavily laden one should call another to carry his load, none of it shall be carried by the other, even though he be a near of kin. (O Prophet), you can warn only those who fear their Lord without seeing Him and establish Prayer. Whoever purifies himself does so to his own good. To Allah is the final return.
Text2: and his consort and his children;

Text1: No one can bear another's burden. If a heavily laden one should call another to carry his load, none of it shall be carried by the other, even though he be a near of kin. (O Prophet), you can warn only those who fear their Lord without seeing Him and establish Prayer. Whoever purifies himself does so to his own good. To Allah is the final return.
Text2: on that Day each will be occupied with his own business, making him oblivious of all save himself.

Text1: We have sent you with the Truth to proclaim good news and to warn. Never has there been a nation but a warner came to it.
Text2: We raised a Messenger in every community (to tell them): "Serve Allah and shun the Evil One." Thereafter Allah guided some of them while others were overtaken by error. Go about the earth, then, and observe what was the end of those who rejected the Messengers, calling them liars.

Text1: and human beings too, and beasts, and cattle -- diverse are their hues. From among His servants, it is only those who know that fear Allah. Verily Allah is Most Mighty, Most Forgiving.
