Text2: And on the earth there are many tracts of land neighbouring each other. There are on it vineyards, and sown fields, and date palms: some growing in clusters from one root, some standing alone. They are irrigated by the same water, and yet We make some excel others in taste. Surely there are signs in these for a people who use their reason.

Text1: (the Lord) Who, out of His Bounty, has made us dwell in an abode wherein no toil, nor fatigue affects us.
Text2: (They will be told): _—“Eat and drink with good cheer as a reward for the good deeds you did in the days that have passed by._—ù

Text1: As for those who disbelieved, the Fire of Hell awaits them. There they shall not be finished off and die; nor will the torment (of Hell) be lightened for them. Thus do We requite every thankless being.
Text2: Whomsoever Allah guides is rightly guided; and whomsoever Allah lets go astray, you shall find none - apart from Him - who could protect him. We shall muster them all on the Day of Resurrection, on their faces - blind and dumb and deaf. Hell shall be their refuge. Every time its Fire subsides, We will intensify for them its flame.

Text1: As for those who disbelieved, the Fire of Hell awaits them. There they shall not be finished off and die; nor will the torment (of Hell) be lightened for them. Thus do We requite every thankless being.
Text2: But the evil-doers shall abide in the torment of Hell.

Text1: As for those who disbelieved, the Fire of Hell awaits them. There they shall not be finished off and die; nor will the torment (of Hell) be lightened for them. Thus do We requite every thankless being.
Text2: Never will their torment be lightened for them. They shall remain in utter despair.

Text1: As for those who disbelieved, the Fire of Hell awaits them. There they shall not be finished off and die; nor will the torment (of Hell) be lightened for them. Thus do We requite every thankless being.
Text2: So taste (the fruit of your deeds). We shall only increase your torment.

Text1: They will cry out in Hell and say: _—“Our Lord, let us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we did before._—ù (They will be told): _—“Did we not grant you an age long enough for anyone to take heed if he had wanted to take heed? Besides, there came a warner to you. So have a taste of the torment now. None may come to the help of the wrong-doers._—ù
Text2: He who follows the Right Way shall do so to his own advantage; and he who strays shall incur his own loss. No one shall bear another's burden. And never do We punish any people until We send a Messenger (to make the Truth distinct from falsehood).

Text1: They will cry out in Hell and say: _—“Our Lord, let us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we did before._—ù (They will be told): _—“Did we not grant you an age long enough for anyone to take heed if he had wanted to take heed? Besides, there came a warner to you. So have a taste of the torment now. None may come to the help of the wrong-doers._—ù
Text2: They will say: _—“Our Lord, twice have You caused us to die and twice have You given us life. We have now confessed our sins. Is there, then, any way out?_—ù

Text1: They will cry out in Hell and say: _—“Our Lord, let us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we did before._—ù (They will be told): _—“Did we not grant you an age long enough for anyone to take heed if he had wanted to take heed? Besides, there came a warner to you. So have a taste of the torment now. None may come to the help of the wrong-doers._—ù
Text2: (They will be told): _—“(The cause of your present state is that) when Allah alone was invoked, you disbelieved; and when others instead of Him were invoked, you believed. Today all judgement lies with Allah, the Most High, the All-Great._—ù

Text1: They will cry out in Hell and say: _—“Our Lord, let us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we did before._—ù (They will be told): _—“Did we not grant you an age long enough for anyone to take heed if he had wanted to take heed? Besides, there came a warner to you. So have a taste of the torment now. None may come to the help of the wrong-doers._—ù
Text2: They shall call out: _—“O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us._—ù He will reply: _—“You must stay on in it.

Text1: They will cry out in Hell and say: _—“Our Lord, let us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we did before._—ù (They will be told): _—“Did we not grant you an age long enough for anyone to take heed if he had wanted to take heed? Besides, there came a warner to you. So have a taste of the torment now. None may come to the help of the wrong-doers._—ù
Text2: We brought you the Truth; but to the truth most of you were averse._—ù

Text1: They will cry out in Hell and say: _—“Our Lord, let us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we did before._—ù (They will be told): _—“Did we not grant you an age long enough for anyone to take heed if he had wanted to take heed? Text1: They will cry out in Hell and say: _—“Our Lord, let us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we did before._—ù (They will be told): _—“Did we not grant you an age long enough for anyone to take heed if he had wanted to take heed? Besides, there came a warner to you. So have a taste of the torment now. None may come to the help of the wrong-doers._—ù
Text2: They will say: _—“Yes, a warner came to us, but we gave the lie to him and said: 'Allah has revealed nothing. You are surely in huge error.'

Text1: Surely Allah holds the heavens and the earth, lest they should be displaced there, for if they were displaced none would be able to hold them after Him. Surely He is Most Forbearing, Most Forgiving.
Text2: Allah: the Everlasting, the Sustainer of the whole Universe; there is no god but He. He does neither slumber nor sleep. Whatsoever is in the heavens and in the earth is His. Who is there that can intercede with Him except by His own permission.? He knows what is before the people and also what is hidden from them. And they cannot comprehend anything of His knowledge save whatever He Himself pleases to reveal. His Kingdom spreads over the heavens and the earth and the guarding of these does not weary Him. He alone is the Supreme and the Exalted.

Text1: Swearing by Allah their strongest oaths they claimed that if a warner came to them they would be better-guided than any other people. But when a warner did come to them, his coming only increased their aversion (to the Truth).
Text2: (You may no longer) say now that the Book was revealed only to two groups of people before Us and that we had indeed been unaware of what they read.

Text1: Swearing by Allah their strongest oaths they claimed that if a warner came to them they would be better-guided than any other people. But when a warner did come to them, his coming only increased their aversion (to the Truth).
Text2: They used to say before:

Text1: Swearing by Allah their strongest oaths they claimed that if a warner came to them they would be better-guided than any other people. But when a warner did come to them, his coming only increased their aversion (to the Truth).

Text1: Swearing by Allah their strongest oaths they claimed that if a warner came to them they would be better-guided than any other people. But when a warner did come to them, his coming only increased their aversion (to the Truth).

Text1: Swearing by Allah their strongest oaths they claimed that if a warner came to them they would be better-guided than any other people. But when a warner did come to them, his coming only increased their aversion (to the Truth).
Text2: But when it came to them, they rejected it. They shall soon come to know (the end of such an attitude).

Text1: They began to wax even more proud on earth and contrived evil designs although the contriving of evil designs only overtakes their authors. Are they waiting, then, for anything except what happened to the nations before them? You shall not find any change in the Way of Allah; and you shall not find anything that can ever alter the Way of Allah.
Text2: But no sooner than He delivers them than they go about committing excesses on the earth, acting unjustly. Men! The excesses you commit will be of harm only to yourselves, (Enjoy, if you will) the fleeting pleasure of this world; in me end you shall all return to Us, and then We shall tell you what you did.

Text1: They began to wax even more proud on earth and contrived evil designs although the contriving of evil designs only overtakes their authors. Are they waiting, then, for anything except what happened to the nations before them? You shall not find any change in the Way of Allah; and you shall not find anything that can ever alter the Way of Allah.
Text2: There are guardians over everyone, both before him and behind him, who guard him by Allah's command. Verily Allah does not change a people's condition unless they change their inner selves. And when Allah decides to make a people suffer punishment, no one can avert it. Nor can any be of help to such a people against Allah.

Text1: They began to wax even more proud on earth and contrived evil designs although the contriving of evil designs only overtakes their authors. Are they waiting, then, for anything except what happened to the nations before them? You shall not find any change in the Way of Allah; and you shall not find anything that can ever alter the Way of Allah.
Text2: Those who swore fealty to you, (O Prophet), in fact swore fealty to Allah. The Hand of Allah is above their hands. So whoever breaks his covenant breaks it to his own hurt; and whoever fulfils the covenant that he made with Allah, He will bestow on him a great reward.

Text1: (and this Qur'an) is a revelation from the Most Mighty, the Most Compassionate
Text2: Even so We revealed to you, (O Prophet), a spirit by Our command. (Ere to that) you knew neither what the Book nor what the faith was. But We made that spirit a light whereby We guide those of Our servants whom We please to the Right Way. Surely you are directing people to the Right Way,

Text1: (and this Qur'an) is a revelation from the Most Mighty, the Most Compassionate
Text2: the Way of Allah, to Whom belongs the dominion of all that is in the heavens and the earth. Lo, it is to Allah that all things ultimately revert.

Text1: so that you may warn a people whose ancestors were not warned before wherefore they are heedless.
Text2: [Say, O Muhammad]: 'O men! I am Allah's Messenger to you all - of Him to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. There is no god but He. He grants life and deals death. Have faith then, in Allah and in His Messenger, the ummi Prophet who believes in Allah and His words; and follow him so that you may be guided aright.'

Text1: We have put fetters around their necks which reach up to their chins so that they are standing with their heads upright,
Text2: (vi) Do not keep your hand fastened to your neck nor outspread it, altogether outspread, for you will be left sitting rebuked, destitute.

Text1: and We have put a barrier before them and a barrier behind them, and have covered them up, so they are unable to see.
Text2: Surely those against whom the word of your Lord has been fulfilled will not believed

Text1: We shall surely raise the dead to life and We record what they did and the traces of their deeds that they have left behind. We have encompassed that in a Clear Book.
Text2: Then think of the Day We shall summon every community with its leader. Those who are given their Record in their right hand shall read the Record of their deeds and shall not be wronged a whit.

Text1: We shall surely raise the dead to life and We record what they did and the traces of their deeds that they have left behind. We have encompassed that in a Clear Book.
Text2: The earth shall shine with the light of its Lord, and the Scroll (of deeds) shall be set in place, and the Prophets and all witnesses shall be brought, and judgement shall be justly passed among them, and they shall not be wronged;

Text1: They said: _—“We have been sent to you as Messengers._—ù The people of the town said: _—“You are only human beings like ourselves, and the Merciful Lord has revealed nothing. You are simply lying._—ù
Text2: If you were to obey a human being like yourselves, you will certainly be losers.

Text1: The Messengers replied: _—“Your evil omen is with you. (Are you saying this) because you were asked to take heed? The truth is that you are a people who have exceeded all bounds._—ù
Text2: Wherever you might be, death will overtake you even though you be in massive towers. And when some good happens to them, they say: 'This is from Allah'; whereas when some misfortune befalls them, they say: 'This is because of you'. Say: 'All is from Allah.' What has happened to this people that they seem to understand nothing?

Text1: What! Shall I take any deities apart from Him whose intercession will not avail me the least were the Merciful One to bring any adversity upon me, nor will they be able to rescue me?
Text2: If Allah afflicts you with any hardship, none other than He can remove it; and if He wills any good for you, none can avert His bounty. He bestows good upon whomsoever of His servants He wills. He is AllForgiving, All-Merciful.'

Text1: (Eventually they killed him and he was told): _—“Enter Paradise._—ù The man exclaimed: _—“Would that my people knew
Text2: In the meantime a man came running from the far end of the town, saying: _—“My people, follow the Messengers;

Text1: After him, We did not send down any hosts from the heaven; We stood in no need to send down any host.
Text2: After We had destroyed the earlier generations We bestowed the Book on Moses - a source of enlightenment for people and a guidance and mercy -- that they may take heed.

Text1: Have they not seen how many nations before them did We destroy? Thereafter they never came back to them.
Text2: There is no other life than the life of the world. We shall live here and here shall we die; and we are not going to be raised again.

Text1: All of them shall (one day) be gathered before Us.
Text2: Surely your Lord will recompense all to the full for their deeds. For indeed He is well aware of all what they do.

Text1: The sun is running its course to its appointed place. That is the ordaining of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.
Text2: Then He made them seven heavens in two days and revealed to each heaven its law. And We adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and firmly secured it. All this is the firm plan of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.

Text1: and then created for them other vessels like those on which they ride.
Text2: Verily when the water rose to great heights, We bore you upon a floating vessel (i.e. the Ark)

Text1: (nervously) exclaiming. _—“Alas for us! Who roused us out of our sleeping-place?_—ù _—“This is what the Merciful One had promised, and what (His) Messengers had said was true._—ù
Text2: On that Day when the Hour will come to pass the wicked shall swear that they had stayed (in the world) no more than an hour. Thus they used to be deceived in the life of the world.

Text1: (nervously) exclaiming. _—“Alas for us! Who roused us out of our sleeping-place?_—ù _—“This is what the Merciful One had promised, and what (His) Messengers had said was true._—ù
Text2: But those who had been endowed with knowledge and faith shall say: _—“According to Allah's Record you have stayed till the Day of Resurrection. Now, this is the Day of Resurrection. But you did not know._—ù

Text1: (nervously) exclaiming. _—“Alas for us! Who roused us out of our sleeping-place?_—ù _—“This is what the Merciful One had promised, and what (His) Messengers had said was true._—ù
Text2: _—“Yes, this is the Day of Final Decision that you used to deny as a lie._—ù

Text1: Then there will simply be one single Blast, and all will have gathered before Us.
Text2: Allah has full knowledge of the truths beyond the reach of perception both in the heavens and the earth; and the coming of the Hour will take no more than the twinkling of an eye; it may take even less. Indeed Allah has power over everything.

Text1: Then there will simply be one single Blast, and all will have gathered before Us.
Text2: Surely they will need no more than a single stern blast,

Text1: Then there will simply be one single Blast, and all will have gathered before Us.

Text1: _—“Criminals, separate yourselves from others today!

Text1: We did not teach him (to wit, the Messenger) poetry and it does not behove him. This is none but an Admonition, and a Clear Book
Text2: Falsehood may not enter it from the front or from the rear. It is a revelation that has been sent down from the Most Wise, the Immensely Praiseworthy.

Text1: that he may warn him who is alive and establish an argument against those that deny the Truth.
Text2: Can it happen that he who takes his stand on a clear evidence from his Lord, subsequently followed by a witness from Him (in his support), and prior to that the Book of Moses was revealed as a guide and a mercy, (would even he deny the truth in the manner of those who adore the life of this world)? Rather, such men are bound to believe in it. The Fire shall be the promised resort of the groups that disbelieve. So be in no doubt about it for this indeed is the truth from your Lord although most people do not believe.

Text1: These satans cannot listen to what transpires in the High Council for they are pelted away from every side
Text2: No intercession can avail with Allah except for him whom Allah permits (to intercede). When their hearts are relieved of fright they will ask the intercessors: _—“What did your Lord say?_—ù They will reply: _—“(He said) what is right, and He is the High, the Great._—ù

Text1: And if any is able to snatch a fragment, he is pursued by a piercing flame.
Text2: and that _—“we do not know whether evil is intended for those on the earth, or whether their Lord intends to direct them to the Right Way_—ù;

Text2: Whomsoever Allah guides is rightly guided; and whomsoever Allah lets go astray, you shall find none - apart from Him - who could protect him. We shall muster them all on the Day of Resurrection, on their faces - blind and dumb and deaf. Hell shall be their refuge. Every time its Fire subsides, We will intensify for them its flame.

Text1: (They say so although) he brought the Truth and confirmed the veracity of the Messengers.
Text2: (O Prophet), nothing is said to you but what was already said to the Messengers before you. Surely your Lord is the Lord of forgiveness and the Lord of grievous chastisement.

Text1: But Allah's chosen servants (shall be spared this woeful end).
Text2: Then We shall deliver those that feared Allah and leave the wrong-doers there on their knees.

Text1: But Allah's chosen servants (shall be spared this woeful end).
Text2: save the People of the Right Hand

Text1: But Allah's chosen servants (shall be spared this woeful end).
Text2: except those who have faith and do righteous deeds. Theirs is a never ending reward.

Text1: But Allah's chosen servants (shall be spared this woeful end).
Text2: save those who have faith and do righteous deeds, and counsel each other to hold on to truth and counsel each other to be steadfast.

Text1: One of them will say: _—“I had a companion in the world
Text2: And so it is that against every Prophet We have set up the evil ones from among men and jinn, some of them inspire others with specious speech only by way of. delusion. Had it been your Lord's will, they would not have done it. Leave them alone to fabricate what they will.

Text1: One of them will say: _—“I had a companion in the world
Text2: from the mischief of the whispering, elusive prompter who returns again and again,

Text1: One of them will say: _—“I had a companion in the world
Text2: who whispers in the hearts of people;

Text1: One of them will say: _—“I had a companion in the world
Text2: whether he be from the jinn or humans._—ù

Text1: But for Allah's favour, I should be one of those who have been mustered here.
Text2: We shall strip away all rancour from their hearts, and rivers shall flow beneath them, and they shall say: 'All praise be to Allah Who has guided us on to this. Had it not been for Allah Who granted us guidance, we would not be on the Right Path. Surely the Messengers of our Lord did indeed come down with truth.' Then a voice will cry out to them: 'This is the Paradise which you are made to inherit as a reward for your deeds.'

Text1: Is this a better hospitality or the tree of al-Zaqqum?
Text2: And We also produced the tree which springs forth from Mount Sinai, containing oil and sauce for those that eat.

Text1: We have made this tree a trial for the wrong-doers.
Text2: And recall when We said to you, (O Muhammad), that your Lord encompasses these people; and that We have made that vision that We have shown you, and the tree accursed in the Qur'an, but as a trial for people. We go about warning them, but each warning leads them to greater transgression.

Text1: (The people of Hell) will surely eat of it, filling their bellies with it.
Text2: that will neither nourish nor satisfy their hunger.

Text1: Then their return will be to the same blazing Hell.
Text2: (On the contrary) only those who have deserved the Garden, will have a good abode on that Day and a cool place for midday rest.

Text1: We delivered him and his household from the great calamity;
Text2: and made his offspring the only ones to survive,

Text1: and when he was old enough to go about and work with him, (one day) Abraham said to him: _—“My son, I see in my dream that I am slaughtering you. So consider (and tell me) what you think._—ù He said: _—“Do as you are bidden. You will find me, if Allah so wills, among the steadfast._—ù
Text2: He enjoined his household to observe Prayer and to give Zakah (purifying alms); and his Lord was well pleased with him.

Text1: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among the offspring of the two some did good and some plainly wronged themselves.
Text2: It was said: 'Noah! Disembark, with Our peace, and with blessings upon you and upon those who are with you. There are also people whom We shall allow to enjoy themselves for a while, and then a painful chastisement from Us shall afflict them.'

Text1: Had he not been one of those who glorify Allah,
Text2: Thereupon We accepted his prayer, and rescued him from grief. Thus do We rescue the believers.

Text1: and We sent him forth to a nation of a hundred thousand or more,
Text2: But even after seeing these Signs your hearts hardened and became as hard as rocks; nay, even harder than rocks. For there are some rocks out of which springs gush forth, and others which split open, and water issues out of them; then there are some which tumble down for fear of Allah. And Allah is not unaware of what you are doing.

Text1: and We sent him forth to a nation of a hundred thousand or more,
Text2: Have you not seen those who were told: 'Restrain you hands, and establish the Prayer, and pay the Zakah'? But when fighting was enjoined upon them some of them feared men as one should fear Allah, or even more, and said: 'Our Lord, why have You ordained fighting for us? Why did You not grant us a little more respite?' Say to them: 'There is little enjoyment in this world. The World to Come is much better for the God-fearing. And you shall not be wronged even to the extent of the husk of a date-stone.

Text1: and We sent him forth to a nation of a hundred thousand or more,
Text2: until he was two bows' length away, or nearer.

Text1: So ask their opinion: _—“(Are you convinced) that your Lord should have daughters and you should have sons?
Text2: When any of them is told about the birth of a female his face turns dark, and he is filled with suppressed anger,

Text1: So ask their opinion: _—“(Are you convinced) that your Lord should have daughters and you should have sons?
Text2: That is indeed an unfair division!

Text1: Did He choose daughters rather than sons?
Text2: What is the matter with you that you make such strange judgements?

Text1: and we are of those who glorify Allah._—ù
Text2: They say: "The Most Compassionate Lord has taken to Himself a son." Glory be to Him! Those whom they so designate are only His honoured servants.

Text1: and we are of those who glorify Allah._—ù
Text2: They do not outstrip Him in speech and only act as He commands.

Text1: and we are of those who glorify Allah._—ù
Text2: He knows whatever is before them and whatsoever is remote from them and they do not intercede except for him, intercession on whose behalf pleases Him, and they stand constantly in awe of Him.

Text1: and we are of those who glorify Allah._—ù
Text2: And if anyone of them were to claim: "Indeed I am a god apart from Him," We shall recompense both with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrong-doers.

Text1: and we are of those who glorify Allah._—ù
Text2: By those who range themselves in rows;

Text1: we would surely have been Allah's chosen servants._—ù
Text2: Nor may you claim that: 'Had the Book been revealed to us, we would have been better guided than they.' Surely clear evidence has come to you from your Lord, which is both a guidance and a mercy. Who, then, is more unjust than he who gave the lie to the signs of Allah and turned away from them? And We shall soon requite those who turn away from Our signs with a severe chastisement for having turned away.

Text1: How many a nation did We destroy before them! (When they approached their doom) they cried out (for deliverance), but the time for deliverance was already past.
Text2: (They were told): "Flee not, but return to your comforts and to your dwellings. You are likely to be questioned."

Text1: Has this Exhortation been sent down among us only to him, to the exclusion of all others?_—ù Nay, they are in doubt regarding My Exhortation, and are saying all this because they have not yet had any taste of My chastisement.
Text2: Is it they who distribute the Mercy of your Lord? It is We Who have distributed their livelihood among them in the life of this world, and have raised some above others in rank that some of them may harness others to their service. Your Lord's Mercy is better than all the treasures that they hoard.

Text1: Do they possess the treasures of your Lord, the Most Mighty, the Great Bestower?
Text2: Have they any share in the dominion (of Allah)? Had that been so, they would never have granted people even as much as the speck on a date-stone.

Text1: Do they possess the treasures of your Lord, the Most Mighty, the Great Bestower?
Text2: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Even if you owned the treasures of my Lord's Mercy you would have held them back for fear of spending them." Man is indeed ever niggardly.

Text1: Has this Exhortation been sent down among us only to him, to the exclusion of all others?_—ù Nay, they are in doubt regarding My Exhortation, and are saying all this because they have not yet had any taste of My chastisement.
Text2: Was there none but he to whom the Reminder could be vouchsafed excluding all others? Nay; he is an insolent liar._—ù

Text1: David said: _—“He has certainly wronged you in seeking to add your ewe to his ewes; and indeed many who live together commit excesses, one to the other, except those that believe and act righteously; and they are but few._—ù (While so saying) David realized that it is We Who have put him to test; therefore, he sought the forgiveness of his Lord, and fell down, bowing and penitently turning (to Him).
Text2: And We bestowed upon Abraham (offspring) Ishaq (Isaac) and Ya'qub (Jacob) and each of them did We guide to the right way as We had earlier guided Noah to the right way; and (of his descendants We guided) Da'ud (David) and Sulayman (Solomon), Ayyub (Job), Yusuf (Joseph), Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron). Thus do We reward those who do good.

Text1: (and We said to him): _—“Take in your hand a bundle of rushes and strike with it, and do not break your oath._—ù Indeed We found him steadfast. How excellent a servant (of Ours) he was. Indeed he constantly turned (to his Lord).
Text2: and will provide him sustenance from whence he never even imagined. Whoever puts his trust in Allah, He shall suffice him. Surely Allah brings about what He decrees; Allah has set a measure for everything.

Text1: This is Our provision for you, never to end.
Text2: Whatever you have is bound to pass away and whatever is with Allah will last. And We shall surely grant those who have been patient their reward according to the best of what they did.

Text1: Is it that we mistakenly made fun of them; or have they disappeared from our sight?_—ù
Text2: And the people of Paradise shall cry to the people of Hell: 'Surely we have found our Lord's promise to us to be true. have you also found true what your Lord has promised you?' 'Yes', they shall answer; and a herald shall cry out among them: 'Allah's curse be upon the wrong-doers';

Text1: Is it that we mistakenly made fun of them; or have they disappeared from our sight?_—ù
Text2: And the people of the Heights will cry out to the men whom they would recognize by their marks. saving: 'Neither your numbers nor the riches of which you were proud availed you.

Text1: except those of Your servants, the chosen ones from amongst them._—ù
Text2: He then continued: "Look! This is he whom You have exalted above me! If you will grant me respite till the Day of Resurrection I shall uproot the whole of his progeny except only a few."

Text1: This is nothing but an Admonition for all people the world over.
Text2: Ask them: 'Whose testimony is the greatest?' Say: 'Allah is the witness between me and you; and this Qur'an was revealed to me that I should warn you thereby and also whomsoever it may reach.' Do you indeed testify that there are other gods with Allah? Say: 'I shall never testify such a thing.' Say: 'He is the One God and I am altogether averse to all that you associate with Him in His divinity.'

Text1: This is nothing but an Admonition for all people the world over.
Text2: Can it happen that he who takes his stand on a clear evidence from his Lord, subsequently followed by a witness from Him (in his support), and prior to that the Book of Moses was revealed as a guide and a mercy, (would even he deny the truth in the manner of those who adore the life of this world)? Rather, such men are bound to believe in it. The Fire shall be the promised resort of the groups that disbelieve. So be in no doubt about it for this indeed is the truth from your Lord although most people do not believe.

Text1: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.
Text2: which the truthful spirit has carried down

Text1: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.
Text2: to your heart that you might become one of those who warn (others on behalf of Allah),

Text1: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.
Text2: (a revelation) in clear Arabic language,

Text1: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.
Text2: These are the ones who rejected the Good Counsel when it came to them, although it is certainly a Mighty Book.

Text1: Lo, religion is exclusively devoted to Allah. Your religion is entirely consecrated to Him. As for those who have taken others than Allah for their guardians, (they say): _—“We worship them only that they may bring us nearer to Allah._—ù Allah will judge between them concerning what they differ about. Verily Allah does not guide anyone who is given to sheer lying, is an utter unbeliever.
Text2: We raised a Messenger in every community (to tell them): "Serve Allah and shun the Evil One." Thereafter Allah guided some of them while others were overtaken by error. Go about the earth, then, and observe what was the end of those who rejected the Messengers, calling them liars.

Text1: Lo, religion is exclusively devoted to Allah. Your religion is entirely consecrated to Him. As for those who have taken others than Allah for their guardians, (they say): _—“We worship them only that they may bring us nearer to Allah._—ù Allah will judge between them concerning what they differ about. Verily Allah does not guide anyone who is given to sheer lying, is an utter unbeliever.
Text2: Never did We send any Messenger before you to whom We did not reveal: "There is no god but Me. So serve Me alone."

Text1: Lo, religion is exclusively devoted to Allah. Your religion is entirely consecrated to Him. As for those who have taken others than Allah for their guardians, (they say): _—“We worship them only that they may bring us nearer to Allah._—ù Allah will judge between them concerning what they differ about. Verily Allah does not guide anyone who is given to sheer lying, is an utter unbeliever.
Text2: And on the Day when He will muster them all and will ask the angels: _—“Are they the ones who worshipped you?_—ù

Text1: Lo, religion is exclusively devoted to Allah. Your religion is entirely consecrated to Him. As for those who have taken others than Allah for their guardians, (they say): _—“We worship them only that they may bring us nearer to Allah._—ù Allah will judge between them concerning what they differ about. Verily Allah does not guide anyone who is given to sheer lying, is an utter unbeliever.
Text2: They will reply: _—“Glory to You! You are our Protector, not they. Nay, they rather used to worship the jinn. Most of them believe in them._—ù

Text1: He it is Who created you from a single being, and He it is Who made from it its mate. He it is Who created for you eight heads of cattle in pairs. He creates you in your mothers' wombs, giving you one form after another in threefold depths of darkness. That, then, is Allah, your Lord. His is the kingdom. There is no god but He. So, whence are you being turned astray?
Text2: And likewise, of camels there are two, and of oxen there are two. Ask them: 'Is it either the two males that He has forbidden or the two females, or that which the wombs of the two females may contain? Or were you present when Allah enjoined this commandment upon you?' Who, then, would be more unjust than he who fabricates a lie against Allah that he might lead people astray without knowledge. Surely Allah never guides such a wrong-doing folk.

Text1: to those who pay heed to what is said and follow the best of it. They are the ones whom Allah has guided to the Right Way; they are the ones endowed with understanding.
Text2: And We ordained for Moses in the Tablets all manner of admonition, and instruction concerning all things, and said to him: Hold to these, with all your strength. and bid your people to follow them in accord with their best understanding. I shall soon show you the habitation of the wicked.

Text1: Do you not see that Allah sent down water from the sky, then made it flow on earth as springs and streams and rivers and then with it He brings forth vegetation of various hues; then this vegetation ripens and dries up, turning yellow, whereafter He reduces it to broken straw? Surely there is a lesson in this for those endowed with understanding.
Text2: And it is He, Who drives the winds to be the harbingers of His mercy: then He sends down pure water from the sky

Text1: Allah has revealed the best teaching, a self-consistent Book which repeats its contents in manifold forms whereat shiver the skins of those that hold their Lord in awe, and then their skins and their hearts soften for Allah's remembrance. That is Allah's Guidance wherewith He guides whosoever He pleases. And he whom Allah does not guide to the Right Path has none to guide him.
Text2: Is it, then, in regard to Him Who watches over the deeds of every person that they are acting blasphemously by setting up His associates? Tell them: "Name those associates (if Allah Himself has made them His associates)! Or are you informing Allah of something the existence of which He does not even know?" Or do people arbitrarily utter empty words? Indeed, their foul contriving has been made to seem fair to the unbelievers and they have been barred from finding the Right Way. Whomsoever Allah lets go astray will have none to guide him.

Text1: Allah has revealed the best teaching, a self-consistent Book which repeats its contents in manifold forms whereat shiver the skins of those that hold their Lord in awe, and then their skins and their hearts soften for Allah's remembrance. That is Allah's Guidance wherewith He guides whosoever He pleases. And he whom Allah does not guide to the Right Path has none to guide him.
Text2: who do not behave like the blind and the deaf, when the Revelations of their Lord are recited to them for admonition;

Text1: Allah has revealed the best teaching, a self-consistent Book which repeats its contents in manifold forms whereat shiver the skins of those that hold their Lord in awe, and then their skins and their hearts soften for Allah's remembrance. That is Allah's Guidance wherewith He guides whosoever He pleases. And he whom Allah does not guide to the Right Path has none to guide him.
Text2: This was a remembrance. An excellent retreat awaits the God-fearing

That is Allah's Guidance wherewith He guides whosoever He pleases. And he whom Allah does not guide to the Right Path has none to guide him.
Text2: All this (is for the God-fearing). But for the transgressors, an evil resort awaits them --

That is Allah's Guidance wherewith He guides whosoever He pleases. And he whom Allah does not guide to the Right Path has none to guide him.
Text2: Surely the virtuous shall be in Bliss,

That is Allah's Guidance wherewith He guides whosoever He pleases. And he whom Allah does not guide to the Right Path has none to guide him.

Text1: Allah has revealed the best teaching, a self-consistent Book which repeats its contents in manifold forms whereat shiver the skins of those that hold their Lord in awe, and then their skins and their hearts soften for Allah's remembrance. That is Allah's Guidance wherewith He guides whosoever He pleases. And he whom Allah does not guide to the Right Path has none to guide him.
Text2: No indeed! Verily the deeds of the wicked are in the Record locked up in the prison-house!

Text1: Allah has revealed the best teaching, a self-consistent Book which repeats its contents in manifold forms whereat shiver the skins of those that hold their Lord in awe, and then their skins and their hearts soften for Allah's remembrance. That is Allah's Guidance wherewith He guides whosoever He pleases. And he whom Allah does not guide to the Right Path has none to guide him.
Text2: No indeed! Verily, the deeds of the virtuous shall be in the record of the exalted ones.

Text1: We have indeed propounded for mankind all kinds of parables in this Qur'an that they may take heed.
Text2: He sets forth for you a parable from your own lives. Do you have among your slaves some who share with you the sustenance that We have bestowed on you so that you become equals in it, all being alike, and then you would hold them in fear as you fear each other? Thus do We make plain the Signs for those who use reason.

Text1: If you ask them: _—“Who created the heavens and the earth?_—ù they will surely answer: _—“Allah._—ù Tell them: _—“What do you think, then, of the deities whom you call upon instead of Allah? If Allah should will that an affliction befall me, will those deities remove the harm inflicted by Him? Or if Allah should will that I receive (His) Mercy, will they be able to withhold His Mercy from me?_—ù Say: _—“Allah is sufficient for me; those who have to put their trust, let them put their trust in Him.
Text2: All we can say is that some god of ours has afflicted you with evil.. Hud said: 'Indeed I take Allah as my witness, and you too to be my witnesses that I have nothing to do with your associating with Allah

Text1: If you ask them: _—“Who created the heavens and the earth?_—ù they will surely answer: _—“Allah._—ù Tell them: _—“What do you think, then, of the deities whom you call upon instead of Allah? If Allah should will that an affliction befall me, will those deities remove the harm inflicted by Him? Or if Allah should will that I receive (His) Mercy, will they be able to withhold His Mercy from me?_—ù Say: _—“Allah is sufficient for me; those who have to put their trust, let them put their trust in Him.
Text2: others than Him in His divinity. So conspire against me, all of you, and give me no respite.

Text1: (O Prophet), We revealed to you the Book with the Truth for all mankind. So he who follows the Right Way does so to his own benefit, and he who goes astray, shall hurt only himself by straying. You are not accountable on their behalf.
Text2: (O Messenger!) Let it not happen that you omit (to expound) a portion of what was revealed to you. And do not be distressed that they will say: 'Why was a treasure not bestowed upon him?' or 'Why did no angel accompany him?' For you are merely a warner, whereas Allah has control over everything.

Text1: It is Allah Who takes away the souls of people at the hour of their death, and takes away at the time of sleep the souls of those that have not died. Then He retains the souls of those against whom He had decreed death and returns the souls of others till an appointed time. Surely there are Signs in this for a people who reflect.
Text2: And He alone holds sway over His servants and sets guardians over you till death approaches any of you and Our deputed angels take his soul, neglecting no part of their task.

Text1: When an affliction befalls man, he cries out to Us; but when We grant him a favour from Us, he says: _—“I have been granted this on account of my knowledge._—ù Nay; this (favour) is a test; but most of them do not know.
Text2: They always said: _—“We have more wealth and children than you have, and we shall not be chastised._—ù

Text1: or lest he should say, when he sees the chastisement: _—“O that I might return again, and be among those who do good._—ù
Text2: If you call upon them, they cannot hear your prayer. And if they hear it, they cannot answer it. On the Day of Resurrection they will disown you for associating others with Allah in His Divinity. No one can inform you of the truth save the All-Aware.

Text1: And the Trumpet shall be blown and all who are in the heavens and the earth shall fall down dead save those whom Allah wills. Then the Trumpet shall be blown again, and lo! all of them will be standing and looking on.
Text2: and detain them there; they will be called to account.

Text1: And the Trumpet shall be blown and all who are in the heavens and the earth shall fall down dead save those whom Allah wills. Then the Trumpet shall be blown again, and lo! all of them will be standing and looking on.
Text2: the Day when they will emerge and nothing of them shall be hidden from Allah. (On that Day they will be asked): _—“Whose is the kingdom today?_—ù (The whole world will cry out): _—“It is Allah's, the One, the Overpowering._—ù

Text1: And the Trumpet shall be blown and all who are in the heavens and the earth shall fall down dead save those whom Allah wills. Then the Trumpet shall be blown again, and lo! all of them will be standing and looking on.
Text2: Surely they will need no more than a single stern blast,

Text1: And the Trumpet shall be blown and all who are in the heavens and the earth shall fall down dead save those whom Allah wills. Then the Trumpet shall be blown again, and lo! all of them will be standing and looking on.
Text2: and lo, they will all be in the open plain.

Text1: The earth shall shine with the light of its Lord, and the Scroll (of deeds) shall be set in place, and the Prophets and all witnesses shall be brought, and judgement shall be justly passed among them, and they shall not be wronged;
Text2: Indeed Allah wrongs none, not even as much as an atom's weight. Whenever a man does good, He multiplies it two-fold, and bestows out of His grace a mighty reward.

Text1: The earth shall shine with the light of its Lord, and the Scroll (of deeds) shall be set in place, and the Prophets and all witnesses shall be brought, and judgement shall be justly passed among them, and they shall not be wronged;
Text2: We shall set up just scales on the Day of Resurrection so that none will be wronged in the least. (We shall bring forth the acts of everyone), even if it be the weight of a grain of mustard seed. We shall suffice as Reckoners.

Text1: (After the judgement has been passed) the unbelievers shall be driven in companies to Hell so that when they arrive there, its gates shall be thrown open and its keepers shall say to them: _—“Did Messengers from among yourselves not come to you, rehearsing to you the Signs of your Lord and warning you against your meeting of this Day?_—ù They will say: _—“Yes indeed; but the sentence of chastisement was bound to be executed against the unbelievers._—ù
Text2: Whomsoever Allah guides is rightly guided; and whomsoever Allah lets go astray, you shall find none - apart from Him - who could protect him. We shall muster them all on the Day of Resurrection, on their faces - blind and dumb and deaf. Hell shall be their refuge. Every time its Fire subsides, We will intensify for them its flame.

Text1: (After the judgement has been passed) the unbelievers shall be driven in companies to Hell so that when they arrive there, its gates shall be thrown open and its keepers shall say to them: _—“Did Messengers from among yourselves not come to you, rehearsing to you the Signs of your Lord and warning you against your meeting of this Day?_—ù They will say: _—“Yes indeed; but the sentence of chastisement was bound to be executed against the unbelievers._—ù
Text2: The Day shall soon come when We shall bring together the God-fearing to the Most Compassionate Lord, as honoured guests;

Text1: They will say: _—“All thanks and praise be to Allah Who has made His promise to us come true, and Who gave us the earth to inherit. We may now dwell in Paradise wherever we please._—ù How excellent is the reward of those who laboured!
Text2: 'Our Lord, fulfil what You promised to us through Your Messengers, and disgrace us not on the Day of Resurrection; indeed You never go back on Your promise.

Text1: They will say: _—“All thanks and praise be to Allah Who has made His promise to us come true, and Who gave us the earth to inherit. We may now dwell in Paradise wherever we please._—ù How excellent is the reward of those who laboured!
Text2: The shades of Paradise will bend over them, and its fruits will be brought within their easy reach;

Text1: They will say: _—“All thanks and praise be to Allah Who has made His promise to us come true, and Who gave us the earth to inherit. We may now dwell in Paradise wherever we please._—ù How excellent is the reward of those who laboured!
Text2: All praise is for Allah alone, Who created the heavens and the earth, and brought into being light and darkness, and yet those who have rejected the call of the Truth ascribe others to be equals to their Lord.

Text1: You shall see the angels surrounding the Throne, glorifying their Lord with His praise, and judgement will have been made among them with fairness, and it will be proclaimed: _—“All praise and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe._—ù
Text2: Do they not see that We are advancing in the land, diminishing it by its borders on all sides? Allah judges, and no one has the power to reverse His judgement. He is swift in reckoning.

Text1: You shall see the angels surrounding the Throne, glorifying their Lord with His praise, and judgement will have been made among them with fairness, and it will be proclaimed: _—“All praise and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe._—ù
Text2: and Who gave you all that you asked Him for. Were you to count the favours of Allah you shall never be able to encompass them. Verily man is highly unjust, exceedingly ungrateful.

Text1: You shall see the angels surrounding the Throne, glorifying their Lord with His praise, and judgement will have been made among them with fairness, and it will be proclaimed: _—“All praise and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe._—ù
Text2: (O Prophet), declare to My servants that I am indeed Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.

Text1: You shall see the angels surrounding the Throne, glorifying their Lord with His praise, and judgement will have been made among them with fairness, and it will be proclaimed: _—“All praise and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe._—ù
Text2: At the same time, My chastisement is highly painful.

Text1: You shall see the angels surrounding the Throne, glorifying their Lord with His praise, and judgement will have been made among them with fairness, and it will be proclaimed: _—“All praise and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe._—ù
Text2: We allow them to enjoy themselves a while in the world and then We shall drive them in utter helplessness to a harsh chastisement.

Text1: None but the unbelievers dispute regarding the Signs of Allah. So let not their strutting about in the land delude you.
Text2: This is but a little enjoyment, then their destination is Hell -what an evil resting place!

Text1: They will say: _—“Our Lord, twice have You caused us to die and twice have You given us life. We have now confessed our sins. Is there, then, any way out?_—ù
Text2: No! They will say this merely because the Truth which they had concealed will become obvious to them; or else if they were sent back, they would still revert to what was forbidden to them. (So this plea of theirs would be a lie too) for they are just liars.

Text1: They will say: _—“Our Lord, twice have You caused us to die and twice have You given us life. We have now confessed our sins. Is there, then, any way out?_—ù
Text2: Allah will say: "Away from Me; stay where you are and do not address Me.

Text2: Indeed this is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe;

Text1: (It will then be said): _—“Today shall everyone be fully recompensed for his deeds. None shall be wronged today. Surely Allah is Swift in Reckoning._—ù
Text2: To create all of you or to resurrect all of you is to Him like (creating or resurrecting) a single person. Verily Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

Text1: (It will then be said): _—“Today shall everyone be fully recompensed for his deeds. None shall be wronged today. Surely Allah is Swift in Reckoning._—ù
Text2: Our command consists of only one Word which is carried out in the twinkling of an eye.

Text1: (O Prophet), then warn them of the Day that has drawn near, the Day when hearts full of suppressed grief will leap up to the throats and the wrong-doers shall neither have any sincere friend nor intercessor whose word will be heeded.
Text2: Allah's judgement has (all but) come; do not, then, call for its speedy advent. Holy is He, and far above their associating others with Him in His Divinity.

Text1: (O Prophet), then warn them of the Day that has drawn near, the Day when hearts full of suppressed grief will leap up to the throats and the wrong-doers shall neither have any sincere friend nor intercessor whose word will be heeded.
Text2: The time of people's reckoning has drawn near, and yet they turn aside in heedlessness.

Text1: (O Prophet), then warn them of the Day that has drawn near, the Day when hearts full of suppressed grief will leap up to the throats and the wrong-doers shall neither have any sincere friend nor intercessor whose word will be heeded.
Text2: When they will see it near at hand, the faces of all those who had denied it will be distraught, and then they will be told: _—“This is the doom which you used to ask for._—ù

Text1: (O Prophet), then warn them of the Day that has drawn near, the Day when hearts full of suppressed grief will leap up to the throats and the wrong-doers shall neither have any sincere friend nor intercessor whose word will be heeded.
Text2: The Day when the Spirit and the angels are ranged row on row. None shall speak save he whom the Merciful Lord will permit; and he too will speak what is right.

Text1: Allah will judge with justice, whereas those whom they call upon beside Him cannot judge at all. Surely Allah -- and He alone -- is All- Hearing, All-Seeing.
Text2: To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. He will requite the evil-doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

Text1: Have they not journeyed in the land that they might observe the end of those who came before them? They were even greater in strength than they and left behind more splendid traces in the land. Then Allah seized them because of their sins and they had none who could protect them from Allah.
Text2: We had established them firmly in a manner We have not established you. We had given them ears and eyes and hearts. But nothing availed them -- neither their ears, nor their eyes, nor their hearts, for they denied the Signs of Allah. Then what they had mocked at encompassed them.

Text1: to Pharaoh and Haman and Korah. They said: _—“(He is) a sorcerer, an utter liar._—ù
Text2: Thus has it been (in the past): never did a Messenger come to the nations that preceded them but they said: _—“(He is) a sorcerer, or a mad-man._—ù

Text1: to Pharaoh and Haman and Korah. They said: _—“(He is) a sorcerer, an utter liar._—ù
Text2: Have they arrived at a common understanding concerning this? No; but they are a people given to transgression.

Text1: When Moses brought them the Truth from Us they said: _—“Kill the sons of all the believers who have joined him, but spare the women._—ù The guile of the unbelievers always ends in vain.
Text2: The people of Moses replied: 'We were oppressed before your coming to us and after it.' Moses said: 'Your Lord will soon destroy your enemy and make you rulers in the land. Then He will see how you act.'

Text1: Then a man endowed with faith, from Pharaoh's folk, who had kept his faith hidden, said: _—“Do you kill a person simply because he says: 'My Lord is Allah' even though he brought to you clear Signs from your Lord? If he is a liar, his lying will recoil upon him; but if he is truthful, you will be smitten with some of the awesome consequences of which he warns you. Allah does not guide to the Right Way any who exceeds the limits and is an utter liar.
Text2: One day Pharaoh said: _—“Let me go and kill Moses; then let him invoke his Lord. I fear that he will change your religion or cause disruption in the land._—ù

Text1: Then a man endowed with faith, from Pharaoh's folk, who had kept his faith hidden, said: _—“Do you kill a person simply because he says: 'My Lord is Allah' even though he brought to you clear Signs from your Lord? Text1: Then a man endowed with faith, from Pharaoh's folk, who had kept his faith hidden, said: _—“Do you kill a person simply because he says: 'My Lord is Allah' even though he brought to you clear Signs from your Lord? Text1: My people, today the kingdom is yours, and you are supreme in the land. But if Allah's chastisement were to come upon you, who will come to our help?_—ù Pharaoh said: _—“I only counsel what I consider right; I only direct you to the Path of Rectitude._—ù
Text2: to Pharaoh and his nobles. But they obeyed the command of Pharaoh even though Pharaoh's command was not rightly-directed.

Text1: My people, today the kingdom is yours, and you are supreme in the land. But if Allah's chastisement were to come upon you, who will come to our help?_—ù Pharaoh said: _—“I only counsel what I consider right; I only direct you to the Path of Rectitude._—ù
Text2: Moses replied: "You know well that no one but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent these as eye-opening proofs. I truly think, O Pharaoh, that you are indeed doomed."

Text1: My people, today the kingdom is yours, and you are supreme in the land. But if Allah's chastisement were to come upon you, who will come to our help?_—ù Pharaoh said: _—“I only counsel what I consider right; I only direct you to the Path of Rectitude._—ù
Text2: Pharaoh led his people astray; he did not guide them aright.

Text1: My people, today the kingdom is yours, and you are supreme in the land. But if Allah's chastisement were to come upon you, who will come to our help?_—ù Pharaoh said: _—“I only counsel what I consider right; I only direct you to the Path of Rectitude._—ù
Text2: They denied those Signs out of iniquity and arrogance although their hearts were convinced of their truth. So see how evil was the end of those mischief-makers!

Text1: My people, today the kingdom is yours, and you are supreme in the land. But if Allah's chastisement were to come upon you, who will come to our help?_—ù Pharaoh said: _—“I only counsel what I consider right; I only direct you to the Path of Rectitude._—ù
Text2: That is the Bounty of which Allah gives tidings to His servants who have faith and do good deeds. Tell them, (O Prophet): _—“I do not ask you for any recompense for my work except love towards kinsfolk._—ù Whoever does a good deed, We shall increase its merit for him. Surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciative.

Text1: My people, I fear that you will encounter a day when there will be much wailing and you will cry out to one another for help,
Text2: And the people of Paradise shall cry to the people of Hell: 'Surely we have found our Lord's promise to us to be true. have you also found true what your Lord has promised you?' 'Yes', they shall answer; and a herald shall cry out among them: 'Allah's curse be upon the wrong-doers';

Text1: My people, I fear that you will encounter a day when there will be much wailing and you will cry out to one another for help,
Text2: And the people of the Fire will cry out to the people of Paradise: 'Pour out some water on us or throw at us something of what Allah has bestowed upon you.' They will reply: 'Allah has forbidden them to the deniers of the truth,

Text1: the day when you will turn around to retreat, there will be none to protect you from Allah. He whom Allah lets go astray, none will be able to show him the Right Way.
Text2: No, there is no refuge.

Text1: the day when you will turn around to retreat, there will be none to protect you from Allah. He whom Allah lets go astray, none will be able to show him the Right Way.
Text2: With your Lord alone will be the retreat that Day.

Text1: There is no doubt that those whom you call me to have no claim to be called upon in this world and in the Hereafter. Certainly to Allah shall be our return, and those who exceed the limits are destined to the Fire.
Text2: If you call upon them, they cannot hear your prayer. And if they hear it, they cannot answer it. On the Day of Resurrection they will disown you for associating others with Allah in His Divinity. No one can inform you of the truth save the All-Aware.

Text1: There is no doubt that those whom you call me to have no claim to be called upon in this world and in the Hereafter. Certainly to Allah shall be our return, and those who exceed the limits are destined to the Fire.
Text2: When all human beings will be gathered together those who had been called upon will become the enemies to their votaries and will disown their worship.

Text1: Those suffering in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell: _—“Call upon your Lord to lighten the chastisement for us just for a day._—ù
Text2: Allah will say: "Away from Me; stay where you are and do not address Me.

Text1: Your Lord said: _—“Pray to Me, and I will accept your prayers. Surely those who wax too proud to worship Me shall enter Hell, utterly abased._—ù
Text2: Strive in the cause of Allah in a manner worthy of that striving. He has chosen you (for His task), and He has not laid upon you any hardship in religion. Keep to the faith of your father Abraham. Allah named you Muslims earlier and even in this (Book), that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and that you may be witnesses over all mankind. So establish Prayer, and pay Zakah, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protector. What an excellent Protector; what an excellent Helper!

Text1: Allah it is Who made the earth a dwelling place for you and made the sky a canopy, Who shaped you -- and shaped you exceedingly well -- and gave you good things as sustenance. That is Allah, your Lord; blessed be Allah, the Lord of the Universe.
Text2: O Mankind, submit to your Lord Who created you and those who were before you; in this way only you may expect to save yourselves.

Text1: Allah it is Who made the earth a dwelling place for you and made the sky a canopy, Who shaped you -- and shaped you exceedingly well -- and gave you good things as sustenance. That is Allah, your Lord; blessed be Allah, the Lord of the Universe.
Text2: It is He Who has made the earth a bed for you and the sky a canopy; and it is He Who sends down rain from above for the growth of every kind of food products for your sustenance. So, when you know this, you should not set up equals to rank with Allah.

Text1: Those who gave the lie to this Book and all the Books which We had sent with Our Messengers shall soon come to know the Truth
Text2: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

Text1: When they saw Our chastisement, they said: _—“We have come to believe in Allah, the Only One, and we reject all what we had associated (with Allah in His Divinity)._—ù
Text2: Moses prayed: 'Our Lord! You bestowed upon Pharaoh and his nobles splendour and riches in the world. Our Lord! Have You done this that they may lead people astray from Your path? Our Lord! Obliterate their riches and harden their hearts that they may not believe until they observe the painful chastisement.

Text1: When they saw Our chastisement, they said: _—“We have come to believe in Allah, the Only One, and we reject all what we had associated (with Allah in His Divinity)._—ù
Text2: (Thereupon came the response): 'Now you believe, although you disobeyed earlier and were one of the mischief-makers.

Text1: This is a revelation from the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate,

Text1: As to those who have faith and do good works, surely theirs shall be a never-ending reward.
Text2: And as for those who are blessed, they shall abide in the Garden as long as the heavens and the earth endure, unless your Lord may will otherwise. They shall enjoy an unceasing gift.

Text1: Tell them, (O Prophet): _—“Do you indeed disbelieve in Him and assign compeers to Him Who created the earth in two days? He is the Lord of all beings of the Universe.
Text2: Is it harder to create you or the heaven? But Allah built it,
