Text1: The only reward of those who make war upon Allah and His messenger and strive after corruption in the land will be that they will be killed or crucified, or have their hands and feet on alternate sides cut off, or will be expelled out of the land. Such will be their degradation in the world, and in the Hereafter theirs will be an awful doom;
Text2: Thus we misled you. Lo! we were (ourselves) astray.

Text1: O ye who believe! Ye have charge of your own souls. He who erreth cannot injure you if ye are rightly guided. Unto Allah ye will all return; and then He will inform you of what ye used to do.
Text2: We called unto him: O Abraham!

Text1: Then Allah sent a raven scratching up the ground, to show him how to hide his brother_s naked corpse. He said: Woe unto me! Am I not able to be as this raven and so hide my brother_s naked corpse? And he became repentant.
Text2: We had no power over you, but ye were wayward folk.

Text1: (Their Lord) said: For this the land will surely be forbidden them for forty years that they will wander in the earth, bewildered. So grieve not over the wrongdoing folk.
Text2: What aileth you that ye help not one another?

Text1: There shall be no sin (imputed) unto those who believe and do good works for what they may have eaten (in the past). So be mindful of your duty (to Allah), and believe, and do good works; and again: be mindful of your duty, and believe; and once again: be mindful of your duty, and do right. Allah loveth the good.
Text2: What aileth you that ye speak not?

Text1: Eat of that which Allah hath bestowed on you as food lawful and good, and keep your duty to Allah in Whom ye are believers.
Text2: What then is your opinion of the Lord of the Worlds?

Text1: Allah hath appointed the Ka_bah, the Sacred House, a standard for mankind, and the Sacred Month and the offerings and the garlands. That is so that ye may know that Allah knoweth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, and that Allah is Knower of all things.
Text2: When Allah hath created you and what ye make?

Text1: Allah hath rewarded them for that their saying - Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide for ever. That is the reward of the good.
Text2: When he came unto his Lord with a whole heart;

Text1: But those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations, they are owners of hell-fire.
Text2: When he said unto his father and his folk: What is it that ye worship?

Text1: They indeed have disbelieved who say: Lo! Allah is the Messiah, son of Mary. Say: Who then can do aught against Allah, if He had willed to destroy the Messiah son of Mary, and his mother and everyone on earth? Allah_s is the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them. He createth what He will. And Allah is Able to do all things.
Text2: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then, forsooth, be raised (again)?

Text1: And unto thee have We revealed the Scripture with the truth, confirming whatever Scripture was before it, and a watcher over it. So judge between them by that which Allah hath revealed, and follow not their desires away from the truth which hath come unto thee. For each We have appointed a divine law and a traced-out way. Had Allah willed He could have made you one community. But that He may try you by that which He hath given you (He hath made you as ye are). So vie one with another in good works. Unto Allah ye will all return, and He will then inform you of that wherein ye differ.
Text2: Wherein there is no headache nor are they made mad thereby.

Text1: Let the People of the Gospel judge by that which Allah hath revealed therein. Whoso judgeth not by that which Allah hath revealed: such are evil-livers.
Text2: White, delicious to the drinkers,

Text1: Then will the believers say (unto the people of the Scripture): are these they who swore by Allah their most binding oaths that they were surely with you? Their works have failed, and they have become the losers.
Text2: Who used to say: Art thou in truth of those who put faith (in his words)?

Text1: O ye who believe! Be steadfast witnesses for Allah in equity, and let not hatred of any people seduce you that ye deal not justly. Deal justly, that is nearer to your duty. Observe your duty to Allah. Lo! Allah is Informed of what ye do.
Text2: With security from every froward devil.

Text1: Knowest thou not that unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth? He punisheth whom He will, and forgiveth whom He will. Allah is Able to do all things.
Text2: Ye are requited naught save what ye did -

Text1: Messengers indeed have been denied before thee, and they were patient under the denial and the persecution till Our succour reached them. There is none to alter the decisions of Allah. Already there hath reached thee (somewhat) of the tidings of the messengers (We sent before).
Text2: (And again of their falsehood): He hath preferred daughters to sons.

Text1: We know well how their talk grieveth thee, though in truth they deny not thee (Muhammad) but evil-doers flout the revelations of Allah.
Text2: Allah hath begotten. Allah! verily they tell a lie.

Text1: Had we sent down unto thee (Muhammad) (actual) writing upon parchment, so that they could feel it with their hands, those who disbelieve would have said: This is naught else than mere magic.
Text2: Allah, your Lord and Lord of your forefathers?

Text1: Say (O Muhammad): What thing is of most weight in testimony? Say: Allah is Witness between me and you. And this Quran hath been inspired in me, that I may warn therewith you and whomsoever it may reach. Do ye in sooth bear witness that there are gods beside Allah? Say: I bear no such witness. Say: He is only One Allah. Lo! I am innocent of that which ye associate (with Him).
Text2: And at night-time; have ye then no sense?

Text1: See how they lie against themselves, and (how) the thing which they devised hath failed them!
Text2: And had he not been one of those who glorify (Allah)

Text1: We send not the messengers save as bearers of good news and warners. Whoso believeth and doeth right, there shall no fear come upon them neither shall they grieve.
Text2: And indeed they used to say:

Text1: Never came there unto them a revelation of the revelations of Allah but they did turn away from it.
Text2: And lo! Elias was of those sent (to warn),

Text1: Those unto whom We gave the Scripture recognise (this revelation) as they recognise their sons. Those who ruin their own souls will not believe.
Text2: And lo! Jonah verily was of those sent (to warn)

Text1: Say: Shall I choose for a protecting friend other than Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, Who feedeth and is never fed? Say: I am ordered to be the first to surrender (unto Him). And be not thou (O Muhammad) of the idolaters.
Text2: And lo! Lot verily was of those sent (to warn).

Text1: He is the Omnipotent over His slaves, and He is the Wise, the Knower.
Text2: And lo! ye verily pass by (the ruin of) them in the morning

Text1: Then are they restored unto Allah, their Lord, the Just. Surely His is the judgment. And He is the most swift of reckoners.
Text2: And peace be unto those sent (to warn).

Text1: Say: Who delivereth you from the darkness of the land and the sea? Ye call upon Him humbly and in secret, (saying): If we are delivered from this (fear) we truly will be of the thankful.
Text2: And praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds!

Text1: And when those who believe in Our revelations come unto thee, say: Peace be unto you! Your Lord hath prescribed for Himself mercy, that whoso of you doeth evil through ignorance and repenteth afterward thereof and doeth right, (for him) lo! He is Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: And that Our host, they verily would be the victors.

Text1: Then will they have no contention save that they will say: By Allah, our Lord, we never were idolaters.
Text2: And the fish swallowed him while he was blameworthy;

Text1: And on the day We gather them together We shall say unto those who ascribed partners (unto Allah): Where are (now) those partners of your make-believe?
Text2: And then drew lots and was of those rejected;

Text1: And they say: There is naught save our life of the world, and we shall not be raised (again).
Text2: And they believed, therefor We gave them comfort for a while.

Text1: Those who deny Our revelations are deaf and dumb in darkness. Whom Allah will sendeth astray, and whom He will He placeth on a straight path.
Text2: And they imagine kinship between him and the jinn, whereas the jinn know well that they will be brought before (Him).

Text1: Repel not those who call upon their Lord at morn and evening, seeking His Countenance. Thou art not accountable for them in aught, nor are they accountable for thee in aught, that thou shouldst repel them and be of the wrong-doers.
Text2: And verily Our word went forth of old unto Our bondmen sent (to warn)

Text1: He it is Who gathereth you at night and knoweth that which ye commit by day. Then He raiseth you again to life therein, that the term appointed (for you) may be accomplished. And afterward unto Him is your return. Then He will proclaim unto you what ye used to do.
Text2: And watch, for they will (soon) see.

Text1: Say: I am forbidden to worship those on whom ye call instead of Allah. Say: I will not follow your desires, for then should I go astray and I should not be of the rightly guided.
Text2: And watch, for they will (soon) see.

Text1: If thou couldst see when they are set before the Fire and say: Oh, would that we might return! Then would we not deny the revelations of our Lord but we would be of the believers!
Text2: And We caused a tree of gourd to grow above him;

Text1: Messengers (of Allah) have been derided before thee, but that whereat they scoffed surrounded such of them as did deride.
Text2: And we left for him among the later folk (the salutation):

Text1: Nay, but that hath become clear unto them which before they used to hide. And if they were sent back they would return unto that which they are forbidden. Lo! they are liars.
Text2: And We sent him to a hundred thousand (folk) or more

Text1: They say: Why hath not an angel been sent down unto him? If We sent down an angel, then the matter would be judged; no further time would be allowed them (for reflection).
Text2: But they denied him, so they surely will be haled forth (to the doom)

Text1: Say: If I had that for which ye are impatient, then would the case (ere this) have been decided between me and you. Allah is Best Aware of the wrong-doers.
Text2: But when it cometh home to them, then it will be a hapless morn for those who have been warned.

Text1: Say: Can ye see yourselves, if the punishment of Allah come upon you or the Hour come upon you, (calling upon other than Allah)? Do ye then call (for help) to any other than Allah? (Answer that) if ye are truthful.
Text2: Glorified be Allah from that which they attribute (unto Him),

Text1: He is the Omnipotent over His slaves. He sendeth guardians over you until, when death cometh unto one of you, Our messengers receive him, and they neglect not.
Text2: Glorified be thy Lord, the Lord of Majesty, from that which they attribute (unto Him)

Text1: Of them are some who listen unto thee, but We have placed upon their hearts veils, lest they should understand, and in their ears a deafness. If they saw every token they would not believe therein; to the point that, when they come unto thee to argue with thee, the disbelievers say: This is naught else than fables of the men of old.
Text2: He would have tarried in its belly till the day when they are raised;

Text1: But as for those who deny Our revelations, torment will afflict them for that they used to disobey.
Text2: If we had but a reminder from the men of old

Text1: Unto Him belongeth whatsoever resteth in the night and the day. He is the Hearer, the Knower.
Text2: Lo! he is one of our believing slaves.

Text1: Naught is the life of the world save a pastime and a spot. Better far is the abode of the Hereafter for those who keep their duty (to Allah). Have ye then no sense?
Text2: Lo! it is of their falsehood that they say:

Text1: He is Allah in the heavens and in the earth. He knoweth both your secret and your utterance, and He knoweth what ye earn.
Text2: Lo! they are two of Our believing slaves.

Text1: He it is Who hath created you from clay, and hath decreed a term for you. A term is fixed with Him. Yet still ye doubt!
Text2: Lo! thus do We reward the good.

Text1: Say: Unto whom belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth? Say: Unto Allah. He hath prescribed for Himself mercy, that He may bring you all together to the Day of Resurrection whereof there is no doubt. Those who ruin their souls will not believe.
Text2: Lo! thus do We reward the good.

Text1: We have sent already unto peoples that were before thee, and We visited them with tribulation and adversity, in order that they might grow humble.
Text2: Lo! verily, ye and that which ye worship,

Text1: Say: Can ye see yourselves, if the punishment of Allah come upon you unawares or openly? Would any perish save wrongdoing folk?
Text2: Lo! we, even we are they who hymn His praise

Text1: Say: Have ye imagined, if Allah should take away your hearing and your sight and seal your hearts, Who is the Allah Who could restore it to you save Allah? See how We display the revelations unto them! Yet still they turn away.
Text2: Lo! we, even we are they who set the ranks,

Text1: If thou couldst see when they are set before their Lord! He will say: Is not this real? They will say: Yea, verily, by our Lord! He will say: Taste now the retribution for that ye used to disbelieve.
Text2: Now ask them (O Muhammad): Hath thy Lord daughters whereas they have sons?

Text1: They indeed are losers who deny their meeting with Allah until, when the Hour cometh on them suddenly, they cry: Alas for us, that we neglected it! They bear upon their backs their burdens. Ah, evil is that which they bear!
Text2: Or created We the angels females while they were present?

Text1: They say: Why hath no portent been sent down upon him from his Lord? Say: Lo! Allah is Able to send down a portent. But most of them know not.
Text2: Or have ye a clear warrant?

Text1: Say (unto the disbelievers): Travel in the land, and see the nature of the consequence for the rejecters!
Text2: Peace be unto Elias!

Text1: Praise be to Allah, Who hath created the heavens and the earth, and hath appointed darkness and light. Yet those who disbelieve ascribe rivals unto their Lord.
Text2: Peace be unto Moses and Aaron!

Text1: He from whom (such retribution) is averted on that day, (Allah) hath in truth had mercy on him. That will be the signal triumph.
Text2: Save an old woman among those who stayed behind;

Text1: Then, when they forgot that whereof they had been reminded, We opened unto them the gates of all things till, even as they were rejoicing in that which they were given, We seized them unawares, and lo! they were dumbfounded.
Text2: Save him who is to burn in hell.

Text1: Had we appointed him (Our messenger) an angel, We assuredly had made him (as) a man (that he might speak to men); and (thus) obscured for them (the truth) they (now) obscure.
Text2: Save single-minded slaves of Allah.

Text1: Nay, but unto Him ye call, and He removeth that because of which ye call unto Him, if He will, and ye forget whatever partners ye ascribed unto Him.
Text2: Save single-minded slaves of Allah.

Text1: Thus do We expound the revelations that the way of the unrighteous may be manifest.
Text2: So withdraw from them (O Muhammad) awhile,

Text1: And even so do We try some of them by others, that they say: Are these they whom Allah favoureth among us? Is not Allah best Aware of the thanksgivers?
Text2: That they verily would be helped,

Text1: There is not an animal in the earth, nor a flying creature flying on two wings, but they are peoples like unto you. We have neglected nothing in the Book (of Our decrees). Then unto their Lord they will be gathered.
Text2: Then produce your writ, if ye are truthful.

Text1: And they forbid (men) from it and avoid it, and they ruin none save themselves, though they perceive not.
Text2: Then We cast him on a desert shore while he was sick;

Text1: If Allah touch thee with affliction, there is none that can relieve therefrom save Him, and if He touch thee with good fortune (there is none that can impair it); for He is Able to do all things.
Text2: Then We destroyed the others.

Text1: So of the people who did wrong the last remnant was cut off. Praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds!
Text2: There is not one of us but hath his known position.

Text1: Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): I say not unto you (that) I possess the treasures of Allah, nor that I have knowledge of the Unseen; and I say not unto you: Lo! I am an angel. I follow only that which is inspired in me. Say: Are the blind man and the seer equal? Will ye not then take thought?
Text2: We would be single-minded slaves of Allah.

Text1: And if their aversion is grievous unto thee, then, if thou canst, seek a way down into the earth or a ladder unto the sky that thou mayst bring unto them a portent (to convince them all)! - If Allah willed, He could have brought them all together to the guidance - So be not thou among the foolish ones.
Text2: What aileth you? How judge ye?

Text1: Who doth greater wrong than he who inventeth a lie against Allah or denieth His revelations? Lo! the wrongdoers will not be successful.
Text2: When he fled unto the laden ship,

Text1: And they denied the truth when it came unto them. But there will come unto them the tidings of that which they used to deride.
Text2: When he said unto his folk: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

Text1: Say: I fear, if I rebel against my Lord, the retribution of an Awful Day.
Text2: When We saved him and his household, every one,

Text1: See they not how many a generation We destroyed before them, whom We had established in the earth more firmly than We have established you, and We shed on them abundant showers from the sky, and made the rivers flow beneath them. Yet we destroyed them for their sins, and created after them another generation.
Text2: Will ye cry unto Baal and forsake the Best of creators,

Text1: Only those can accept who hear. As for the dead, Allah will raise them up; then unto Him they will be returned.
Text2: Will ye not then reflect?

Text1: And with Him are the keys of the Invisible. None but He knoweth them. And He knoweth what is in the land and the sea. Not a leaf falleth but He knoweth it, not a grain amid the darkness of the earth, naught of wet or dry but (it is noted) in a clear record.
Text2: Withdraw from them awhile

Text1: Say: I am (relying) on clear proof from my Lord, while ye deny Him. I have not that for which ye are impatient. The decision is for Allah only. He telleth the truth and He is the Best of Deciders.
Text2: Would they hasten on Our doom?

Text1: If only, when Our disaster came on them, they had been humble! But their hearts were hardened and the devil made all that they used to do seem fair unto them!
Text2: Ye cannot excite (anyone) against Him.

Text1: Warn hereby those who fear (because they know) that they will be gathered unto their Lord, for whom there is no protecting ally nor intercessor beside Him, that they may ward off (evil).
Text2: Yet (now that it is come) they disbelieve therein; but they will come to know.

Text1: Those are they unto whom We gave the Scripture and command and prophethood. But if these disbelieve therein, then indeed We shall entrust it to a people who will not be disbelievers therein.
Text2: (And it was said unto him): O David! Lo! We have set thee as a viceroy in the earth; therefor judge aright between mankind, and follow not desire that it beguile thee from the way of Allah. Lo! those who wander from the way of Allah have an awful doom, forasmuch as they forgot the Day of Reckoning.

Text1: Thus do We display Our revelations that they may say (unto thee, Muhammad): "Thou hast studied," and that We may make (it) clear for people who have knowledge.
Text2: (And it was said unto him): Strike the ground with thy foot. This (spring) is a cool bath and a refreshing drink.

Text1: With some of their forefathers and their offspring and their brethren; and We chose them and guided them unto a straight path.
Text2: (David) said: He hath wronged thee in demanding thine ewe in addition to his ewes, and lo! many partners oppress one another, save such as believe and do good works, and they are few. And David guessed that We had tried him, and he sought forgiveness of his Lord, and he bowed himself and fell down prostrate and repented.

Text1: Such is Allah, your Lord. There is no Allah save Him, the Creator of all things, so worship Him. And He taketh care of all things.
Text2: (Saying): This is Our gift, so bestow thou, or withhold, without reckoning.

Text1: He is the Cleaver of the Daybreak, and He hath appointed the night for stillness, and the sun and the moon for reckoning. That is the measuring of the Mighty, the Wise.
Text2: (Then he said): Bring them back to me, and fell to slashing (with his sword their) legs and necks.

Text1: And this is a blessed Scripture which We have revealed, confirming that which (was revealed) before it, that thou mayst warn the Mother of Villages and those around her. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe herein, and they are careful of their worship.
Text2: (This is) a Scripture that We have revealed unto thee, full of blessing, that they may ponder its revelations, and that men of understanding may reflect.

Text1: (Remember) when Abraham said unto his father Azar: Takest thou idols for gods? Lo! I see thee and thy folk in error manifest.
Text2: A defeated host are (all) the factions that are there.

Text1: Had Allah willed, they had not been idolatrous. We have not set thee as a keeper over them, nor art thou responsible for them.
Text2: And (it was said unto him): Take in thine hand a branch and smite therewith, and break not thine oath. Lo! We found him steadfast, how excellent a slave! Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (to his Lord).

Text1: When the night grew dark upon him he beheld a star. He said: This is my Lord. But when it set, he said: I love not things that set.
Text2: And (the tribe of) Thamud, and the folk of Lot, and the dwellers in the wood: these were the factions.

Text1: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob; each of them We guided; and Noah did We guide aforetime; and of his seed (We guided) David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the good.
Text2: And hath the story of the litigants come unto thee? How they climbed the wall into the royal chamber;

Text1: Lo! Allah (it is) Who splitteth the grain of corn and the date-stone (for sprouting). He bringeth forth the living from the dead, and is the bringer-forth of the dead from the living. Such is Allah. How then are ye perverted?
Text2: And he said: Lo! I have preferred the good things (of the world) to the remembrance of my Lord; till they were taken out of sight behind the curtain.

Text1: Vision comprehendeth Him not, but He comprehendeth (all) vision. He is the Subtile, the Aware.
Text2: And lo! he hath favour with Us, and a happy journey_s end.

Text1: He it is Who produceth gardens trellised and untrellised, and the date-palm, and crops of divers flavour, and the olive and the pomegranate, like and unlike. Eat ye of the fruit thereof when it fruiteth, and pay the due thereof upon the harvest day, and be not prodigal. Lo! Allah loveth not the prodigals.
Text2: And lo! My curse is on thee till the Day of Judgment.

Text1: Proofs have come unto you from your Lord, so whoso seeth, it is for his own good, and whoso is blind is blind to his own hurt. And I am not a keeper over you.
Text2: And make mention (O Muhammad) of Our bondman Job, when he cried unto his Lord (saying): Lo! the devil doth afflict me with distress and torment.

Text1: And though We should send down the angels unto them, and the dead should speak unto them, and We should gather against them all things in array, they would not believe unless Allah so willed. Howbeit, most of them are ignorant.
Text2: And make mention of Ishmael and Elisha and Dhu_l-Kifl. All are of the chosen.

Text1: Revile not those unto whom they pray beside Allah lest they wrongfully revile Allah through ignorance. Thus unto every nation have We made their deed seem fair. Then unto their Lord is their return, and He will tell them what they used to do.
Text2: And make mention of Our bondmen, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of parts and vision.

Text1: And eat not of that whereon Allah_s name hath not been mentioned, for lo! it is abomination. Lo! the devils do inspire their minions to dispute with you. But if ye obey them, ye will be in truth idolaters.
Text2: And other (torment) of the kind in pairs (the two extremes)!

Text1: The Originator of the heavens and the earth! How can He have a child, when there is for Him no consort, when He created all things and is Aware of all things?
Text2: And others linked together in chains,

Text1: Those who believe and obscure not their belief by wrongdoing, theirs is safety; and they are rightly guided.
Text2: And the birds assembled; all were turning unto Him.

Text1: Yet they ascribe as partners unto Him the jinn, although He did create them, and impute falsely, without knowledge, sons and daughters unto Him. Glorified be He and High Exalted above (all) that they ascribe (unto Him).
Text2: And the unruly, every builder and diver (made We subservient),

Text1: For every announcement there is a term, and ye will come to know.
Text2: And they marvel that a warner from among themselves hath come unto them, and the disbelievers say: This is a wizard, a charlatan.

Text1: And whomsoever it is Allah_s will to guide, He expandeth his bosom unto the Surrender, and whomsoever it is His Will to send astray, He maketh his bosom close and narrow as if he were engaged in sheer ascent. Thus Allah layeth ignominy upon those who believe not.
Text2: And they say: What aileth us that we behold not men whom we were wont to count among the wicked?

Text1: And He it is Who hath set for you the stars that ye may guide your course by them amid the darkness of the land and the sea. We have detailed Our revelations for a people who have knowledge.
Text2: And verily We tried Solomon, and set upon his throne a (mere) body. Then did he repent.

Text1: Who is guilty of more wrong than he who forgeth a lie against Allah, or saith: I am inspired, when he is not inspired in aught; and who saith: I will reveal the like of that which Allah hath revealed? If thou couldst see, when the wrong-doers reach the pangs of death and the angels stretch their hands out (saying): Deliver up your souls. This day ye are awarded doom of degradation for that ye spake concerning Allah other than the truth, and used to scorn His portents.
Text2: And We bestowed on David, Solomon. How excellent a slave! Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (toward Allah).

Text1: Follow that which is inspired in thee from thy Lord; there is no Allah save Him; and turn away from the idolaters.
Text2: And We bestowed on him (again) his household and therewith the like thereof, a mercy from Us, and a memorial for men of understanding.

Text1: Those are they whom Allah guideth, so follow their guidance. Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I ask of you no fee for it. Lo! it is naught but a Reminder to (His) creatures.
Text2: And We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is between them in vain. That is the opinion of those who disbelieve. And woe unto those who disbelieve, from the Fire!

Text1: Say (O Muhammad): O my people! Work according to your power. Lo! I too am working. Thus ye will come to know for which of us will be the happy sequel. Lo! the wrong-doers will not be successful.
Text2: And when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My Spirit, then fall down before him prostrate,

Text1: Perfected is the Word of thy Lord in truth and justice. There is naught that can change His words. He is the Hearer, the Knower.
Text2: And with them are those of modest gaze, companions.

Text1: Say: Come, I will recite unto you that which your Lord hath made a sacred duty for you: That ye ascribe no thing as partner unto Him and that ye do good to parents, and that ye slay not your children because of penury - We provide for you and for them - and that ye draw not nigh to lewd things whether open or concealed. And that ye slay not the life which Allah hath made sacred, save in the course of justice. This He hath command you, in order that ye may discern.
Text2: And ye will come in time to know the truth thereof.

Text1: His people argued with him. He said: Dispute ye with me concerning Allah when He hath guided me? I fear not at all that which ye set up beside Him unless my Lord willeth aught. My Lord includeth all things in His knowledge. Will ye not then remember?
Text2: Bear with what they say, and remember Our bondman David, lord of might, Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (toward Allah).

Text1: This is the path of thy Lord, a straight path. We have detailed Our revelations for a people who take heed.
Text2: Did we take them (wrongly) for a laughing-stock, or have our eyes missed them?

Text1: That the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter may incline thereto, and that they may take pleasure therein, and that they may earn what they are earning.
Text2: Gardens of Eden, whereof the gates are opened for them,

Text1: Say: Shall we cry, instead of unto Allah, unto that which neither profiteth us nor hurteth us, and shall we turn back after Allah hath guided us, like one bewildered whom the devils have infatuated in the earth, who hath companions who invite him to the guidance (saying): Come unto us? Say: Lo! the guidance of Allah is Guidance, and we are ordered to surrender to the Lord of the Worlds,
Text2: Hath the reminder been unto him (alone) among us? Nay, but they are in doubt concerning My reminder; nay but they have not yet tasted My doom.

Text1: They are losers who besottedly have slain their children without knowledge, and have forbidden that which Allah bestowed upon them, inventing a lie against Allah. They indeed have gone astray and are not guided.
Text2: He said: Go forth from hence, for lo! thou art outcast,

Text1: And they say: That which is in the bellies of such cattle is reserved for our males and is forbidden to our wives; but if it be born dead, then they (all) may be partakers thereof. He will reward them for their attribution (of such ordinances unto Him). Lo, He is Wise, Aware.
Text2: He said: I am better than him. Thou createdst me of fire, whilst him Thou didst create of clay.

Text1: Eight pairs: Of the sheep twain, and of the goats twain. Say: Hath He forbidden the two males or the two females, or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Expound to me (the case) with knowledge, if ye are truthful.
Text2: He said: Lo! thou art of those reprieved

Text1: And He it is Who hath produced you from a single being, and (hath given you) a habitation and a repository. We have detailed Our revelations for a people who have understanding.
Text2: He said: My Lord! Forgive me and bestow on me sovereignty such as shall not belong to any after me. Lo! Thou art the Bestower.

Text1: And of the cattle (He produceth) some for burdens, some for food. Eat of that which Allah hath bestowed upon you, and follow not the footsteps of the devil, for lo! he is an open foe to you.
Text2: He said: My Lord! Reprieve me till the day when they are raised.

Text1: And they say: Such cattle and crops are forbidden. No-one is to eat of them save whom we will - in their make-believe - cattle whose backs are forbidden, cattle over which they mention not the name of Allah. (All that is) a lie against Him. He will repay them for that which they invent.
Text2: He said: O Iblis! What hindereth thee from falling prostrate before that which I have created with both My hands? Art thou too proud or art thou of the high exalted?

Text1: So if they give the lie to thee (Muhammad), say: Your Lord is a Lord of All-Embracing Mercy, and His wrath will never be withdrawn from guilty folk.
Text2: He said: The Truth is, and the Truth I speak,

Text1: Say: I find not in that which is revealed unto me aught prohibited to an eater that he eat thereof, except it be carrion, or blood poured forth, or swineflesh - for that verily is foul - or the abomination which was immolated to the name of other than Allah. But whoso is compelled (thereto), neither craving nor transgressing, (for him) lo! thy Lord is Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: He said: Then, by Thy might, I surely will beguile them every one,

Text1: How should ye not eat of that over which the name of Allah hath been mentioned, when He hath explained unto you that which is forbidden unto you unless ye are compelled thereto. But lo! many are led astray by their own lusts through ignorance. Lo! thy Lord, He is Best Aware of the transgressors.
Text2: Hell, where they will burn, an evil resting-place.

Text1: Forsake the outwardness of sin and the inwardness thereof. Lo! those who garner sin will be awarded that which they have earned.
Text2: Here is a boiling and an ice-cold draught, so let them taste it,

Text1: Is he who was dead and We have raised him unto life, and set for him a light wherein he walketh among men, as him whose similitude is in utter darkness whence he cannot emerge? Thus is their conduct made fairseeming for the disbelievers.
Text2: Here is an army rushing blindly with you. (Those who are already in the Fire say): No word of welcome for them. Lo! they will roast at the Fire.

Text1: Thy people (O Muhammad) have denied it, though it is the Truth. Say: I am not put in charge of you.
Text2: How many a generation We destroyed before them, and they cried out when it was no longer the time for escape!

Text1: And Zachariah and John and Jesus and Elias. Each one (of them) was of the righteous.
Text2: How they burst in upon David, and he was afraid of them. They said: Be not afraid! (We are) two litigants, one of whom hath wronged the other, therefor judge aright between us; be not unjust; and show us the fair way.

Text1: For all there will be ranks from what they did. Thy Lord is not unaware of what they do.
Text2: I had no knowledge of the Highest Chiefs when they disputed;

Text1: Thy Lord is the Absolute, the Lord of Mercy. If He will, He can remove you and can cause what He will to follow after you, even as He raised you from the seed of other folk.
Text2: It is revealed unto me only that I may be a plain warner.

Text1: We confound their hearts and their eyes. As they believed not therein at the first, We let them wander blindly on in their contumacy.
Text2: Lo! in Our sight they are verily of the elect, the excellent.

Text1: Say: Come, bring your witnesses who can bear witness that Allah forbade (all) this. And if they bear witness, do not thou bear witness with them. Follow thou not the whims of those who deny Our revelations, those who believe not in the Hereafter and deem (others) equal with their Lord.
Text2: Lo! it is naught else than a reminder for all peoples

Text1: For them is the abode of peace with their Lord. He will be their Protecting Friend because of what they used to do.
Text2: Lo! that is very truth: the wrangling of the dwellers in the Fire.

Text1: Lo! thy Lord, He knoweth best who erreth from His way; and He knoweth best (who are) the rightly guided.
Text2: Lo! this in truth is Our provision, which will never waste away.

Text1: And Ishmael and Elisha and Jonah and Lot. Each one (of them) did We prefer above (Our) creatures,
Text2: Lo! this my brother hath ninety and nine ewes while I had one ewe; and he said: Entrust it to me, and he conquered me in speech.

Text1: And they swear a solemn oath by Allah that if there come unto them a portent they will believe therein. Say; Portents are with Allah and (so is) that which telleth you that if such came unto them they would not believe.
Text2: Lo! We purified them with a pure thought, remembrance of the Home (of the Hereafter).

Text1: How should I fear that which ye set up beside Him, when ye fear not to set up beside Allah that for which He hath revealed unto you no warrant? Which of the two factions hath more right to safety? (Answer me that) if ye have knowledge.
Text2: Lo! We subdued the hills to hymn the praises (of their Lord) with him at nightfall and sunrise,

Text1: Thus We let some of the wrong-doers have power over others because of what they are wont to earn.
Text2: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Mighty, the Pardoning.

Text1: And when thou seest those who meddle with Our revelations, withdraw from them until they meddle with another topic. And if the devil cause thee to forget, sit not, after the remembrance, with the congregation of wrong-doers.
Text2: Maketh he the gods One Allah? Lo! that is an astounding thing.

Text1: Say: He is able to send punishment upon you from above you or from beneath your feet, or to bewilder you with dissension and make you taste the tyranny one of another. See how We display the revelations so that they may understand.
Text2: Nay, but those who disbelieve are in false pride and schism.

Text1: And when he saw the moon uprising, he exclaimed: This is my Lord. But when it set, he said: Unless my Lord guide me, I surely shall become one of the folk who are astray.
Text2: Not one of them but did deny the messengers, therefor My doom was justified,

Text1: And to establish worship and be dutiful to Him, and He it is unto Whom ye will be gathered.
Text2: Or are theirs the treasures of the mercy of thy Lord, the Mighty, the Bestower?

Text1: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in truth. In the day when He saith: Be! it is. His Word is the Truth, and His will be the Sovereignty on the day when the trumpet is blown. Knower of the Invisible and the Visible, He is the Wise, the Aware.
Text2: Or is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them theirs? Then let them ascend by ropes!

Text1: Say: Allah delivereth you from this and from all affliction. Yet ye attribute partners unto Him.
Text2: Sad. By the renowned Quran,

Text1: Unto those who are Jews We forbade every animal with claws. And of the oxen and the sheep forbade We unto them the fat thereof save that upon the backs or the entrails, or that which is mixed with the bone. That we awarded them for their rebellion. And lo! we verily are truthful.
Text2: Save Thy single-minded slaves among them.

Text1: Thus have their (so-called) partners (of Allah) made the killing of their children to seem fair unto many of the idolaters, that they may ruin them and make their faith obscure for them. Had Allah willed (it otherwise), they had not done so. So leave them alone with their devices.
Text2: Saving Iblis; he was scornful and became one of the disbelievers.

Text1: Say - For Allah_s is the final argument - Had He willed He could indeed have guided all of you.
Text2: Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I ask of you no fee for this, and I am no simulating.

Text1: In the day when He will gather them together (He will say): O ye assembly of the jinn! Many of humankind did ye seduce. And their adherents among humankind will say: Our Lord! We enjoyed one another, but now we have arrived at the appointed term which Thou appointedst for us. He will say: Fire is your home. Abide therein for ever, save him whom Allah willeth (to deliver). Lo! thy Lord is Wise, Aware.
Text2: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): I am only a warner, and there is no Allah save Allah, the One, the Absolute,

Text1: O ye assembly of the jinn and humankind! Came there not unto you messengers of your own who recounted unto you My tokens and warned you of the meeting of this your Day? They will say: We testify against ourselves. And the life of the world beguiled them. And they testify against themselves that they were disbelievers.
Text2: Say: It is tremendous tidings

Text1: And they measure not the power of Allah its true measure when they say: Allah hath naught revealed unto a human being. Say (unto the Jews who speak thus): Who revealed the Book which Moses brought, a light and guidance for mankind, which ye have put on parchments which ye show, but ye hide much (thereof), and (by which) ye were taught that which ye knew not yourselves nor (did) your fathers (know it)? Say: Allah. Then leave them to their play of cavilling.
Text2: Shall We treat those who believe and do good works as those who spread corruption in the earth; or shall We treat the pious as the wicked?

Text1: Such is the guidance of Allah wherewith He guideth whom He will of His bondmen. But if they had set up (for worship) aught beside Him, (all) that they did would have been vain.
Text2: So We forgave him that; and lo! he had access to Our presence and a happy journey_s end.

Text1: He it is Who sendeth down water from the sky, and therewith We bring forth buds of every kind; We bring forth the green blade from which We bring forth the thick-clustered grain; and from the date-palm, from the pollen thereof, spring pendant bunches; and (We bring forth) gardens of grapes, and the olive and the pomegranate, alike and unlike. Look upon the fruit thereof, when they bear fruit, and upon its ripening. Lo! herein verily are portents for a people who believe.
Text2: So We made the wind subservient unto him, setting fair by his command whithersoever he intended.

Text1: They who are idolaters will say: Had Allah willed, we had not ascribed (unto Him) partners neither had our fathers, nor had we forbidden aught. Thus did those who were before them give the lie (to Allah_s messengers) till they tasted of the fear of Us. Say: Have ye any knowledge that ye can adduce for Us? Lo! ye follow naught but an opinion, Lo! ye do but guess.
Text2: That I shall fill hell with thee and with such of them as follow thee, together.

Text1: They assign unto Allah, of the crops and cattle which He created, a portion, and they say: "This is Allah_s" - in their make-believe - "and this is for (His) partners in regard to us." Thus that which (they assign) unto His partners in them reacheth not Allah and that which (they assign) unto Allah goeth to their (so-called) partners. Evil is their ordinance.
Text2: The angels fell down prostrate, every one,

Text1: Those who ward off (evil) are not accountable for them in aught, but the Reminder (must be given them) that haply they (too) may ward off (evil).
Text2: The chiefs among them go about, exhorting: Go and be staunch to your gods! Lo! this is a thing designed.

Text1: Thus did We show Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth that he might be of those possessing certainty:
Text2: The folk of Noah before them denied (their messenger) and (so did the tribe of) A_ad, and Pharaoh firmly planted,

Text1: And when he saw the sun uprising, he cried: This is my Lord! This is greater! And when it set he exclaimed: O my people! Lo! I am free from all that ye associate (with Him).
Text2: These wait for but one Shout, there will be no second thereto.

Text1: And thus have We made in every city great ones of its wicked ones, that they should plot therein. They do but plot against themselves, though they perceive not.
Text2: They say: Nay, but you (misleaders), for you there is no word of welcome. Ye prepared this for us (by your misleading). Now hapless is the plight.

Text1: Lo! I have turned my face toward Him Who created the heavens and the earth, as one by nature upright, and I am not of the idolaters.
Text2: They say: Our Lord! Hasten on for us our fate before the Day of Reckoning.

Text1: And when a token cometh unto them, they say: We will not believe till we are given that which Allah_s messengers are given. Allah knoweth best with whom to place His message. Humiliation from Allah and heavy punishment will smite the guilty for their scheming.
Text2: They say: Our Lord! Whoever did prepare this for us, oh, give him double portion of the Fire!

Text1: Eat of that over which the name of Allah hath been mentioned, if ye are believers in His revelations.
Text2: This (is for the righteous). And lo! for the transgressors there with be an evil journey_s end,

Text1: Thus have We appointed unto every prophet an adversary - devils of humankind and jinn who inspire in one another plausible discourse through guile. If thy Lord willed, they would not do so; so leave them alone with their devising;
Text2: This is a reminder. And lo! for those who ward off (evil) is a happy journey_s end,

Text1: If thou obeyedst most of those on earth they would mislead thee far from Allah_s way. They follow naught but an opinion, and they do but guess.
Text2: This it is that ye are promised for the Day of Reckoning.

Text1: And of the camels twain and of the oxen twain. Say: Hath He forbidden the two males or the two females, or that which the wombs of the two females contain; or were ye by to witness when Allah commanded you (all) this? Then who doth greater wrong than he who deviseth a lie concerning Allah, that he may lead mankind astray without knowledge. Lo! Allah guideth not wrongdoing folk.
Text2: Until the day of the time appointed.

Text1: And forsake those who take their religion for a pastime and a jest, and whom the life of the world beguileth. Remind (mankind) hereby lest a soul be destroyed by what it earneth. It hath beside Allah no protecting ally nor intercessor, and though it offer every compensation it will not be accepted from it. Those are they who perish by their own deserts. For them is drink of boiling water and a painful doom, because they disbelieved.
Text2: We have not heard of this in later religion. This is naught but an invention.

Text1: That is Our argument. We gave it unto Abraham against his folk. We raise unto degrees of wisdom whom We will. Lo! thy Lord is Wise, Aware.
Text2: We made his kingdom strong and gave him wisdom and decisive speech.

Text1: Now have ye come unto Us solitary as We did create you at the first, and ye have left behind you all that We bestowed upon you, and We behold not with you those your intercessors, of whom ye claimed that they possessed a share in you. Now is the bond between you severed, and that which ye presumed hath failed you.
Text2: When there were shown to him at eventide lightfooted coursers

Text1: Lo! that which ye are promised will surely come to pass, and ye cannot escape.
Text2: When thy Lord said unto the angels: Lo! I am about to create a mortal out of mire,

Text1: This is because thy Lord destroyeth not the townships arbitrarily while their people are unconscious (of the wrong they do).
Text2: Whence ye turn away!

Text1: Shall I seek other than Allah for judge, when He it is Who hath revealed unto you (this) Scripture, fully explained? Those unto whom We gave the Scripture (aforetime) know that it is revealed from thy Lord in truth. So be not thou (O Muhammad) of the waverers.
Text2: Wherein, reclining, they call for plenteous fruit and cool drink (that is) therein.

Text1: He hath no partner. This am I commanded, and I am first of those who surrender (unto Him).
Text2: And I am commanded to be the first of those who are muslims (surrender unto Him).

Text1: Lo! As for those who sunder their religion and become schismatics, no concern at all hast thou with them. Their case will go to Allah, Who then will tell them what they used to do.
Text2: And when some hurt toucheth man, he crieth unto his Lord, turning unto Him (repentant). Then, when He granteth him a boon from Him he forgetteth that for which he cried unto Him before, and setteth up rivals to Allah that he may beguile (men) from his way. Say (O Muhammad, unto such an one): Take pleasure in thy disbelief a while. Lo! thou art of the owners of the Fire.

Text1: Or lest ye should say: If the Scripture had been revealed unto us, we surely had been better guided than are they. Now hath there come unto you a clear proof from your Lord, a guidance and mercy; and who doeth greater wrong than he who denieth the revelations of Allah, and turneth away from them? We award unto those who turn away from Our revelations an evil doom because of their aversion.
Text2: He created you from one being, then from that (being) He made its mate; and He hath provided for you of cattle eight kinds. He created you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, in a threefold gloom. Such is Allah, your Lord. His is the Sovereignty. There is no Allah save Him. How then are ye turned away?

Text1: Lest ye should say: The Scripture was revealed only to two sects before us, and we in sooth were unaware of what they read;
Text2: He hath created the heavens and the earth with truth. He maketh night to succeed day, and He maketh day to succeed night, and He constraineth the sun and the moon to give service, each running on for an appointed term. Is not He the Mighty, the Forgiver?

Text1: And this is a blessed Scripture which We have revealed. So follow it and ward off (evil), that ye may find mercy.
Text2: If Allah had willed to choose a son, He could have chosen what He would of that which He hath created. Be He Glorified! He is Allah, the One, the Absolute.

Text1: Wait they, indeed, for nothing less than that the angels should come unto them, or thy Lord should come, or there should come one of the portents from thy Lord? In the day when one of the portents from thy Lord cometh, its belief availeth naught a soul which theretofore believed not, nor in its belief earned good (by works). Say: Wait ye! Lo! We (too) are waiting.
Text2: If ye are thankless, yet Allah is Independent of you, though He is not pleased with thanklessness for His bondmen; and if ye are thankful He is pleased therewith for you. No laden soul will bear another_s load. Then unto your Lord is your return; and He will tell you what ye used to do. Lo! He knoweth what is in the breasts (of men).

Text1: Whoso bringeth a good deed will receive tenfold the like thereof, while whoso bringeth an ill-deed will be awarded but the like thereof; and they will not be wronged.
Text2: Is he who payeth adoration in the watches of the night, prostrate and standing, bewaring of the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, (to be accounted equal with a disbeliever)? Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Are those who know equal with those who know not? But only men of understanding will pay heed.

Text1: And (He commandeth you, saying): This is My straight path, so follow it. Follow not other ways, lest ye be parted from His way. This hath He ordained for you, that ye may ward off (evil).
Text2: Lo! We have revealed the Scripture unto thee (Muhammad) with truth; so worship Allah, making religion pure for Him (only).

Text1: Say: Lo! my worship and my sacrifice and my living and my dying are for Allah, Lord of the Worlds.
Text2: Say (O Muhammad): Lo! I am commanded to worship Allah, making religion pure for Him (only).

Text1: He it is Who hath placed you as viceroys of the earth and hath exalted some of you in rank above others, that He may try you by (the test of) that which He hath given you. Lo! Thy Lord is swift in prosecution, and Lo! He verily is Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: Say: Allah I worship, making my religion pure for Him (only).

Text1: Say: Shall I seek another than Allah for Lord, when He is Lord of all things? Each soul earneth only on its own account, nor doth any laden bear another_s load. Then unto your Lord is your return and He will tell you that wherein ye differed.
Text2: Say: Lo! if I should disobey my Lord, I fear the doom of a tremendous Day.

Text1: Say: Lo! As for me, my Lord hath guided me unto a straight path, a right religion, the community of Abraham, the upright, who was no idolater.
Text2: Say: O My bondmen who believe! Observe your duty to your Lord. For those who do good in this world there is good, and Allah_s earth is spacious. Verily the steadfast will be paid their wages without stint.

Text1: Again, We gave the Scripture unto Moses, complete for him who would do good, an explanation of all things, a guidance and a mercy, that they might believe in the meeting with their Lord.
Text2: Surely pure religion is for Allah only. And those who choose protecting friends beside Him (say): We worship them only that they may bring us near unto Allah. Lo! Allah will judge between them concerning that wherein they differ. Lo! Allah guideth not him who is a liar, an ingrate.

Text1: And approach not the wealth of the orphan save with that which is better, till he reach maturity. Give full measure and full weight, in justice. We task not any soul beyond its scope. And if ye give your word, do justice thereunto, even though it be (against) a kinsman; and fulfil the covenant of Allah. This He commandeth you that haply ye may remember.
Text2: The revelation of the Scripture is from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.

Text1: Who debar (men) from the path of Allah and would have it crooked, and who are disbelievers in the Last Day.
Text2: (But now the answer will be): Nay, for My revelations came unto thee, but thou didst deny them and wast scornful and wast among the disbelievers.

Text1: He said: Reprieve me till the day when they are raised (from the dead).
Text2: A Lecture in Arabic, containing no crookedness, that haply they may ward off (evil).

Text1: He said: Lo! thou art of those reprieved.
Text2: Allah coineth a similitude: A man in relation to whom are several part-owners, quarrelling, and a man belonging wholly to one man. Are the two equal in similitude? Praise be to Allah! But most of them know not.

Text1: And as for those whose scale is light: those are they who lose their souls because they used to wrong Our revelations.
Text2: Allah hath (now) revealed the fairest of statements, a Scripture consistent, (wherein promises of reward are) paired (with threats of punishment), whereat doth creep the flesh of those who fear their Lord, so that their flesh and their hearts soften to Allah_s reminder. Such is Allah_s guidance, wherewith He guideth whom He will. And him whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide.

Text1: And the dwellers on the Heights call unto men whom they know by their marks, (saying): What did your multitude and that in which ye took your pride avail you?
Text2: Allah is Creator of all things, and He is Guardian over all things.

Text1: And when they do some lewdness they say: We found our fathers doing it and Allah hath enjoined it on us. Say: Allah, verily, enjoineth not lewdness. Tell ye concerning Allah that which ye know not?
Text2: Allah receiveth (men_s) souls at the time of their death, and that (soul) which dieth not (yet) in its sleep. He keepeth that (soul) for which He hath ordained death and dismisseth the rest till an appointed term. Lo! herein verily are portents for people who take thought.

Text1: And when their eyes are turned toward the dwellers of the Fire, they say: Our Lord! Place us not with the wrong-doing folk.
Text2: And Allah delivereth those who ward off (evil) because of their deserts. Evil toucheth them not, nor do they grieve.

Text1: Work not confusion in the earth after the fair ordering (thereof). and call on Him in fear and hope. Lo! the mercy of Allah is nigh unto the good.
Text2: And each soul is paid in full for what it did. And He is Best Aware of what they do.

Text1: Theirs will be a bed of hell, and over them coverings (of hell). Thus do We requite wrong-doers.
Text2: And follow the better (guidance) of that which is revealed unto you from your Lord, before the doom cometh on you suddenly when ye know not,

Text1: They said: Our Lord! We have wronged ourselves. If thou forgive us not and have not mercy on us, surely we are of the lost!
Text2: And he whom Allah guideth, for him there can be no misleader. Is not Allah Mighty, Able to Requite (the wrong)?

Text1: Between them is a veil. And on the Heights are men who know them all by their marks. And they call unto the dwellers of the Garden: Peace be unto you! They enter it not although they hope (to enter).
Text2: And on the Day of Resurrection thou (Muhammad) seest those who lied concerning Allah with their faces blackened. Is not the home of the scorners in hell?

Text1: (O mankind!) Call upon your Lord humbly and in secret. Lo! He loveth not aggressors.
Text2: And the earth shineth with the light of her Lord, and the Book is set up, and the prophets and the witnesses are brought, and it is judged between them with truth, and they are not wronged.

Text1: And every nation hath its term, and when its term cometh, they cannot put it off an hour nor yet advance (it).
Text2: And the evils that they earned will appear unto them, and that whereat they used to scoff will surround them.

Text1: Lo! your Lord is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days, then mounted He the Throne. He covereth the night with the day, which is in haste to follow it, and hath made the sun and the moon and the stars subservient by His command. His verily is all creation and commandment. Blessed be Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!
Text2: And the trumpet is blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are in the earth swoon away, save him whom Allah willeth. Then it is blown a second time, and behold them standing waiting!

Text1: Await they aught save the fulfilment thereof? On the day when the fulfilment thereof cometh, those who were before forgetful thereof will say: The messengers of our Lord did bring the Truth! Have we any intercessors, that they may intercede for us? Or can we be returned (to life on earth), that we may act otherwise than we used to act? They have lost their souls, and that which they devised hath failed them.
Text2: And they esteem not Allah as He hath the right to be esteemed, when the whole earth is His handful on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens are rolled in His right hand. Glorified is He and High Exalted from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him).

Text1: And He it is Who sendeth the winds as tidings heralding His mercy, till, when they bear a cloud heavy (with rain), We lead it to a dead land, and then cause water to descend thereon and thereby bring forth fruits of every kind. Thus bring We forth the dead. Haply ye may remember.
Text2: And those who disbelieve are driven unto hell in troops till, when they reach it and the gates thereof are opened, and the warders thereof say unto them: Came there not unto you messengers of your own, reciting unto you the revelations of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this your Day? they say: Yea, verily. But the word of doom of disbelievers is fulfilled.

Text1: We sent Noah (of old) unto his people, and he said: O my people! Serve Allah. Ye have no other Allah save Him. Lo! I fear for you the retribution of an Awful Day.
Text2: And those who keep their duty to their Lord are driven unto the Garden in troops till, when they reach it, and the gates thereof are opened, and the warders thereof say unto them: Peace be unto you! Ye are good, so enter ye (the Garden of delight), to dwell therein;

Text1: (Saying): Follow that which is sent down unto you from your Lord, and follow no protecting friends beside Him. Little do ye recollect!
Text2: And those who put away false gods lest they should worship them and turn to Allah in repentance, for them there are glad tidings. Therefor give good tidings (O Muhammad) to My bondmen

Text1: He said: O my people! There is no error in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds.
Text2: And thou (O Muhammad) seest the angels thronging round the Throne, hymning the praises of their Lord. And they are judged aright. And it is said: Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!

Text1: Say: My Lord forbiddeth only indecencies, such of them as are apparent and such as are within, and sin and wrongful oppression, and that ye associate with Allah that for which no warrant hath been revealed, and that ye tell concerning Allah that which ye know not.
Text2: And though those who do wrong possess all that is in the earth, and therewith as much again, they verily will seek to ransom themselves therewith on the Day of Resurrection from the awful doom; and there will appear unto them, from their Lord, that wherewith they never reckoned.

Text1: Who took their religion for a sport and pastime, and whom the life of the world beguiled. So this day We have forgotten them even as they forgot the meeting of this their Day and as they used to deny Our tokens.
Text2: And verily it hath been revealed unto thee as unto those before thee (saying): If thou ascribe a partner to Allah thy work will fail and thou indeed wilt be among the losers.

Text1: He said: Then go down hence! It is not for thee to show pride here, so go forth! Lo! thou art of those degraded.
Text2: And verily We have coined for mankind in this Quran all kinds of similitudes, that haply they may reflect;

Text1: He said: Go down (from hence), one of you a foe unto the other. There will be for you on earth a habitation and provision for a while.
Text2: And verily, if thou shouldst ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth? they will say: Allah. Say: Bethink you then of those ye worship beside Allah, if Allah willed some hurt for me, could they remove from me His hurt; or if He willed some mercy for me, could they restrain His mercy? Say: Allah is my all. In Him do (all) the trusting put their trust.

Text1: O Children of Adam! Look to your adornment at every place of worship, and eat and drink, but be not prodigal. Lo! He loveth not the prodigals.
Text2: And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter are repelled, and when those (whom they worship) beside Him are mentioned, behold! they are glad.

Text1: He said: Go forth from hence, degraded, banished. As for such of them as follow thee, surely I will fill hell with all of you.
Text2: And who doth greater wrong than he who telleth a lie against Allah, and denieth the truth when it reacheth him? Will not the home of disbelievers be in hell?

Text1: And (unto man): O Adam! Dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden and eat from whence ye will, but come not nigh this tree lest ye become wrong-doers.
Text2: And whoso bringeth the truth and believeth therein - Such are the dutiful.

Text1: Who doeth greater wrong than he who inventeth a lie concerning Allah or denieth Our tokens. (For such) their appointed portion of the Book (of destiny) reacheth them till, when Our messengers come to gather them, they say: Where (now) is that to which ye cried beside Allah? They say: They have departed from us. And they testify against themselves that they were disbelievers.
Text2: But the evils that they earned smote them; and such of these as do wrong, the evils that they earn will smite them; they cannot escape.

Text1: Then verily We shall question those unto whom (Our message) hath been sent, and verily We shall question the messengers.
Text2: But those who keep their duty to their Lord, for them are lofty halls with lofty halls above them, built (for them), beneath which rivers flow. (It is) a promise of Allah. Allah faileth not His promise.

Text1: Then verily We shall narrate unto them (the event) with knowledge, for We were not absent (when it came to pass).
Text2: Hast thou not seen how Allah hath sent down water from the sky and hath caused it to penetrate the earth as watersprings, and afterward thereby produceth crops of divers hues; and afterward they wither and thou seest them turn yellow; then He maketh them chaff. Lo! herein verily is a reminder for men of understanding.

Text1: Are these they of whom ye swore that Allah would not show them mercy? (Unto them it hath been said): Enter the Garden. No fear shall come upon you nor is it ye who will grieve.
Text2: His are the keys of the heavens and the earth, and they who disbelieve the revelations of Allah - such are they who are the losers.

Text1: No plea had they, when Our terror came unto them, save that they said: Lo! We were wrong-doers.
Text2: Is he on whom the word of doom is fulfilled (to be helped), and canst thou (O Muhammad) rescue him who is in the Fire?

Text1: And We have given you (mankind) power in the earth, and appointed for you therein livelihoods. Little give ye thanks!
Text2: Is he then, who will strike his face against the awful doom upon the Day of Resurrection (as he who doeth right)? And it will be said unto the wrong-doers: Taste what ye used to earn.

Text1: The weighing on that day is the true (weighing). As for those whose scale is heavy, they are the successful.
Text2: Is he whose bosom Allah hath expanded for Al-Islam, so that he followeth a light from his Lord, (as he who disbelieveth)? Then woe unto those whose hearts are hardened against remembrance of Allah. Such are in plain error.

Text1: As for the good land, its vegetation cometh forth by permission of its Lord; while as for that which is bad, only the useless cometh forth (from it). Thus do We recount the tokens for people who give thanks.
Text2: It is said (unto them): Enter ye the gates of hell to dwell therein. Thus hapless is the journey_s end of the scorners.

Text1: He saith: Enter into the Fire among nations of the jinn and humankind who passed away before you. Every time a nation entereth, it curseth its sister (nation) till, when they have all been made to follow one another thither, the last of them saith unto the first of them: Our Lord! These led us astray, so give them double torment of the Fire. He saith: For each one there is double (torment), but ye know not.
Text2: Know they not that Allah enlargeth providence for whom He will, and straiteneth it (for whom He will). Lo! herein verily are portents for people who believe.

Text1: But (as for) those who believe and do good works - We tax not any soul beyond its scope - Such are rightful owners of the Garden. They abide therein.
Text2: Lest any soul should say: Alas, my grief that I was unmindful of Allah, and I was indeed among the scoffers!

Text1: He said: Now, because Thou hast sent me astray, verily I shall lurk in ambush for them on Thy Right Path.
Text2: Lo! thou wilt die, and lo! they will die;

Text1: O Children of Adam! Let not Satan seduce you as he caused your (first) parents to go forth from the Garden and tore off from them their robe (of innocence) that he might manifest their shame to them. Lo! he seeth you, he and his tribe, from whence ye see him not. Lo! We have made the devils protecting friends for those who believe not.
Text2: Lo! We have revealed unto thee (Muhammad) the Scripture for mankind with truth. Then whosoever goeth right it is for his soul, and whosoever strayeth, strayeth only to its hurt. And thou art not a warder over them.

Text1: Verily We have brought them a Scripture which We expounded with knowledge, a guidance and a mercy for a people who believe.
Text2: Nay, but Allah must thou serve, and be among the thankful!

Text1: O Children of Adam! When messengers of your own come unto you who narrate unto you My revelations, then whosoever refraineth from evil and amendeth - there shall no fear come upon them neither shall they grieve.
Text2: Now when hurt toucheth a man he crieth unto Us, and afterward when We have granted him a boon from Us, he saith: Only by force of knowledge I obtained it. Nay, but it is a test. But most of them know not.

Text1: Say: My Lord enjoineth justice. And set your faces upright (toward Him) at every place of worship and call upon Him, making religion pure for Him (only). As He brought you into being, so return ye (unto Him).
Text2: Or choose they intercessors other than Allah? Say: What! Even though they have power over nothing and have no intelligence?

Text1: And the dwellers of the Garden cry unto the dwellers of the Fire: We have found that which our Lord promised us (to be) the Truth. Have ye (too) found that which your Lord promised the Truth? They say: Yea, verily. And a crier in between them crieth: The curse of Allah is on evil-doers,
Text2: Or should say, when it seeth the doom: Oh, that I had but a second chance that I might be among the righteous!

Text1: And We remove whatever rancour may be in their hearts. Rivers flow beneath them. And they say: The praise to Allah, Who hath guided us to this. We could not truly have been led aright if Allah had not guided us. Verily the messengers of our Lord did bring the Truth. And it is cried unto them: This is the Garden. Ye inherit it for what ye used to do.
Text2: Or should say: If Allah had but guided me I should have been among the dutiful!

Text1: And the dwellers of the Fire cry out unto the dwellers of the Garden: Pour on us some water or some wherewith Allah hath provided you. They say: Lo! Allah hath forbidden both to disbelievers (in His guidance),
Text2: Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): Do ye bid me serve other than Allah? O ye fools!

Text1: Say: Who hath forbidden the adornment of Allah which He hath brought forth for His bondmen, and the good things of His providing? Say: Such, on the Day of Resurrection, will be only for those who believed during the life of the world. Thus do we detail Our revelations for people who have knowledge.
Text2: Say: O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of the Invisible and the Visible! Thou wilt judge between Thy slaves concerning that wherein they used to differ.

Text1: He said: There shall ye live, and there shall ye die, and thence shall ye be brought forth.
Text2: Say: O my people! Act in your manner. Lo! I (too) am acting. Thus ye will come to know

Text1: And the first of them saith unto the last of them: Ye were no whit better than us, so taste the doom for what ye used to earn.
Text2: Say: O My slaves who have been prodigal to their own hurt! Despair not of the mercy of Allah, Who forgiveth all sins. Lo! He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

Text1: A party hath He led aright, while error hath just hold over (another) party, for lo! they choose the devils for protecting supporters instead of Allah and deem that they are rightly guided.
Text2: Say: Unto Allah belongeth all intercession. His is the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. And afterward unto Him ye will be brought back.

Text1: And he swore unto them (saying): Lo! I am a sincere adviser unto you.
Text2: That Allah will remit from them the worst of what they did, and will pay them for reward the best they used to do.

Text1: Then I shall come upon them from before them and from behind them and from their right hands and from their left hands, and Thou wilt not find most of them beholden (unto Thee).
Text2: Then lo! on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord ye will dispute.

Text1: (It is) a Scripture that is revealed unto thee (Muhammad) - so let there be no heaviness in thy heart therefrom - that thou mayst warn thereby, and (it is) a Reminder unto believers.
Text2: They have an awning of fire above them and beneath them a dais (of fire). With this doth Allah appal His bondmen. O My bondmen, therefor fear Me!

Text1: The chieftains of his people said: Lo! we see thee surely in plain error.
Text2: They say: Praise be to Allah, Who hath fulfilled His promise unto us and hath made us inherit the land, sojourning in the Garden where we will! So bounteous is the wage of workers.

Text1: Then Satan whispered to them that he might manifest unto them that which was hidden from them of their shame, and he said: Your Lord forbade you from this tree only lest ye should become angels or become of the immortals.
Text2: They shall have what they will of their Lord_s bounty. That is the reward of the good:

Text1: And We created you, then fashioned you, then told the angels: Fall ye prostrate before Adam! And they fell prostrate, all save Iblis, who was not of those who make prostration.
Text2: Those before them denied, and so the doom came on them whence they knew not.

Text1: But they who deny Our revelations and scorn them - each are rightful owners of the Fire; they will abide therein.
Text2: Those before them said it, yet (all) that they had earned availed them not;

Text1: He said: What hindered thee that thou didst not fall prostrate when I bade thee? (Iblis) said: I am better than him. Thou createdst me of fire while him Thou didst create of mud.
Text2: Thus Allah made them taste humiliation in the life of the world, and verily the doom of the Hereafter will be greater if they did but know.

Text1: Lo! they who deny Our revelations and scorn them, for them the gates of heaven will nor be opened not will they enter the Garden until the camel goeth through the needle_s eye. Thus do We requite the guilty.
Text2: Turn unto your Lord repentant, and surrender unto Him, before there come unto you the doom, when ye cannot be helped.

Text1: How many a township have We destroyed! As a raid by night, or while they slept at noon, Our terror came unto them.
Text2: Who hear advice and follow the best thereof. Such are those whom Allah guideth, and such are men of understanding.

Text1: O Children of Adam! We have revealed unto you raiment to conceal your shame, and splendid vesture, but the raiment of restraint from evil, that is best. This is of the revelations of Allah, that they may remember.
Text2: Who it is unto whom cometh a doom that will abase him, and on whom there falleth everlasting doom.

Text1: Thus did he lead them on with guile. And when they tasted of the tree their shame was manifest to them and they began to hide (by heaping) on themselves some of the leaves of the Garden. And their Lord called them, (saying): Did I not forbid you from that tree and tell you: Lo! Satan is an open enemy to you?
Text2: Will not Allah defend His slave? Yet they would frighten thee with those beside Him. He whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide.

Text1: Therefore We took retribution from them; therefore We drowned them in the sea: because they denied Our revelations and were heedless of them.
Text2: (And it is said unto them): This is because ye exulted in the earth without right, and because ye were petulant.

Text1: And to (the tribe of) Thamud (We sent) their brother Salih. He said: O my people! Serve Allah. Ye have no other Allah save Him. A wonder from your Lord hath come unto you. Lo! this is the camel of Allah, a token unto you; so let her feed in Allah_s earth, and touch her not with hurt lest painful torment seize you.
Text2: (It is said unto them): This is (your plight) because, when Allah only was invoked, ye disbelieved, but when some partner was ascribed to Him ye were believing. But the command belongeth only to Allah, the Sublime, the Majestic.

Text1: And (remember) when We did deliver you from Pharaoh_s folk who were afflicting you with dreadful torment, slaughtering your sons and sparing your women. That was a tremendous trial from your Lord.
Text2: (Many) benefits ye have from them - and that ye may satisfy by their means a need that is in your breasts, and may be borne upon them as upon the ship.

Text1: And We sent no prophet unto any township but We did afflict its folk with tribulation and adversity that haply they might grow humble.
Text2: A day when ye will turn to flee, having no preserver from Allah: and he whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide.

Text1: They said: O Moses! Either throw (first) or let us be the first throwers?
Text2: A guide and a reminder for men of understanding.

Text1: Those who denied Shu_eyb became as though they had not dwelt there. Those who denied Shu_eyb, they were the losers.
Text2: A plight like that of Noah_s folk, and A_ad and Thamud, and those after them, and Allah willeth no injustice for (His) slaves.

Text1: They said: Lo! We are about to return unto our Lord!
Text2: Allah it is Who appointed for you the earth for a dwelling-place and the sky for a canopy, and fashioned you and perfected your shapes, and hath provided you with good things. Such is Allah, your Lord. Then blessed be Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!

Text1: He said: Shall I seek for you a god other than Allah when He hath favoured you above (all) creatures?
Text2: Allah it is Who hath appointed for you cattle, that ye may ride on some of them, and eat of some -

Text1: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.
Text2: Allah it is Who hath appointed for you night that ye may rest therein, and day for seeing. Lo! Allah is a Lord of bounty for mankind, yet most of mankind give not thanks.

Text1: Lo! ye come with lust unto men instead of women. Nay, but ye are wanton folk.
Text2: Allah judgeth with truth, while those to whom they cry instead of Him judge not at all. Lo! Allah, He is the Hearer, the Seer.

Text1: We should have invented a lie against Allah if we returned to your religion after Allah hath rescued us from it. It is not for us to return to it unless Allah our Lord should (so) will. Our Lord comprehendeth all things in knowledge. In Allah do we put our trust. Our Lord! Decide with truth between us and our folk, for Thou art the best of those who make decision.
Text2: And a believing man of Pharaoh_s family, who hid his faith, said: Would ye kill a man because he saith: My Lord is Allah, and hath brought you clear proofs from your Lord? If he is lying, then his lie is upon him; and if he is truthful, then some of that wherewith he threateneth you will strike you. Lo! Allah guideth not one who is a prodigal, a liar.

Text1: And when We did appoint for Moses thirty nights (of solitude), and added to them ten, and he completed the whole time appointed by his Lord of forty nights; and Moses said unto his brother, Aaron: Take my place among the people. Do right, and follow not the way of mischief-makers.
Text2: And He showeth you His tokens. Which, then, of the tokens of Allah do ye deny?

Text1: Are they then secure from Allah_s scheme? None deemeth himself secure from Allah_s scheme save folk that perish.
Text2: And he who believed said: O my people! Follow me. I will show you the way of right conduct.

Text1: So the earthquake seized them and morning found them prostrate in their dwelling-place.
Text2: And he who believed said: O my people! Lo! I fear for you a fate like that of the factions (of old);

Text1: Are the people of the townships then secure from the coming of Our wrath upon them as a night-raid while they sleep?
Text2: And Pharaoh said: O Haman! Build for me a tower that haply I may reach the roads,

Text1: And if there is a party of you which believeth in that wherewith I have been sent, and there is a party which believeth not, then have patience until Allah judge between us. He is the Best of all who deal in judgment.
Text2: And Pharaoh said: Suffer me to kill Moses, and let him cry unto his Lord. Lo! I fear that he will alter your religion or that he will cause confusion in the land.

Text1: Thus were they there defeated and brought low.
Text2: And the blind man and the seer are not equal, neither are those who believe and do good works (equal with) the evil-doer. Little do ye reflect!

Text1: Who would expel you from your land. Now what do ye advise?
Text2: And those in the Fire say unto the guards of hell: Entreat your Lord that He relieve us of a day of the torment.

Text1: Then changed We the evil plight for good till they grew affluent and said: Tribulation and distress did touch our fathers. Then We seized them unawares, when they perceived not.
