Text1: The chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved, said: We see thee but a mortal like us, and we see not that any follow thee save the most abject among us, without reflection. We behold in you no merit above us - nay, we deem you liars.
Text2: O ye who believe! If an evil-liver bring you tidings, verify it, lest ye smite some folk in ignorance and afterward repent of what ye did.

Text1: They said: O Noah! Thou hast disputed with us and multiplied disputation with us; now bring upon us that wherewith thou threatenest us, if thou art of the truthful.
Text2: O ye who believe! Let not a folk deride a folk who may be better than they (are), not let women (deride) women who may be better than they are; neither defame one another, nor insult one another by nicknames. Bad is the name of lewdness after faith. And whoso turneth not in repentance, such are evil-doers.

Text1: Lo! those who believe and do good works and humble themselves before their Lord: such are rightful owners of the Garden; they will abide therein.
Text2: O ye who believe! Lift not up your voices above the voice of the Prophet, nor shout when speaking to him as ye shout one to another, lest your works be rendered vain while ye perceive not.

Text1: He said: Only Allah will bring it upon you if He will, and ye can by no means escape.
Text2: O ye who believe! Shun much suspicion; for lo! some suspicion is a crime. And spy not, neither backbite one another. Would one of you love to eat the flesh of his dead brother? Ye abhor that (so abhor the other)! And keep your duty (to Allah). Lo! Allah is Relenting, Merciful.

Text1: Build the ship under Our eyes and by Our inspiration, and speak not unto Me on behalf of those who do wrong. Lo! they will be drowned.
Text2: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Would ye teach Allah your religion, when Allah knoweth all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, and Allah is Aware of all things?

Text1: And it was inspired in Noah, (saying): No-one of thy folk will believe save him who hath believed already. Be not distressed because of what they do.
Text2: The (true) believers are those only who believe in Allah and His messenger and afterward doubt not, but strive with their wealth and their lives for the cause of Allah. Such are the sincere.

Text1: I say not unto you: "I have the treasures of Allah" nor "I have knowledge of the Unseen," nor say I: "Lo! I am an angel!" Nor say I unto those whom your eyes scorn that Allah will not give them good - Allah knoweth best what is in their hearts - Lo! then indeed I should be of the wrong-doers.
Text2: The believers are naught else than brothers. Therefore make peace between your brethren and observe your duty to Allah that haply ye may obtain mercy.

Text1: Or say they (again): He hath invented it? Say: If I have invented it, upon me be my crimes, but I am innocent of (all) that ye commit.
Text2: The wandering Arabs say: We believe. Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Ye believe not, but rather say "We submit," for the faith hath not yet entered into your hearts. Yet, if ye obey Allah and His messenger, He will not withhold from you aught of (the reward of) your deeds. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

Text1: And he was building the ship, and every time that chieftains of his people passed him, they made mock of him. He said: Though ye make mock of Us, yet We mock at you even as ye mock;
Text2: They make it a favour unto thee (Muhammad) that they have surrendered (unto Him). Say: Deem not your Surrender a favour unto me; but Allah doth confer a favour on you, inasmuch as He hath led you to the Faith, if ye are earnest.

Text1: He said: O my people! Bethink you: if I am (acting) on clear proof from my Lord and there hath come unto me a mercy from Him, who will save me from Allah if I disobey Him? Ye would add to me naught save perdition.
Text2: (And it is said): Do ye twain hurl to hell each rebel ingrate,

Text1: And his wife, standing by laughed when We gave her good tidings (of the birth) of Isaac, and, after Isaac, of Jacob.
Text2: (And it is said): This is that which ye were promised. (It is) for every penitent and heedful one,

Text1: And unto (the tribe of) Thamud (We sent) their brother Salih. He said: O my people! Serve Allah, Ye have no other Allah save Him. He brought you forth from the earth and hath made you husband it. So ask forgiveness of Him and turn unto Him repentant. Lo! my Lord is Nigh, Responsive.
Text2: (And unto the evil-doer it is said): Thou wast in heedlessness of this. Now We have removed from thee thy covering, and piercing is thy sight this day.

Text1: He said: My Lord! Lo! in Thee do I seek refuge (from the sin) that I should ask of Thee that whereof I have no knowledge. Unless Thou forgive me and have mercy on me I shall be among the lost.
Text2: A vision and a reminder for every penitent slave.

Text1: And, O my people! Ask forgiveness of your Lord, then turn unto Him repentant; He will cause the sky to rain abundance on you and will add unto you strength to your strength. Turn not away, guilty!
Text2: And (the tribe of) A_ad, and Pharaoh, and the brethren of Lot,

Text1: They said: O Salih! Thou hast been among us hitherto as that wherein our hope was placed. Dost thou ask us not to worship what our fathers worshipped? Lo! we verily are in grave doubt concerning that to which thou callest us.
Text2: And (unto the evil-doer) his comrade saith: This is that which I have ready (as testimony).

Text1: And a curse was made to follow them in the world and on the Day of Resurrection. Lo! A_ad disbelieved in their Lord. A far removal for A_ad, the folk of Hud!
Text2: And every soul cometh, along with it a driver and a witness.

Text1: Lo! Abraham was mild, imploring, penitent.
Text2: And how many a generation We destroyed before them, who were mightier than these in prowess so that they overran the lands! Had they any place of refuge (when the judgment came)?

Text1: They said: Well thou knowest that we have no right to thy daughters, and well thou knowest what we want.
Text2: And in the night-time hymn His praise, and after the (prescribed) prostrations.

Text1: He said: Would that I had strength to resist you or had some strong support (among you)!
Text2: And listen on the day when the crier crieth from a near place,

Text1: This is of the tidings of the Unseen which We inspire in thee (Muhammad). Thou thyself knewest it not, nor did thy folk (know it) before this. Then have patience. Lo! the sequel is for those who ward off (evil).
Text2: And lofty date-palms with ranged clusters,

Text1: And when Our commandment came to pass We saved Hud and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us; We saved them from a harsh doom.
Text2: And the agony of death cometh in truth. (And it is said unto him): This is that which thou wast wont to shun.

Text1: They said: O Hud! Thou hast brought us no clear proof and we are not going to forsake our gods on thy (mere) saying, and we are not believers in thee.
Text2: And the dwellers in the wood, and the folk of Tubb_a: every one denied their messengers, therefor My threat took effect.

Text1: He said: O Noah! Lo! he is not of thy household; lo! he is of evil conduct, so ask not of Me that whereof thou hast no knowledge. I admonish thee lest thou be among the ignorant.
Text2: And the earth have We spread out, and have flung firm hills therein, and have caused of every lovely kind to grow thereon,

Text1: And when he saw their hands reached not to it, he mistrusted them and conceived a fear of them. They said: Fear not! Lo! we are sent unto the folk of Lot.
Text2: And the Garden is brought nigh for those who kept from evil, no longer distant.

Text1: And such were A_ad. They denied the revelations of their Lord and flouted His messengers and followed the command of every froward potentate.
Text2: And the trumpet is blown. This is the threatened Day.

Text1: And when Our messengers came unto Lot, he was distressed and knew not how to protect them. He said: This is a distressful day.
Text2: And verily We created the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, in six Days, and naught of weariness touched Us.

Text1: It was said (unto him): O Noah! Go thou down (from the mountain) with peace from Us and blessings upon thee and some nations (that will spring) from those with thee. (There will be other) nations unto whom We shall give enjoyment a long while and then a painful doom from Us will overtake them.
Text2: And We send down from the sky blessed water whereby We give growth unto gardens and the grain of crops,

Text1: They said: Wonderest thou at the commandment of Allah? The mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, O people of the house! Lo! He is Owner of Praise, Owner of Glory!
Text2: Enter it in peace. This is the day of immortality.

Text1: And Noah cried unto his Lord and said: My Lord! Lo! my son is of my household! Surely Thy promise is the truth and Thou are the Most Just of Judges.
Text2: Have they not then observed the sky above them, how We have constructed it and beautified it, and how there are no rifts therein?

Text1: And the (awful) Cry overtook those who did wrong, so that morning found them prostrate in their dwellings,
Text2: He saith: Contend not in My presence, when I had already proffered unto you the warning.

Text1: And if ye turn away, still I have conveyed unto you that wherewith I was sent unto you, and my Lord will set in place of you a folk other than you. Ye cannot injure Him at all. Lo! my Lord is Guardian over all things.
Text2: He uttereth no word but there is with him an observer ready.

Text1: O my people! This is the camel of Allah, a token unto you, so suffer her to feed in Allah_s earth, and touch her not with harm lest a near torment seize you.
Text2: Hinderer of good, transgressor, doubter,

Text1: So, when Our commandment came to pass, We saved Salih, and those who believed with him, by a mercy from Us, from the ignominy of that day. Lo, thy Lord! He is the Strong, the Mighty.
Text2: His comrade saith: Our Lord! I did not cause him to rebel, but he was (himself) far gone in error.

Text1: (It was said) O Abraham! Forsake this! Lo! thy Lord_s commandment hath gone forth, and lo! there cometh unto them a doom which cannot be repelled.
Text2: Lo! therein verily is a reminder for him who hath a heart, or giveth ear with full intelligence.

Text1: So when Our commandment came to pass We overthrew (that township) and rained upon it stones of clay, one after another,
Text2: Lo! We it is Who quicken and give death, and unto Us is the journeying.

Text1: And it was said: O earth! Swallow thy water and, O sky! be cleared of clouds! And the water was made to subside. And the commandment was fulfilled. And it (the ship) came to rest upon (the mount) Al-Judi and it was said: A far removal for wrongdoing folk!
Text2: Nay, but they have denied the truth when it came unto them, therefor they are now in troubled case.

Text1: And he said: Embark therein! In the name of Allah be its course and its mooring. Lo! my Lord is Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: Nay, but they marvel that a warner of their own hath come unto them; and the disbelievers say: This is a strange thing:

Text1: Marked with fire in the providence of thy Lord (for the destruction of the wicked). And they are never far from the wrong-doers.
Text2: On the day when the earth splitteth asunder from them, hastening forth (they come). That is a gathering easy for Us (to make).

Text1: And Our messengers cam unto Abraham with good news. They said: Peace! He answered: Peace! and delayed not to bring a roasted calf.
Text2: On the day when We say unto hell: Art thou filled? and it saith: Can there be more to come?

Text1: And unto (the tribe of) A_ad (We sent) their brother, Hud. He said: O my people! Serve Allah! Ye have no other Allah save Him. Lo! ye do but invent.
Text2: Provision (made) for men; and therewith We quicken a dead land. Even so will be the resurrection of the dead.

Text1: (Thus it was) till, when Our commandment came to pass and the oven gushed forth water, We said: Load therein two of every kind, a pair (the male and female), and thy household, save him against whom the word hath gone forth already, and those who believe. And but a few were they who believed with him.
Text2: Qaf. By the Glorious Quran,

Text1: (The messengers) said: O Lot! Lo! we are messengers of thy Lord; they shall not reach thee. So travel with thy people in a part of the night, and let not one of you turn round - (all) save thy wife. Lo! that which smiteth them will smite her (also). Lo! their tryst is (for) the morning. Is not the morning nigh?
Text2: The day when they will hear the (Awful) Cry in truth. That is the day of coming forth (from the graves).

Text1: O my people! I ask of you no reward for it. Lo! my reward is the concern only of Him Who made me. Have ye then no sense?
Text2: The folk of Noah denied (the truth) before them, and (so did) the dwellers at Ar-Rass and (the tribe of) Thamud,

Text1: As though they had not dwelt there. Lo! Thamud disbelieved in their Lord. A far removal for Thamud!
Text2: The sentence that cometh from Me cannot be changed, and I am in no wise a tyrant unto the slaves.

Text1: And when the awe departed from Abraham, and the glad news reached him, he pleaded with Us on behalf of the folk of Lot.
Text2: There they have all that they desire, and there is more with Us.

Text1: And his people came unto him, running towards him - and before then they used to commit abominations - He said: O my people! Here are my daughters! They are purer for you. Beware of Allah, and degrade me not in (the person of) my guests. Is there not among you any upright man?
Text2: Therefor (O Muhammad) bear with what they say, and hymn the praise of thy Lord before the rising and before the setting of the sun;

Text1: And unto Midian (We sent) their brother Shu_eyb. He said: O my people! Serve Allah. Ye have no other Allah save Him! And give not short measure and short weight. Lo! I see you well-to-do, and lo! I fear for you the doom of a besetting Day.
Text2: We are Best Aware of what they say, and thou (O Muhammad) art in no wise a compeller over them. But warn by the Quran him who feareth My threat.

Text1: He said: I shall betake me to some mountain that will save me from the water. (Noah) said: This day there is none that saveth from the commandment of Allah save him on whom He hath had mercy. And the wave came in between them, so he was among the drowned.
Text2: We know that which the earth taketh of them, and with Us is a recording Book.

Text1: Beside Him. So (try to) circumvent me, all of you, give me no respite.
Text2: We verily created man and We know what his soul whispereth to him, and We are nearer to him than his jugular vein.

Text1: We say naught save that one of our gods hath possessed thee in an evil way. He said: I call Allah to witness, and do ye (too) bear witness, that I am innocent of (all) that ye ascribe as partners (to Allah)
Text2: Were We then worn out by the first creation? Yet they are in doubt about a new creation.

Text1: Lo! I have put my trust in Allah, my Lord and your Lord. Not an animal but He doth grasp it by the forelock! Lo! my Lord is on a straight path.
Text2: When the two Receivers receive (him), seated on the right hand and on the left,

Text1: And it sailed with them amid waves like mountains, and Noah cried unto his son - and he was standing aloof - O my son! Come ride with us, and be not with the disbelievers.
Text2: When we are dead and have become dust (shall we be brought back again)? That would be a far return!

Text1: She said: Oh woe is me! Shall I bear a child when I am an old woman, and this my husband is an old man? Lo! this is a strange thing!
Text2: Who feareth the Beneficent in secret and cometh with a contrite heart.

Text1: But they hamstrung her, and then he said: Enjoy life in your dwelling-place three days! This is a threat that will not be belied.
Text2: Who setteth up another god along with Allah. Do ye twain hurl him to the dreadful doom.

Text1: And have patience, (O Muhammad), for lo! Allah loseth not the wages of the good.
Text2: (Abraham) said: And (afterward) what is your errand, O ye sent (from Allah)?

Text1: He will go before his people on the Day of Resurrection and will lead them to the Fire for watering-place. Ah, hapless is the watering-place (whither they are) led.
Text2: (And it will be said unto them): Taste your torment (which ye inflicted). This is what ye sought to hasten.

Text1: Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they did follow the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was no right guide.
Text2: (It is) the day when they will be tormented at the Fire,

Text1: And when Our commandment came to pass We saved Shu_eyb and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us; and the (Awful) Cry seized those who did injustice, and morning found them prostrate in their dwellings,
Text2: Accursed be the conjecturers

Text1: On the day when it cometh no soul will speak except by His permission; some among them will be wretched, (others) glad.
Text2: And (also) in yourselves. Can ye then not see?

Text1: Abiding there so long as the heavens and the earth endure save for that which thy Lord willeth. Lo! thy Lord is Doer of what He will.
Text2: And by the Lord of the heavens and the earth, it is the truth, even as (it is true) that ye speak.

Text1: Even thus is the grasp of thy Lord when He graspeth the townships while they are doing wrong. Lo! His grasp is painful, very strong.
Text2: And ere the dawning of each day would seek forgiveness,

Text1: And lo! unto each thy Lord will verily repay his works in full. Lo! He is Informed of what they do.
Text2: And he set it before them, saying: Will ye not eat?

Text1: And wait! Lo! We (too) are waiting.
Text2: And in Moses (too, there is a portent) when We sent him unto Pharaoh with clear warrant,

Text1: And We defer it only to a term already reckoned.
Text2: And in the earth are portents for those whose faith is sure.

Text1: As for those who will be wretched (on that day) they will be in the Fire; sighing and wailing will be their portion therein,
Text2: And in the heaven is your providence and that which ye are promised;

Text1: Lo! herein verily there is a portent for those who fear the doom of the Hereafter. That is a day unto which mankind will be gathered, and that is a day that will be witnessed.
Text2: And in their wealth the beggar and the outcast had due share.

Text1: Ask pardon of your Lord and then turn unto Him (repentant). Lo! my Lord is Merciful, Loving.
Text2: And lo! the judgment will indeed befall.

Text1: That which Allah leaveth with you is better for you if ye are believers; and I am not a keeper over you.
Text2: And those that bear the burden (of the rain)

Text1: They said: O Shu_eyb! Doth thy way of prayer command thee that we should forsake that which our fathers (used to) worship, or that we (should leave off) doing what we will with our own property. Lo! thou art the mild, the guide to right behaviour.
Text2: And those that glide with ease (upon the sea)

Text1: He said: O my people! Bethink you: if I am (acting) on a clear proof from my Lord and He sustaineth me with fair sustenance from Him (how can I concede aught to you)? I desire not to do behind your backs that which I ask you not to do. I desire naught save reform so far as I am able. My welfare is only in Allah. In Him I trust and unto Him I turn (repentant).
Text2: And those who distribute (blessings) by command,

Text1: And say unto those who believe not: Act according to your power. Lo! We (too) are acting.
Text2: And We left behind therein a portent for those who fear a painful doom.

Text1: And Allah_s is the Invisible of the heavens and the earth, and unto Him the whole matter will be returned. So worship Him and put thy trust in Him. Lo! thy Lord is not unaware of what ye (mortals) do.
Text2: But he withdrew (confiding) in his might, and said: A wizard or a madman.

Text1: And all that We relate unto thee of the story of the messengers is in order that thereby We may make firm thy heart. And herein hath come unto thee the Truth and an exhortation and a reminder for believers.
Text2: But We found there but one house of those surrendered (to Allah).

Text1: They said: O Shu_eyb! We understand not much of that thou tellest, and lo! we do behold thee weak among us. But for thy family, we should have stoned thee, for thou art not strong against us.
Text2: By the heaven full of paths,

Text1: O my people! Give full measure and full weight in justice, and wrong not people in respect of their goods. And do not evil in the earth, causing corruption.
Text2: By those that winnow with a winnowing

Text1: And as for those who will be glad (that day) they will be in the Garden, abiding there so long as the heavens and the earth endure save for that which thy Lord willeth: a gift unfailing.
Text2: Hath the story of Abraham_s honoured guests reached thee (O Muhammad)?

Text1: And, O my people! Act according to your power, lo! I (too) am acting. Ye will soon know on whom there cometh a doom that will abase him, and who it is that lieth. And watch! Lo! I am a watcher with you.
Text2: He is made to turn away from it who is (himself) averse.

Text1: And, O my people! Let not the schism with me cause you to sin so that there befall you that which befell the folk of Noah and the folk of Hud, and the folk of Salih; and the folk of Lot are not far off from you.
Text2: Lo! that wherewith ye are threatened is indeed true,

Text1: A curse is made to follow them in the world and on the Day of Resurrection. Hapless is the gift (that will be) given (them).
Text2: Lo! those who keep from evil will dwell amid gardens and watersprings,

Text1: He said: O my people! Is my family more to be honoured by you than Allah? and ye put Him behind you, neglected! Lo! my Lord surroundeth what ye do.
Text2: Lo! ye, forsooth, are of various opinion (concerning the truth).

Text1: And if thy Lord had willed, He verily would have made mankind one nation, yet they cease not differing,
Text2: Marked by thy Lord for (the destruction of) the wanton.

Text1: That is (something) of the tidings of the townships (which were destroyed of old). We relate it unto thee (Muhammad). Some of them are standing and some (already) reaped.
Text2: Taking that which their Lord giveth them; for lo! aforetime they were doers of good;

Text1: In truth thy Lord destroyed not the townships tyrannously while their folk were doing right.
Text2: That we may send upon them stones of clay,

Text1: So tread thou the straight path as thou art commanded, and those who turn (unto Allah) with thee, and transgress not. Lo! He is Seer of what ye do.
Text2: Then he conceived a fear of them. They said: Fear not! and gave him tidings of (the birth of) a wise son.

Text1: And we verily gave unto Moses the Scripture, and there was strife thereupon; and had it not been for a Word that had already gone forth from thy Lord, the case would have been judged between them, and lo! they are in grave doubt concerning it.
Text2: Then he went apart unto his housefolk so that they brought a fatted calf;

Text1: And incline not toward those who do wrong lest the Fire touch you, and ye have no protecting friends against Allah, and afterward ye would not be helped.
Text2: Then his wife came forward, making moan, and smote her face, and cried: A barren old woman!

Text1: Save him on whom thy Lord hath mercy; and for that He did create them. And the Word of thy Lord hath been fulfilled: Verily I shall fill hell with the jinn and mankind together.
Text2: Then we brought forth such believers as were there.

Text1: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations and a clear warrant
Text2: They ask: When is the Day of Judgment?

Text1: Establish worship at the two ends of the day and in some watches of the night. Lo! good deeds annul ill-deeds. This is reminder for the mindful.
Text2: They said: Even so saith thy Lord. Lo! He is the Wise, the Knower.

Text1: If only there had been among the generations before you men possessing a remnant (of good sense) to warn (their people) from corruption in the earth, as did a few of those whom We saved from them! The wrong-doers followed that by which they were made sapless, and were guilty.
Text2: They said: Lo! we are sent unto a guilty folk,

Text1: We wronged them not, but they did wrong themselves; and their gods on whom they call beside Allah availed them naught when came thy Lord_s command; they added to them naught save ruin.
Text2: They used to sleep but little of the night,

Text1: So be not thou in doubt concerning that which these (folk) worship. They worship only as their fathers worshipped aforetime. Lo! we shall pay them their whole due unabated.
Text2: When they came in unto him and said: Peace! he answered, Peace! (and thought): Folk unknown (to me).

Text1: As though they had not dwelt there. A far removal for Midian, even as Thamud had been removed afar!
Text2: Who are careless in an abyss!

Text1: One among them said: Kill not Joseph but, if ye must be doing, fling him into the depth of the pit; some caravan will find him.
Text2: And all things We have created by pairs, that haply ye may reflect.

Text1: Lo! We have revealed it, a Lecture in Arabic, that ye may understand.
Text2: And in (the tribe of) A_ad (there is a portent) when we sent the fatal wind against them.

Text1: When Joseph said unto his father: O my father! Lo! I saw in a dream eleven planets and the sun and the moon, I saw them prostrating themselves unto me.
Text2: And in (the tribe of) Thamud (there is a portent) when it was told them: Take your ease awhile.

Text1: And they sold him for a low price, a number of silver coins; and they attached no value to him.
Text2: And lo! for those who (now) do wrong there is an evil day like unto the evil day (which came for) their likes (of old); so let them not ask Me to hasten on (that day).

Text1: Send him with us to-morrow that he may enjoy himself and play. And lo! we shall take good care of him.
Text2: And set not any other god along with Allah; lo! I am a plain warner unto you from Him.

Text1: (One said): Kill Joseph or cast him to some (other) land, so that your father_s favour may be all for you, and (that) ye may afterward be righteous folk.
Text2: And the earth have We laid out, how gracious is the Spreader (thereof)!

Text1: Verily in Joseph and his brethren are signs (of Allah_s Sovereignty) for the inquiring.
Text2: And the folk of Noah aforetime. Lo! they were licentious folk.

Text1: Thus thy Lord will prefer thee and will teach thee the interpretation of events, and will perfect His grace upon thee and upon the family of Jacob as He perfected it upon thy forefathers, Abraham and Isaac. Lo! thy Lord is Knower, Wise.
Text2: And they were unable to rise up, nor could they help themselves.

Text1: And they came weeping to their father in the evening.
Text2: And warn, for warning profiteth believers.

Text1: And he of Egypt who purchased him said unto his wife: Receive him honourably. Perchance he may prove useful to us or we may adopt him as a son. Thus we established Joseph in the land that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah was predominant in His career, but most of mankind know not.
Text2: And woe unto those who disbelieve, from (that) their day which they are promised.

Text1: He said: O my dear son! Tell not thy brethren of thy vision, lest they plot a plot against thee. Lo! Satan is for man an open foe.
Text2: But they rebelled against their Lord_s decree, and so the thunderbolt overtook them even while they gazed;

Text1: He said: Lo! in truth it saddens me that ye should take him with you, and I fear less the wolf devour him while ye are heedless of him.
Text2: Even so there came no messenger unto those before them but they said: A wizard or a madman!

Text1: They said: If the wolf should devour him when we are (so strong) a band, then surely we should have already perished.
Text2: Have they handed down (the saying) as an heirloom one unto another? Nay, but they are froward folk.

Text1: Saying: O our father! We went racing one with another, and left Joseph by our things, and the wolf devoured him, and thou believest not our saying even when we speak the truth.
Text2: I created the jinn and humankind only that they might worship Me.

Text1: And they came with false blood on his shirt. He said: Nay, but your minds have beguiled you into something. (My course is) comely patience. And Allah it is Whose help is to be sought in that (predicament) which ye describe.
Text2: I seek no livelihood from them, nor do I ask that they should feed Me.

Text1: We narrate unto thee (Muhammad) the best of narratives in that We have inspired in thee this Quran, though aforetime thou wast of the heedless.
Text2: It spared naught that it reached, but made it (all) as dust.

Text1: And there came a caravan, and they sent their waterdrawer. He let down his pail (into the pit). He said: Good luck! Here is a youth. And they hid him as a treasure, and Allah was Aware of what they did.
Text2: Lo! Allah! He it is that giveth livelihood, the Lord of unbreakable might.

Text1: Then, when they led him off, and were of one mind that they should place him in the depth of the pit, We inspired in him: Thou wilt tell them of this deed of theirs when they know (thee) not.
Text2: So withdraw from them (O Muhammad), for thou art in no wise blameworthy,

Text1: They said: O our father! Why wilt thou not trust us with Joseph, when lo! we are good friends to him?
Text2: Therefor flee unto Allah; lo! I am a plain warner unto you from him.

Text1: When they said: Verily Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we are, many though we be. Lo! our father is in plain aberration.
Text2: We have built the heaven with might, and We it is Who make the vast extent (thereof).

Text1: Those whom ye worship beside Him are but names which ye have named, ye and your fathers. Allah hath revealed no sanction for them. The decision rests with Allah only, Who hath commanded you that ye worship none save Him. This is the right religion, but most men know not.
Text2: (And it is said unto them): Eat and drink in health (as a reward) for what ye used to do,

Text1: And it seemed good to them (the men-folk) after they had seen the signs (of his innocence) to imprison him for a time.
Text2: (And it is said unto them): This is the Fire which ye were wont to deny.

Text1: And he said: O my sons! Go not in by one gate; go in by different gates. I can naught avail you as against Allah. Lo! the decision rests with Allah only. In Him do I put my trust, and in Him let all the trusting put their trust.
Text2: A day in which their guile will naught avail them, nor will they be helped.

Text1: And she, in whose house he was, asked of him an evil act. She bolted the doors and said: Come! He said: I seek refuge in Allah! Lo! he is my lord, who hath treated me honourably. Lo! wrong-doers never prosper.
Text2: And a Scripture inscribed

Text1: And when they opened their belongings they discovered that their merchandise had been returned to them. They said: O our father! What (more) can we ask? Here is our merchandise returned to us. We shall get provision for our folk and guard our brother, and we shall have the extra measure of a camel (load). This (that we bring now) is a light measure.
Text2: And if they were to see a fragment of the heaven falling, they would say: A heap of clouds.

Text1: And when he provided them with their provision, he put the drinking-cup in his brother_s saddlebag, and then a crier cried: O camel-riders! Lo! ye are surely thieves!
Text2: And in the night-time also hymn His praise, and at the setting of the stars.

Text1: (And when he came to Joseph in the prison, he exclaimed): Joseph! O thou truthful one! Expound for us the seven fat kine which seven lean were eating and the seven green ears of corn and other (seven) dry, that I may return unto the people, so that they may know.
Text2: And some of them draw near unto others, questioning,

Text1: And they raced with one another to the door, and she tore his shirt from behind, and they met her lord and master at the door. She said: What shall be his reward, who wisheth evil to thy folk, save prison or a painful doom?
Text2: And the House frequented,

Text1: And when she heard of their sly talk, she sent to them and prepared for them a cushioned couch (to lie on at the feast) and gave to every one of them a knife and said (to Joseph): Come out unto them! And when they saw him they exalted him and cut their hands, exclaiming: Allah Blameless! This is no a human being. This is not other than some gracious angel.
Text2: And the mountains move away with (awful) movement,

Text1: (Joseph) said: She it was who asked of me an evil act. And a witness of her own folk testified: If his shirt is torn from before, then she speaketh truth and he is of the liars.
Text2: And the roof exalted,

Text1: And if his shirt is torn from behind, then she hath lied and he is of the truthful.
Text2: And the sea kept filled,

Text1: And he of the two who was released, and (now) at length remembered, said: I am going to announce unto you the interpretation, therefore send me forth.
Text2: And there go round, waiting on them menservants of their own, as they were hidden pearls.

Text1: And he said unto him of the twain who he knew would be released: Mention me in the presence of thy lord. But Satan caused him to forget to mention it to his lord, so he (Joseph) stayed in prison for some years.
Text2: And they who believe and whose seed follow them in faith, We cause their seed to join them (there), and We deprive them of nought of their (life_s) work. Every man is a pledge for that which he hath earned.

Text1: And when they entered in the manner which their father had enjoined, it would have naught availed them as against Allah; it was but a need of Jacob_s soul which he thus satisfied; and lo! he was a lord of knowledge because We had taught him; but most of mankind know not.
Text2: And verily, for those who do wrong, there is a punishment beyond that. But most of them know not.

Text1: And the king said: Lo! I saw in a dream seven fat kine which seven lean were eating, and seven green ears of corn and other (seven) dry. O notables! Expound for me my vision, if ye can interpret dreams.
Text2: And We provide them with fruit and meat such as they desire.

Text1: Then after that will come seven hard years which will devour all that ye have prepared for them, save a little of that which ye have stored.
Text2: But Allah hath been gracious unto us and hath preserved us from the torment of the breath of Fire.

Text1: And And when he reached his prime We gave him wisdom and knowledge. Thus We reward the good.
Text2: By the Mount,

Text1: I do not exculpate myself. Lo! the (human) soul enjoineth unto evil, save that whereon my Lord hath mercy. Lo! my Lord is Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: Do their minds command them to do this, or are they an outrageous folk?

Text1: He said: The food which ye are given (daily) shall not come unto you but I shall tell you the interpretation ere it cometh unto you. This is of that which my Lord hath taught me. Lo! I have forsaken the religion of folk who believe not in Allah and are disbelievers in the Hereafter.
Text2: Endure the heat thereof, and whether ye are patient of it or impatient of it is all one for you. Ye are only being paid for what ye used to do.

Text1: O my fellow-prisoners! Are divers lords better, or Allah the One, Almighty?
Text2: Happy because of what their Lord hath given them, and (because) their Lord hath warded off from them the torment of hell-fire.

Text1: And two young men went to prison with him. One of them said: I dreamed that I was pressing wine. The other said: I dreamed that I was carrying upon my head bread whereof the birds were eating. Announce unto us the interpretation, for we see thee of those good (at interpretation).
Text2: Is this magic, or do ye not see?

Text1: So when he saw his shirt torn from behind, he said: Lo! this is of the guile of you women. Lo! the guile of you is very great.
Text2: Lo! the doom of thy Lord will surely come to pass;

Text1: And I have followed the religion of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac and Jacob. It never was for us to attribute aught as partner to Allah. This is of the bounty of Allah unto us (the seed of Abraham) and unto mankind; but most men give not thanks.
Text2: Lo! those who kept their duty dwell in gardens and delight,

Text1: Then, after that, will come a year when the people will have plenteous crops and when they will press (wine and oil).
Text2: Lo! we used to pray unto Him of old. Lo! He is the Benign, the Merciful.

Text1: She verily desired him, and he would have desired her if it had not been that he saw the argument of his Lord. Thus it was, that We might ward off from him evil and lewdness. Lo! he was of Our chosen slaves.
Text2: On fine parchment unrolled,

Text1: And women in the city said: The ruler_s wife is asking of her slave-boy an ill-deed. Indeed he has smitten her to the heart with love. We behold her in plain aberration.
Text2: On the day when the heaven will heave with (awful) heaving,

Text1: They said: We will try to win him from his father: that we will surely do.
Text2: Or askest thou (Muhammad) a fee from them so that they are plunged in debt?

Text1: And the reward of the Hereafter is better, for those who believe and ward off (evil).
Text2: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, but they are sure of nothing!

Text1: And Joseph_s brethren came and presented themselves before him, and he knew them but they knew him not.
Text2: Or do they own the treasures of thy Lord? Or have they been given charge (thereof)?

Text1: And if ye bring him not unto me, then there shall be no measure for you with me, nor shall ye draw near.
Text2: Or hath He daughters whereas ye have sons?

Text1: He said: Can I entrust him to you save as I entrusted his brother to you aforetime? Allah is better at guarding, and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.
Text2: Or have they any god beside Allah? Glorified be Allah from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him)!

Text1: And when he provided them with their provision he said: Bring unto me a brother of yours from your father. See ye not that I fill up the measure and I am the best of hosts?
Text2: Or have they any stairway (unto heaven) by means of which they overhear (decrees). Then let their listener produce some warrant manifest!

Text1: He said unto his young men: Place their merchandise in their saddlebags, so that they may know it when they go back to their folk, and so will come again.
Text2: Or possess they the Unseen so that they can write (it) down?

Text1: He (the king) (then sent for those women and) said: What happened when ye asked an evil act of Joseph? They answered: Allah Blameless! We know no evil of him. Said the wife of the ruler: Now the truth is out. I asked of him an evil act, and he is surely of the truthful.
Text2: Or say they: (he is) a poet, (one) for whom we may expect the accident of time?

Text1: And the king said: Bring him unto me that I may attach him to my person. And when he had talked with him he said: Lo! thou art to-day in our presence established and trusted.
Text2: Or say they: He hath invented it? Nay, but they will not believe!

Text1: So when they went back to their father they said: O our father! The measure is denied us, so send with us our brother that we may obtain the measure, surely we will guard him well.
Text2: Or seek they to ensnare (the messenger)? But those who disbelieve, they are the ensnared!

Text1: Thus gave We power to Joseph in the land. He was the owner of it where he pleased. We reach with Our mercy whom We will. We lose not the reward of the good.
Text2: Or were they created out of naught? Or are they the creators?

Text1: O my two fellow-prisoners! As for one of you, he will pour out wine for his lord to drink; and as for the other, he will be crucified so that the birds will eat from his head. Thus is the case judged concerning which ye did inquire.
Text2: Reclining on ranged couches. And we wed them unto fair ones with wide, lovely eyes.

Text1: (Then Joseph said: I asked for) this, that he (my lord) may know that I betrayed him not in secret, and that surely Allah guideth not the snare of the betrayers.
Text2: Say (unto them): Except (your fill)! Lo! I am with you among the expectant.

Text1: He said: Ye shall sow seven years as usual, but that which ye reap, leave it in the ear, all save a little which ye eat.
Text2: Saying: Lo! of old, when we were with our families, we were ever anxious;

Text1: And when they went in before Joseph, he took his brother unto him, saying: Lo! I, even I, am thy brother, therefore sorrow not for what they did.
Text2: So wait patiently (O Muhammad) for thy Lord_s decree, for surely thou art in Our sight; and hymn the praise of thy Lord when thou uprisest,

Text1: So his Lord heard his prayer and fended off their wiles from him. Lo! He is Hearer, Knower.
Text2: The day when they are thrust with a (disdainful) thrust, into the fire of hell

Text1: He said: I will not send him with you till ye give me an undertaking in the name of Allah that ye will bring him back to me, unless ye are surrounded. And when they gave him their undertaking he said: Allah is the Warden over what we say.
Text2: Then let them be (O Muhammad), till they meet their day, in which they will be thunder-stricken,

Text1: He said: Set me over the storehouses of the land. Lo! I am a skilled custodian.
Text2: Then let them produce speech the like thereof, if they are truthful.

Text1: She said: This is he on whose account ye blamed me. I asked of him an evil act, but he proved continent, but if he do not my behest he verily shall be imprisoned, and verily shall be of those brought low.
Text2: Then woe that day unto the deniers

Text1: O Joseph! Turn away from this, and thou, (O woman), ask forgiveness for thy sin. Lo! thou art of the faulty.
Text2: There is none that can ward it off.

Text1: They answered: Jumbled dreams! And we are not knowing in the interpretation of dreams.
Text2: There they pass from hand to hand a cup wherein is neither vanity nor cause of sin.

Text1: And the king said: Bring him unto me. And when the messenger came unto him, he (Joseph) said: Return unto thy lord and ask him what was the case of the women who cut their hands. Lo! my Lord knoweth their guile.
Text2: Therefor warn (men, O Muhammad). By the grace of Allah thou art neither soothsayer nor madman.

Text1: He said: O my Lord! Prison is more dear than that unto which they urge me, and if Thou fend not off their wiles from me I shall incline unto them and become of the foolish.
Text2: Who play in talk of grave matters;

Text1: Deem they themselves secure from the coming on them of a pall of Allah_s punishment, or the coming of the Hour suddenly while they are unaware?
Text2: And Abraham who paid his debt:

Text1: In their history verily there is a lesson for men of understanding. It is no invented story but a confirmation of the existing (Scripture) and a detailed explanation of everything, and a guidance and a mercy for folk who believe.
Text2: And afterward he will be repaid for it with fullest payment;

Text1: Thou askest them no fee for it. It is naught else than a reminder unto the peoples.
Text2: And gave a little, then was grudging?

Text1: So, When they despaired of (moving) him, they conferred together apart. The eldest of them said: Know ye not how your father took an undertaking from you in Allah_s name and how ye failed in the case of Joseph aforetime? Therefore I shall not go forth from the land until my father giveth leave or Allah judgeth for me. He is the Best of Judges.
Text2: And He revealed unto His slave that which He revealed.

Text1: Then, when the bearer of glad tidings came, he laid it on his face and he became a seer once more. He said: Said I not unto you that I know from Allah that which ye know not?
Text2: And how many angels are in the heavens whose intercession availeth naught save after Allah giveth leave to whom He chooseth and accepteth.

Text1: They said: Is it indeed thou who art Joseph? He said: I am Joseph and this is my brother. Allah hath shown us favour. Lo! he who wardeth off (evil) and endureth (findeth favour); for lo! Allah loseth not the wages of the kindly.
Text2: And Manat, the third, the other?

Text1: Till, when the messengers despaired and thought that they were denied, then came unto them Our help, and whom We would was saved. And Our wrath cannot be warded from the guilty.
Text2: And that his effort will be seen.

Text1: We sent not before thee (any messengers) save men whom We inspired from among the folk of the townships - Have they not travelled in the land and seen the nature of the consequence for those who were before them? And verily the abode of the Hereafter, for those who ward off (evil), is best. Have ye then no sense? -
Text2: And that man hath only that for which he maketh effort,

Text1: He said: I shall ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Lo! He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
Text2: And they have no knowledge thereof. They follow but a guess, and lo! a guess can never take the place of the truth.

Text1: O my Lord! Thou hast given me (something) of sovereignty and hast taught me (something) of the interpretation of events - Creator of the heavens and the earth! Thou art my Protecting Guardian in the world and the Hereafter. Make me to die muslim (unto Thee), and join me to the righteous.
Text2: And unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, that He may reward those who do evil with that which they have done, and reward those who do good with goodness.

Text1: (And when they came unto their father and had spoken thus to him) he said: Nay, but your minds have beguiled you into something. (My course is) comely patience! It may be that Allah will bring them all unto me. Lo! He, only He, is the Knower, the Wise.
Text2: And verily he saw him yet another time

Text1: They said: By Allah, verily Allah hath preferred thee above us, and we were indeed sinful.
Text2: Are yours the males and His the females?

Text1: (Those around him) said: By Allah, lo! thou art in thine old aberration.
Text2: But unto Allah belongeth the after (life), and the former.

Text1: And he turned away from them and said: Alas, my grief for Joseph! And his eyes were whitened with the sorrow that he was suppressing.
Text2: By the lote-tree of the utmost boundary,

Text1: They cried, coming toward them: What is it ye have lost?
Text2: By the Star when it setteth,

Text1: And though thou try much, most men will not believe.
Text2: Didst thou (O Muhammad) observe him who turned away,

Text1: How many a portent is there in the heavens and the earth which they pass by with face averted!
Text2: Hath he knowledge of the Unseen so that he seeth?

Text1: He said: Know ye what ye did unto Joseph and his brother in your ignorance?
Text2: Have ye thought upon Al-Lat and Al-_Uzza

Text1: They said: And what shall be the penalty for it, if ye prove liars?
Text2: It is naught save an inspiration that is inspired,

Text1: They said: O our father! Ask forgiveness of our sins for us, for lo! we were sinful.
Text2: Lo! it is those who disbelieve in the Hereafter who name the angels with the names of females.

Text1: They said: By Allah, thou wilt never cease remembering Joseph till thy health is ruined or thou art of those who perish!
Text2: Nigh unto which is the Garden of Abode.

Text1: They said: By Allah, well ye know we came not to do evil in the land, and are no thieves.
Text2: Nor doth he speak of (his own) desire.

Text1: Then he (Joseph) began the search with their bags before his brother_s bag, then he produced it from his brother_s bag. Thus did We contrive for Joseph. He could not have taken his brother according to the king_s law unless Allah willed. We raise by grades (of mercy) whom We will, and over every lord of knowledge there is one more knowing.
Text2: One vigorous; and he grew clear to view

Text1: And most of them believe not in Allah except that they attribute partners (unto Him).
Text2: Or hath he not had news of what is in the books of Moses

Text1: When the caravan departed their father had said: Truly I am conscious of the breath of Joseph, though ye call me dotard.
Text2: Or shall man have what he coveteth?

Text1: And he placed his parents on the dais and they fell down before him prostrate, and he said: O my father! This is the interpretation of my dream of old. My Lord hath made it true, and He hath shown me kindness, since He took me out of the prison and hath brought you from the desert after Satan had made strife between me and my brethren. Lo! my Lord is tender unto whom He will. He is the Knower, the Wise.
Text2: Such is their sum of knowledge. Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth, and He is Best Aware of him whom goeth right.

Text1: He said: Have no fear this day! May Allah forgive you, and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.
Text2: That indeed were an unfair division!

Text1: Say: This is my Way: I call on Allah with sure knowledge. I and whosoever followeth me - Glory be to Allah! - and I am not of the idolaters.
Text2: That no laden one shall bear another_s load,

Text1: Go, O my sons, and ascertain concerning Joseph and his brother, and despair not of the Spirit of Allah. Lo! none despaireth of the Spirit of Allah save disbelieving folk.
Text2: The eye turned not aside nor yet was overbold.

Text1: Return unto your father and say: O our father! Lo! thy son hath stolen. We testify only to that which we know; we are not guardians of the Unseen.
Text2: The heart lied not (in seeing) what it saw.

Text1: They said: O ruler of the land! Lo! he hath a very aged father, so take one of us instead of him. Lo! we behold thee of those who do kindness.
Text2: Then he drew nigh and came down

Text1: And when they came in before Joseph, he took his parents unto him, and said: Come into Egypt safe, if Allah will!
Text2: Then withdraw (O Muhammad) from him who fleeth from Our remembrance and desireth but the life of the world.

Text1: Go with this shirt of mine and lay it on my father_s face, he will become (again) a seer; and come to me with all your folk.
Text2: They are but names which ye have named, ye and your fathers, for which Allah hath revealed no warrant. They follow but a guess and that which (they) themselves desire. And now the guidance from their Lord hath come unto them.

Text1: This is of the tidings of the Unseen which We inspire in thee (Muhammad). Thou wast not present with them when they fixed their plan and they were scheming.
Text2: Those who avoid enormities of sin and abominations, save the unwilled offences - (for them) lo! thy Lord is of vast mercy. He is Best Aware of you (from the time) when He created you from the earth, and when ye were hidden in the bellies of your mothers. Therefor ascribe not purity unto yourselves. He is Best Aware of him who wardeth off (evil).

Text1: He said: Allah forbid that we should seize save him with whom we found our property; then truly we should be wrong-doers.
Text2: Till he was (distant) two bows_ length or even nearer,

Text1: And when they came (again) before him (Joseph) they said: O ruler! Misfortune hath touched us and our folk, and we bring but poor merchandise, so fill for us the measure and be charitable unto us. Lo! Allah will requite the charitable,
Text2: Verily he saw one of the greater revelations of his Lord.

Text1: They said: If he stealeth, a brother of his stole before. But Joseph kept it secret in his soul and revealed it not unto them. He said (within himself): Ye are in worse case, and Allah knoweth best (the truth of) that which ye allege.
Text2: When he was on the uppermost horizon.

Text1: He said: I expose my distress and anguish only unto Allah, and I know from Allah that which ye know not.
Text2: When that which shroudeth did enshroud the lote-tree,

Text1: They said: The penalty for it! He in whose bag (the cup) is found, he is the penalty for it. Thus we requite wrong-doers.
Text2: Which one of mighty powers hath taught him,

Text1: Ask the township where we were, and the caravan with which we travelled hither. Lo! we speak the truth.
Text2: Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he seeth?

Text1: They said: We have lost the king_s cup, and he who bringeth it shall have a camel-load, and I (said Joseph) am answerable for it.
Text2: Your comrade erreth not, nor is deceived;

Text1: He it is Who showeth you the lightning, a fear and a hope, and raiseth the heavy clouds.
Text2: And Al-Mu_tafikah He destroyed

Text1: Is he who knoweth that what is revealed unto thee from thy Lord is the truth like him who is blind? But only men of understanding heed;
Text2: And laugh and not weep,

Text1: And in the Earth are neighbouring tracts, vineyards and ploughed lands, and date-palms, like and unlike, which are watered with one water. And we have made some of them to excel others in fruit. Lo! herein verily are portents for people who have sense.
Text2: And that He createth the two spouses, the male and the female,

Text1: He is the Knower of the Invisible and the Visible, the Great, the High Exalted.
Text2: And that He destroyed the former (tribe of) A_ad,

Text1: And they bid thee hasten on the evil rather than the good, when exemplary punishments have indeed occurred before them. But lo! thy Lord is rich in pardon for mankind despite their wrong, and lo! thy Lord is strong in punishment.
Text2: And that He hath ordained the second bringing forth;

Text1: Those who disbelieve say: If only some portent were sent down upon him from his Lord! Thou art a warner only, and for every folk a guide.
Text2: And that He it is Who enricheth and contenteth;

Text1: And He it is Who spread out the earth and placed therein firm hills and flowing streams, and of all fruits He placed therein two spouses (male and female). He covereth the night with the day. Lo! herein verily are portents for people who take thought.
Text2: And that He it is Who giveth death and giveth life;

Text1: Allah knoweth that which every female beareth and that which the wombs absorb and that which they grow. And everything with Him is measured.
Text2: And that He it is Who is the Lord of Sirius;

Text1: Allah it is Who raised up the heavens without visible supports, then mounted the Throne, and compelled the sun and the moon to be of service, each runneth unto an appointed term; He ordereth the course; He detaileth the revelations, that haply ye may be certain of the meeting with your Lord.
Text2: And that He it is who maketh laugh, and maketh weep,

Text1: For him are angels ranged before him and behind him, who guard him by Allah_s command. Lo! Allah changeth not the condition of a folk until they (first) change that which is in their hearts; and if Allah willeth misfortune for a folk there is none that can repel it, nor have they a defender beside Him.
Text2: And the folk of Noah aforetime, Lo! they were more unjust and more rebellious;

Text1: Unto Him is the real prayer. Those unto whom they pray beside Allah respond to them not at all, save as (is the response to) one who stretcheth forth his hands toward water (asking) that it may come unto his mouth, and it will never reach it. The prayer of disbelievers goeth (far) astray.
Text2: Concerning which then, of the bounties of thy Lord, canst thou dispute?

Text1: And if thou wonderest, then wondrous is their saying: When we are dust, are we then forsooth (to be raised) in a new creation? Such are they who disbelieve in their Lord; such have carcans on their necks; such are rightful owners of the Fire, they will abide therein.
Text2: From a drop (of seed) when it is poured forth;

Text1: For those who answered Allah_s call is bliss; and for those who answered not His call, if they had all that is in the earth, and therewith the like thereof, they would proffer it as ransom. Such will have a woeful reckoning, and their habitation will be hell, a dire abode.
Text2: Marvel ye then at this statement,

Text1: He sendeth down water from the sky, so that valleys flow according to their measure, and the flood beareth (on its surface) swelling foam - from that which they smelt in the fire in order to make ornaments and tools riseth a foam like unto it - thus Allah coineth (the similitude of) the true and the false. Then, as for the foam, it passeth away as scum upon the banks, while, as for that which is of use to mankind, it remaineth in the earth. Thus Allah coineth the similitudes.
Text2: None beside Allah can disclose it.

Text1: Such as unite that which Allah hath commandeth should be joined, and fear their Lord, and dread a woeful reckoning;
Text2: Rather prostrate yourselves before Allah and serve Him.

Text1: The thunder hymneth His praise and (so do) the angels for awe of Him. He launcheth the thunderbolts and smiteth with them whom He will while they dispute (in doubt) concerning Allah, and He is mighty in wrath.
Text2: So that there covered them that which did cover.

Text1: Say (O Muhammad): Who is Lord of the heavens and the earth? Say: Allah. Say: Take ye then (others) beside Him for protectors, which, even for themselves, have neither benefit nor hurt? Say: Is the blind man equal to the seer, or is darkness equal to light? Or assign they unto Allah partners who created the like of His creation so that the creation (which they made and His creation) seemed alike to them? Say: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Almighty.
Text2: The threatened Hour is nigh.

Text1: And unto Allah falleth prostrate whosoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, as do their shadows in the morning and the evening hours.
Text2: This is a warner of the warners of old.

Text1: Such as keep the pact of Allah, and break not the covenant;
Text2: While ye amuse yourselves?

Text1: Allah effaceth what He will, and establisheth (what He will), and with Him is the source of ordinance.
Text2: (The tribe of) A_ad rejected warnings. Then how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings.

Text1: Is He Who is aware of the deserts of every soul (as he who is aware of nothing)? Yet they ascribe unto Allah partners. Say: Name them. Is it that ye would inform Him of something which He knoweth not in the earth? Or is it but a way of speaking? Nay but their contrivance is made seeming fair for those who disbelieve and they are kept from the right road. He whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide.
Text2: And caused the earth to gush forth springs, so that the waters met for a predestined purpose.

Text1: Gardens of Eden which they enter, along with all who do right of their fathers and their helpmeets and their seed. The angels enter unto them from every gate,
Text2: And if they behold a portent they turn away and say: Prolonged illusion.

Text1: And verily We sent messengers (to mankind) before thee, and We appointed for them wives and offspring, and it was not (given) to any messenger that he should bring a portent save by Allah_s leave. For everything there is a time prescribed.
Text2: And in truth We have made the Quran easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth?

Text1: They who disbelieve say: Thou art no messenger (of Allah). Say: Allah, and whosoever hath knowledge of the Scripture, is sufficient witness between me and you.
Text2: And in truth We have made the Quran easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth?

Text1: And those who break the covenant of Allah after ratifying it, and sever that which Allah hath commanded should be joined, and make mischief in the earth: theirs is the curse and theirs the ill abode.
Text2: And surely there hath come unto them news whereof the purport should deter,

Text1: Those unto whom We gave the Scripture rejoice in that which is revealed unto thee. And of the clans there are who deny some of it. Say: I am commanded only that I serve Allah and ascribe unto Him no partner. Unto Him I cry, and unto Him is my return.
Text2: And verily We left it as a token; but is there any that remembereth?

Text1: For them is torment in the life of the world, and verily the doom of the Hereafter is more painful, and they have no defender from Allah.
Text2: And We carried him upon a thing of planks and nails,

Text1: Allah enlargeth livelihood for whom He will, and straiteneth (it for whom He will); and they rejoice in the life of the world, whereas the life of the world is but brief comfort as compared with the Hereafter.
Text2: Effective wisdom; but warnings avail not.

Text1: Those who believe and do right: Joy is for them, and bliss (their) journey_s end.
Text2: Hastening toward the summoner; the disbelievers say: This is a hard day.

Text1: Whether We let thee see something of that which We have promised them, or make thee die (before its happening), thine is but conveyance (of the message). Ours the reckoning.
Text2: Lo! We let loose on them a raging wind on a day of constant calamity,

Text1: Had it been possible for a Lecture to cause the mountains to move, or the earth to be torn asunder, or the dead to speak, (this Quran would have done so). Nay, but Allah_s is the whole command. Do not those who believe know that, had Allah willed, He could have guided all mankind? As for those who disbelieve, disaster ceaseth not to strike them because of what they do, or it dwelleth near their home until the threat of Allah come to pass. Lo! Allah faileth not to keep the tryst.
Text2: So he cried unto his Lord, saying: I am vanquished, so give help.

Text1: Those who disbelieve say: If only a portent were sent down upon him from his Lord! Say: Lo! Allah sendeth whom He will astray, and guideth unto Himself all who turn (unto Him),
Text2: So withdraw from them (O Muhammad) on the day when the Summoner summoneth unto a painful thing.

Text1: See they not how we aim to the land, reducing it of its outlying parts? (When) Allah doometh there is none that can postpone His doom, and He is swift at reckoning.
Text2: Sweeping men away as though they were uprooted trunks of palm-trees.

Text1: A similitude of the Garden which is promised unto those who keep their duty (to Allah): Underneath it rivers flow; its food is everlasting, and its shade; this is the reward of those who keep their duty, while the reward of disbelievers is the Fire.
Text2: That ran (upon the waters) in Our sight, as a reward for him who was rejected.

Text1: Thus We send thee (O Muhammad) unto a nation, before whom other nations have passed away, that thou mayst recite unto them that which We have inspired in thee, while they are disbelievers in the Beneficent. Say: He is my Lord; there is no Allah save Him. In Him do I put my trust and unto Him is my recourse.
Text2: The folk of Noah denied before them, yea, they denied Our slave and said: A madman; and he was repulsed.

Text1: Such as persevere in seeking their Lord_s Countenance and are regular in prayer and spend of that which We bestow upon them secretly and openly, and overcome evil with good. Theirs will be the sequel of the (heavenly) Home,
Text2: The hour drew nigh and the moon was rent in twain.

Text1: And verily messengers (of Allah) were mocked before thee, but long I bore with those who disbelieved. At length I seized them, and how (awful) was My punishment!
Text2: Then opened We the gates of heaven with pouring water

Text1: Those who were before them plotted; but all plotting is Allah_s. He knoweth that which each soul earneth. The disbelievers will come to know for whom will be the sequel of the (heavenly) Home.
Text2: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!

Text1: Thus have We revealed it, a decisive utterance in Arabic; and if thou shouldst follow their desires after that which hath come unto thee of knowledge, then truly wouldst thou have from Allah no protecting friend nor defender.
Text2: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!

Text1: (Saying): Peace be unto you because ye persevered. Ah, passing sweet will be the sequel of the (heavenly) Home.
Text2: They denied (the Truth) and followed their own lusts. Yet everything will come to a decision

Text1: Who have believed and whose hearts have rest in the remembrance of Allah. Verily in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find rest!
Text2: With downcast eyes, they come forth from the graves as they were locusts spread abroad,

Text1: And We never sent a messenger save with the language of his folk, that he might make (the message) clear for them. Then Allah sendeth whom He will astray, and guideth whom He will. He is the Mighty, the Wise.
Text2: (Unto their warner it was said): To-morrow they will know who is the rash liar.

Text1: Tell My bondmen who believe to establish worship and spend of that which We have given them, secretly and publicly, before a day cometh wherein there will be neither traffick nor befriending.
Text2: And every small and great thing is recorded.

Text1: And they set up rivals to Allah that they may mislead (men) from His way. Say: Enjoy life (while ye may) for lo! your journey_s end will be the Fire.
Text2: And every thing they did is in the scriptures,

Text1: And verily We shall make you to dwell in the land after them. This is for him who feareth My Majesty and feareth My threats.
Text2: And he indeed had warned them of Our blow, but they did doubt the warnings.

Text1: Hell is before him, and he is made to drink a festering water,
Text2: And in truth the punishment decreed befell them early in the morning.

Text1: A similitude of those who disbelieve in their Lord: Their works are as ashes which the wind bloweth hard upon a stormy day. They have no control of aught that they have earned. That is the extreme failure.
Text2: And in truth We have made the Quran easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth?

Text1: Their messengers said: Can there be doubt concerning Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He calleth you that He may forgive you your sins and reprieve you unto an appointed term. They said: Ye are but mortals like us, who would fain turn us away from what our fathers used to worship. Then bring some clear warrant.
Text2: And in truth We have made the Quran easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth?

Text1: And (remind them) how Moses said unto his people: Remember Allah_s favour unto you when He delivered you from Pharaoh_s folk who were afflicting you with dreadful torment, and were slaying your sons and sparing your women; that was a tremendous trial from your Lord.
Text2: And inform them that the water is to be shared between (her and) them. Every drinking will be witnessed.

Text1: Hast thou not seen those who gave the grace of Allah in exchange for thanklessness and led their people down to the Abode of Loss,
Text2: And Our commandment is but one (commandment), as the twinkling of an eye.

Text1: (Even to) hell? They are exposed thereto. A hapless end!
Text2: And verily We have destroyed your fellows; but is there any that remembereth?

Text1: Hast thou not seen that Allah hath created the heavens and the earth with truth? If He will, He can remove you and bring (in) some new creation;
Text2: And warnings came in truth unto the house of Pharaoh

Text1: They all come forth unto their Lord. Then those who were despised say unto those who were scornful: We were unto you a following, can ye then avert from us aught of Allah_s doom? They say: Had Allah guided us, we should have guided you. Whether we rage or patiently endure is (now) all one for us; we have no place of refuge.
Text2: Are your disbelievers better than those, or have ye some immunity in the scriptures?

Text1: And those who disbelieved said unto their messengers: Verily we will drive you out from our land, unless ye return to our religion. Then their Lord inspired them, (saying): Verily we shall destroy the wrong-doers,
Text2: As grace from Us. Thus We reward him who giveth thanks.

Text1: And when your Lord proclaimed: If ye give thanks, I will give you more; but if ye are thankless, lo! My punishment is dire.
Text2: But they call their comrade and he took and hamstrung (her).

Text1: And maketh the sun and the moon, constant in their courses, to be of service unto you, and hath made of service unto you the night and the day.
Text2: Firmly established in the favour of a Mighty King.

Text1: Allah, unto Whom belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth. and woe unto the disbelievers from an awful doom;
Text2: For they said; Is it a mortal man, alone among us, that we are to follow? Then indeed we should fall into error and madness.

Text1: Those who love the life of the world more than the Hereafter, and debar (men) from the way of Allah and would have it crooked: such are far astray.
Text2: Hath the remembrance been given unto him alone among us? Nay, but he is a rash liar.

Text1: Giving its fruit at every season by permission of its Lord? Allah coineth the similitudes for mankind in order that they may reflect.
Text2: Lo! the guilty are in error and madness.

Text1: Allah is He Who created the heavens and the earth, and causeth water to descend from the sky, thereby producing fruits as food for you, and maketh the ships to be of service unto you, that they may run upon the sea at His command, and hath made of service unto you the rivers;
Text2: Lo! the righteous will dwell among gardens and rivers,

Text1: We verily sent Moses with Our revelations, saying: Bring thy people forth from darkness unto light. And remind them of the days of Allah. Lo! therein are revelations for each steadfast, thankful (heart).
Text2: Lo! We are sending the she-camel as a test for them; so watch them and have patience;

Text1: Allah confirmeth those who believe by a firm saying in the life of the world and in the Hereafter, and Allah sendeth wrong-doers astray. And Allah doeth what He will.
Text2: Lo! We have created every thing by measure.

Text1: How should we not put our trust in Allah when He hath shown us our ways? We surely will endure the hurt ye do us. In Allah let the trusting put their trust.
Text2: Lo! We sent a storm of stones upon them (all) save the family of Lot, whom We rescued in the last watch of the night,

Text1: Hath not the history of those before you reached you: the folk of Noah, and (the tribes of) A_ad and Thamud, and those after them? None save Allah knoweth them. Their messengers came unto them with clear proofs, but they thrust their hands into their mouths, and said: Lo! we disbelieve in that wherewith ye have been sent, and lo! we are in grave doubt concerning that to which ye call us.
Text2: Lo! We sent upon them one Shout, and they became as the dry twigs (rejected by) the builder of a cattle-fold.

Text1: Seest thou not how Allah coineth a similitude: A goodly saying, as a goodly tree, its root set firm, its branches reaching into heaven,
Text2: Nay, but the Hour (of doom) is their appointed tryst, and the Hour will be more wretched and more bitter (than their earthly failure).

Text1: Which he sippeth but can hardly swallow, and death cometh unto him from every side while yet he cannot die, and before him is a harsh doom.
Text2: Now taste My punishment after My warnings!

Text1: And the similitude of a bad saying is as a bad tree, uprooted from upon the earth, possessing no stability.
Text2: On the day when they are dragged into the Fire upon their faces (it is said unto them): Feel the touch of hell.

Text1: And Satan saith, when the matter hath been decided: Lo! Allah promised you a promise of truth; and I promised you, then failed you. And I had no power over you save that I called unto you and ye obeyed me. So blame not, but blame yourselves. I cannot help you, nor can ye help me, Lo! I disbelieved in that which ye before ascribed to me. Lo! for wrong-doers is a painful doom.
Text2: Or say they: We are a host victorious?

Text1: Their messengers said unto them: We are but mortals like you, but Allah giveth grace unto whom He will of His slaves. It is not ours to bring you a warrant unless by the permission of Allah. In Allah let believers put their trust!
Text2: The folk of Lot rejected warnings.

Text1: And those who believed and did good works are made to enter Gardens underneath which rivers flow, therein abiding by permission of their Lord, their greeting therein: Peace!
Text2: The hosts will all be routed and will turn and flee.

Text1: And Moses said: Though ye and all who are in the earth prove thankless, lo! Allah verily is Absolute, Owner of Praise.
Text2: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!

Text1: And they sought help (from their Lord) and every froward potentate was bought to naught;
Text2: They even asked of him his guests for an ill purpose. Then We blinded their eyes (and said): Taste now My punishment after My warnings!

Text1: And that is no great matter for Allah.
Text2: Who denied Our revelations, every one. Therefore We grasped them with the grasp of the Mighty, the Powerful.

Text1: As they come hurrying on in fear, their heads upraised, their gaze returning not to them, and their hearts as air.
Text2: And the earth hath He appointed for (His) creatures,

Text1: On the day when the earth will be changed to other than the earth, and the heavens (also will be changed) and they will come forth unto Allah, the One, the Almighty,
Text2: And the jinn did He create of smokeless fire.

Text1: My Lord! Make me to establish proper worship, and some of my posterity (also); our Lord! and accept my prayer.
Text2: And the sky He hath uplifted; and He hath set the measure,

Text1: Deem not that Allah is unaware of what the wicked do. He but giveth them a respite till a day when eyes will stare (in terror),
Text2: But observe the measure strictly, nor fall short thereof.

Text1: And when Abraham said: My Lord! Make safe this territory, and preserve me and my sons from serving idols.
Text2: Hath made known the Quran.

Text1: So think not that Allah will fail to keep His promise to His messengers. Lo! Allah is Mighty, Able to Requite (the wrong).
Text2: He created man of clay like the potter_s,

Text1: My Lord! Lo! they have led many of mankind astray. But whoso followeth me, he verily is of me. And whoso disobeyeth me - Still Thou art Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: He hath created man.

Text1: This is a clear message for mankind in order that they may be warned thereby, and that they may know that He is only One Allah, and that men of understanding may take heed.
Text2: He hath loosed the two seas. They meet.

Text1: Our Lord! Lo! I have settled some of my posterity in an uncultivable valley near unto Thy holy House, our Lord! that they may establish proper worship; so incline some hearts of men that they may yearn toward them, and provide Thou them with fruits in order that they may be thankful.
Text2: He hath taught him utterance.

Text1: And (have ye not) dwelt in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves (of old) and (hath it not) become plain to you how We dealt with them and made examples for you?
Text2: Husked grain and scented herb.

Text1: Their raiment of pitch, and the Fire covering their faces,
Text2: Lord of the two Easts, and Lord of the two Wests!

Text1: Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents and believers on the day when the account is cast.
Text2: That ye exceed not the measure,

Text1: And He giveth you of all ye ask of Him, and if ye would count the bounty of Allah ye cannot reckon it. Lo! man is verily a wrong-doer, an ingrate.
Text2: The Beneficent

Text1: Praise be to Allah Who hath given me, in my old age, Ishmael and Isaac! Lo! my Lord is indeed the Hearer of Prayer.
Text2: The stars and the trees prostrate.

Text1: Our Lord! Lo! Thou knowest that which we hide and that which we proclaim. Nothing in the earth or in the heaven is hidden from Allah.
Text2: The sun and the moon are made punctual.

Text1: And warn mankind of a day when the doom will come upon them, and those who did wrong will say: Our Lord! Reprieve us for a little while. We will obey Thy call and will follow the messengers. (It will be answered): Did ye not swear before that there would be no end for you?
Text2: Wherein are fruit and sheathed palm-trees,

Text1: Verily they have plotted their plot, and their plot is with Allah, though their plot were one whereby the mountains should be moved.
Text2: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

Text1: He said: My Lord! Because Thou hast sent me astray, I verily shall adorn the path of error for them in the earth, and shall mislead them every one,
Text2: (In beauty) like the jacynth and the coral-stone.

Text1: We verily sent (messengers) before thee among the factions of the men of old.
Text2: All that are in the heavens and the earth entreat Him. Every day He exerciseth (universal) power.

Text1: And lo! for all such, hell will be the promised place.
Text2: And beside them are two other gardens,

Text1: Save him who stealeth the hearing, and them doth a clear flame pursue.
Text2: And when the heaven splitteth asunder and becometh rosy like red hide -

Text1: (All) save the family of Lot. Them we shall deliver every one,
Text2: Blessed be the name of thy Lord, Mighty and glorious!

Text1: And the jinn did We create aforetime of essential fire.
Text2: But for him who feareth the standing before his Lord there are two gardens.

Text1: Lo! those who ward off (evil) are among gardens and watersprings.
Text2: Dark green with foliage.

Text1: Why bringest thou not angels unto us, if thou art of the truthful?
Text2: Everyone that is thereon will pass away;

Text1: They said: Be not afraid! Lo! we bring thee good tidings of a boy possessing wisdom.
Text2: Fair ones, close-guarded in pavilions -

Text1: No nation can outstrip its term nor can they lag behind.
Text2: His are the ships displayed upon the sea, like banners.

Text1: He said: This is a right course incumbent upon Me:
Text2: Is the reward of goodness aught save goodness?

Text1: And even if We opened unto them a gate of heaven and they kept mounting through it,
Text2: O company of jinn and men, if ye have power to penetrate (all) regions of the heavens and the earth, then penetrate (them)! Ye will never penetrate them save with (Our) sanction.

Text1: So, when I have made him and have breathed into him of My Spirit, do ye fall down, prostrating yourselves unto him.
Text2: Of spreading branches.

Text1: And we have given unto you livelihoods therein, and unto those for whom ye provide not.
Text2: On that day neither man nor jinni will be questioned of his sin.

Text1: He said: And afterward what is your business, O ye messengers (of Allah)?
Text2: Reclining on green cushions and fair carpets.

Text1: And lo! the curse shall be upon thee till the Day of Judgment.
Text2: Reclining upon couches lined with silk brocade, the fruit of both the gardens near to hand.

Text1: And We send the winds fertilising, and cause water to descend from the sky, and give it you to drink. It is not ye who are the holders of the store thereof.
Text2: The guilty will be known by their marks, and will be taken by the forelocks and the feet.

Text1: Let them eat and enjoy life, and let (false) hope beguile them. They will come to know!
Text2: There cometh forth from both of them the pearl and coral-stone.

Text1: We send not down the angels save with the Fact, and in that case (the disbelievers) would not be tolerated.
