Text2: O ye who believe! Ward off from yourselves and your families a Fire whereof the fuel is men and stones, over which are set angels strong, severe, who resist not Allah in that which He commandeth them, but do that which they are commanded.

Text1: They are asking thee concerning the Spirit. Say: The Spirit is by command of my Lord, and of knowledge ye have been vouchsafed but little.
Text2: When the Prophet confided a fact unto one of his wives and when she afterward divulged it and Allah apprised him thereof, he made known (to her) part thereof and passed over part. And when he told it her she said: Who hath told thee? He said: The Knower, the Aware hath told me.

Text1: Say (unto them): If ye possessed the treasures of the mercy of my Lord, ye would surely hold them back for fear of spending, for man was ever grudging.
Text2: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord there is the doom of hell, a hapless journey_s end!

Text1: Say: Believe therein or believe not, lo! those who were given knowledge before it, when it is read unto them, fall down prostrate on their faces, adoring,
Text2: And keep your opinion secret or proclaim it, lo! He is Knower of all that is in the breasts (of men).

Text1: And We said unto the Children of Israel after him: Dwell in the land; but when the promise of the Hereafter cometh to pass We shall bring you as a crowd gathered out of various nations.
Text2: And they say: Had we been wont to listen or have sense, we had not been among the dwellers in the flames.

Text1: Have they not seen that Allah Who created the heavens and the earth is Able to create the like of them, and hath appointed for them an end whereof there is no doubt? But the wrong-doers refuse aught save disbelief.
Text2: And verily We have beautified the world_s heaven with lamps, and We have made them missiles for the devils, and for them We have prepared the doom of flame.

Text1: He said: In truth thou knowest that none sent down these (portents) save the Lord of the heavens and the earth as proofs, and lo! (for my part) I deem thee lost, O Pharaoh.
Text2: As it would burst with rage. Whenever a (fresh) host is flung therein the wardens thereof ask them: Came there unto you no warner?

Text1: Say: If there were in the earth angels walking secure, We had sent down for them from heaven an angel as messenger.
Text2: Blessed is He in Whose hand is the Sovereignty, and, He is Able to do all things.

Text1: Say (unto mankind): Cry unto Allah, or cry unto the Beneficent, unto whichsoever ye cry (it is the same). His are the most beautiful names. And thou (Muhammad), be not loud-voiced in thy worship nor yet silent therein, but follow a way between.
Text2: Have ye taken security from Him Who is in the heaven that He will not cause the earth to swallow you when lo! it is convulsed?

Text1: They fall down on their faces, weeping, and it increaseth humility in them.
Text2: He it is Who hath made the earth subservient unto you, so Walk in the paths thereof and eat of His providence. And unto Him will be the resurrection (of the dead).

Text1: And (it is) a Quran that We have divided, that thou mayst recite it unto mankind at intervals, and We have revealed it by (successive) revelation.
Text2: Lo! those who fear their Lord in secret, theirs will be forgiveness and a great reward.

Text1: And say: Praise be to Allah, Who hath not taken unto Himself a son, and Who hath no partner in the Sovereignty, nor hath He any protecting friend through dependence. And magnify Him with all magnificence.
Text2: Or have ye taken security from Him Who is in the heaven that He will not let loose on you a hurricane? But ye shall know the manner of My warning.

Text1: Saying: Glory to our Lord! Verily the promise of our Lord must be fulfilled.
Text2: Should He not know what He created? And He is the Subtile, the Aware.

Text1: With truth have We sent it down, and with truth hath it descended. And We have sent thee as naught else save a bearer of good tidings and a warner.
Text2: So they acknowledge their sins; but far removed (from mercy) are the dwellers in the flames.

Text1: That is their reward because they disbelieved Our revelations and said: When we are bones and fragments shall we, forsooth, be raised up as a new creation?
Text2: Then look again and yet again, thy sight will return unto thee weakened and made dim.

Text1: And he wished to scare them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him, all together.
Text2: They say: Yea, verily, a warner came unto us; but we denied and said: Allah hath naught revealed; ye are in naught but a great error.

Text1: And verily We gave unto Moses nine tokens, clear proofs (of Allah_s Sovereignty). Do but ask the Children of Israel how he came unto them, then Pharaoh said unto him: Lo! I deem thee one bewitched, O Moses.
Text2: When they are flung therein they hear its roaring as it boileth up,

Text1: Say: Allah sufficeth for a witness between me and you. Lo! He is Knower, Seer of His slaves.
Text2: Who hath created life and death that He may try you which of you is best in conduct; and He is the Mighty, the Forgiving,

Text1: And he whom Allah guideth, he is led aright; while, as for him whom He sendeth astray, for them thou wilt find no protecting friends beside Him, and We shall assemble them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces, blind, dumb and deaf; their habitation will be hell; whenever it abateth, We increase the flame for them.
Text2: Who hath created seven heavens in harmony. Thou (Muhammad) canst see no fault in the Beneficent One_s creation; then look again: Canst thou see any rifts?

Text1: And lo! We shall make all that is thereon a barren mound.
Text2: And they say: When (will) this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful?

Text1: Praise be to Allah Who hath revealed the Scripture unto His slave, and hath not placed therein any crookedness,
Text2: And verily those before them denied, then (see) the manner of My wrath (with them)!

Text1: When the young men fled for refuge to the Cave and said: Our Lord! Give us mercy from Thy presence, and shape for us right conduct in our plight.
Text2: But when they see it nigh, the faces of those who disbelieve will be awry, and it will be said (unto them): This is that for which ye used to call.

Text1: (But hath made it) straight, to give warning of stern punishment from Him, and to bring unto the believers who do good works the news that theirs will be a fair reward,
Text2: Have they not seen the birds above them spreading out their wings and closing them? Naught upholdeth them save the Beneficent. Lo! He is Seer of all things.

Text1: (A thing) whereof they have no knowledge, nor (had) their fathers, Dreadful is the word that cometh out of their mouths. They speak naught but a lie.
Text2: Is he who goeth groping on his face more rightly guided, or he who walketh upright on a straight road?

Text1: Wherein they will abide for ever;
Text2: Or who is he that will be an army unto you to help you instead of the Beneficent? The disbelievers are in naught but illusion.

Text1: And to warn those who say: Allah hath chosen a son,
Text2: Or who is he that will provide for you if He should withhold His providence? Nay, but they are set in pride and frowardness.

Text1: Then We sealed up their hearing in the Cave for a number of years.
Text2: Say (O Muhammad): Have ye thought: Whether Allah causeth me (Muhammad) and those with me to perish or hath mercy on us, still, who will protect the disbelievers from a painful doom?

Text1: Yet it may be, if they believe not in this statement, that thou (Muhammad) wilt torment thy soul with grief over their footsteps.
Text2: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): He it is who gave you being, and hath assigned unto you ears and eyes and hearts. Small thanks give ye!

Text1: We narrate unto thee their story with truth. Lo! they were young men who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.
Text2: Say: Have ye thought: If (all) your water were to disappear into the earth, who then could bring you gushing water?

Text1: And afterward We raised them up that We might know which of the two parties would best calculate the time that they had tarried.
Text2: Say: He is the Beneficent. In Him we believe and in Him we put our trust. And ye will soon know who it is that is in error manifest.

Text1: Lo! We have placed all that is on the earth as an ornament thereof that We may try them: which of them is best in conduct.
Text2: Say: He it is Who multiplieth you in the earth, and unto Whom ye will be gathered.

Text1: Or deemest thou that the People of the Cave and the Inscription are a wonder among Our portents?
Text2: Say: The knowledge is with Allah only, and I am but a plain warner;

Text1: Which guideth unto righteousness, so we believe in it and we ascribe no partner unto our Lord.
Text2: Blessed is He in Whose hand is the Sovereignty, and, He is Able to do all things.

Text1: And (we believe) that He - exalted be the glory of our Lord! - hath taken neither wife nor son,
Text2: Who hath created life and death that He may try you which of you is best in conduct; and He is the Mighty, the Forgiving,

Text1: And that the foolish one among us used to speak concerning Allah an atrocious lie.
Text2: Who hath created seven heavens in harmony. Thou (Muhammad) canst see no fault in the Beneficent Oneäs creation; then look again: Canst thou see any rifts?

Text1: And lo! we had supposed that humankind and jinn would not speak a lie concerning Allah -
Text2: Then look again and yet again, thy sight will return unto thee weakened and made dim.

Text1: And indeed (O Muhammad) individuals of humankind used to invoke the protection of individuals of the jinn, so that they increased them in revolt against Allah);
Text2: And verily We have beautified the worldäs heaven with lamps, and We have made them missiles for the devils, and for them We have prepared the doom of flame.

Text1: And indeed they supposed, even as ye suppose, that Allah would not raise anyone (from the dead) -
Text2: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord there is the doom of hell, a hapless journeyäs end!

Text1: And (the Jinn who had listened to the Quran said): We had sought the heaven but had found it filled with strong warders and meteors.
Text2: When they are flung therein they hear its roaring as it boileth up,

Text1: And we used to sit on places (high) therein to listen. But he who listeneth now findeth a flame in wait for him;
Text2: As it would burst with rage. Whenever a (fresh) host is flung therein the wardens thereof ask them: Came there unto you no warner?

Text1: And we know not whether harm is boded unto all who are in the earth, or whether their Lord intendeth guidance for them.
Text2: They say: Yea, verily, a warner came unto us; but we denied and said: Allah hath naught revealed; ye are in naught but a great error.

Text1: And among us there are righteous folk and among us there are far from that. We are sects having different rules.
Text2: And they say: Had we been wont to listen or have sense, we had not been among the dwellers in the flames.

Text1: And we know that we cannot escape from Allah in the earth, nor can we escape by flight.
Text2: So they acknowledge their sins; but far removed (from mercy) are the dwellers in the flames.

Text1: And when we heard the guidance, we believed therein, and whoso believeth in his Lord, he feareth neither loss nor oppression.
Text2: Lo! those who fear their Lord in secret, theirs will be forgiveness and a great reward.

Text1: And there are among us some who have surrendered (to Allah) and there are among us some who are unjust. And whoso hath surrendered to Allah, such have taken the right path purposefully.
Text2: And keep your opinion secret or proclaim it, lo! He is Knower of all that is in the breasts (of men).

Text1: And as for those who are unjust, they are firewood for hell.
Text2: Should He not know what He created? And He is the Subtile, the Aware.

Text1: If they (the idolaters) tread the right path, We shall give them to drink of water in abundance
Text2: He it is Who hath made the earth subservient unto you, so Walk in the paths thereof and eat of His providence. And unto Him will be the resurrection (of the dead).

Text1: That We may test them thereby, and whoso turneth away from the remembrance of his Lord; He will thrust him into ever-growing torment.
Text2: Have ye taken security from Him Who is in the heaven that He will not cause the earth to swallow you when lo! it is convulsed?

Text1: And the places of worship are only for Allah, so pray not unto anyone along with Allah.
Text2: Or have ye taken security from Him Who is in the heaven that He will not let loose on you a hurricane? But ye shall know the manner of My warning.

Text1: And when the slave of Allah stood up in prayer to Him, they crowded on him, almost stifling.
Text2: And verily those before them denied, then (see) the manner of My wrath (with them)!

Text1: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): I pray unto Allah only, and ascribe unto Him no partner.
Text2: Have they not seen the birds above them spreading out their wings and closing them? Naught upholdeth them save the Beneficent. Lo! He is Seer of all things.

Text1: Each of the gardens gave its fruit and withheld naught thereof. And We caused a river to gush forth therein.
Text2: And in the morning it was as if plucked.

Text1: And when ye withdraw from them and that which they worship except Allah, then seek refuge in the Cave; your Lord will spread for you of His mercy and will prepare for you a pillow in your plight.
Text2: And lo! thine verily will be a reward unfailing.

Text1: He said: This is that which we have been seeking. So they retraced their steps again.
Text2: And lo! those who disbelieve would fain disconcert thee with their eyes when they hear the Reminder, and they say: Lo! he is indeed mad;

Text1: And thou mightest have seen the sun when it rose move away from their cave to the right, and when it set go past them on the left, and they were in the cleft thereof. That was (one) of the portents of Allah. He whom Allah guideth, he indeed is led aright, and he whom He sendeth astray, for him thou wilt not find a guiding friend.
Text2: And lo! thou art of a tremendous nature.

Text1: As for such, theirs will be Gardens of Eden, wherein rivers flow beneath them; therein they will be given armlets of gold and will wear green robes of finest silk and gold embroidery, reclining upon throne therein. Blest the reward, and fair the resting-place!
Text2: And made no exception (for the Will of Allah);

Text1: And he had fruit. And he said unto his comrade, when he spake with him: I am more than thee in wealth, and stronger in respect of men.
Text2: And they cried out one unto another in the morning,

Text1: And thou wouldst have deemed them waking though they were asleep, and We caused them to turn over to the right and the left, and their dog stretching out his paws on the threshold. If thou hadst observed them closely thou hadst assuredly turned away from them in flight, and hadst been filled with awe of them.
Text2: And thou wilt see and they will see

Text1: And the guilty behold the Fire and know that they are about to fall therein, and they find no way of escape thence.
Text2: Ask them (O Muhammad) which of them will vouch for that!

Text1: He said: Didst thou see, when we took refuge on the rock, and I forgot the fish - and none but Satan caused me to forget to mention it - it took its way into the waters by a marvel.
Text2: But his Lord chose him and placed him among the righteous.

Text1: And when they reached the point where the two met, they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the waters, being free.
Text2: But wait thou for thy Lord_s decree, and be not like him of the fish, who cried out in despair.

Text1: If only, when thou enteredst thy garden, thou hadst said: That which Allah willeth (will come to pass)! There is no strength save in Allah! Though thou seest me as less than thee in wealth and children,
Text2: But when they saw it, they said: Lo! we are in error!

Text1: Except if Allah will. And remember thy Lord when thou forgettest, and say: It may be that my Lord guideth me unto a nearer way of truth than this.
Text2: Detracter, spreader abroad of slanders,

Text1: Say: Allah is Best Aware how long they tarried. His is the Invisible of the heavens and the earth. How clear of sight is He and keen of hearing! They have no protecting friend beside Him, and He maketh none to share in His government.
Text2: Greedy therewithal, intrusive.

Text1: And when they had gone further, he said unto his servant: Bring us our breakfast. Verily we have found fatigue in this our journey.
Text2: Had it not been that favour from his Lord had reached him he surely had been cast into the wilderness while he was reprobate.

Text1: And (it is said) they tarried in their Cave three hundred years and add nine.
Text2: Hinderer of the good, transgressor, malefactor

Text1: And recite that which hath been revealed unto thee of the Scripture of thy Lord. There is none who can change His words, and thou wilt find no refuge beside Him.
Text2: It is because he is possessed of wealth and children

Text1: And coin for them the similitude of the life of the world as water which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingleth with it and then becometh dry twigs that the winds scatter. Allah is able to do all things.
Text2: It may be that our Lord will give us better than this in place thereof. Lo! we beseech our Lord.

Text1: And who doth greater wrong than he who hath been reminded of the revelations of his Lord, yet turneth away from them and forgetteth what his hands send forward (to the Judgment)? Lo! on their hearts We have placed coverings so that they understand not, and in their ears a deafness. And though thou call them to the guidance, in that case they can never be led aright.
Text2: Leave Me (to deal) with those who give the lie to this pronouncement. We shall lead them on by steps from whence they know not.

Text1: And (bethink you of) the Day when we remove the hills and ye see the earth emerging, and We gather them together so as to leave not one of them behind.
Text2: Lo! for those who keep from evil are gardens of bliss with their Lord.

Text1: For they, if they should come to know of you, will stone you or turn you back to their religion; then ye will never prosper.
Text2: Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth from His way, and He is Best Aware of those who walk aright.

Text1: Lo! as for those who believe and do good works - Lo! We suffer not the reward of one whose work is goodly to be lost.
Text2: Lo! We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed that they would pluck its fruit next morning,

Text1: Yet it may be that my Lord will give me better than thy garden, and will send on it a bolt from heaven, and some morning it will be a smooth hillside,
Text2: Nay, but we are desolate!

Text1: And say not of anything: Lo! I shall do that tomorrow,
Text2: Neither obey thou each feeble oath-monger,

Text1: His comrade, when he (thus) spake with him, exclaimed: Disbelievest thou in Him Who created thee of dust, then of a drop (of seed), and then fashioned thee a man?
Text2: No needy man shall enter it to-day against you.

Text1: And We made firm their hearts when they stood forth and said: Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We cry unto no Allah beside Him, for then should we utter an enormity.
Text2: Nun. By the pen and that which they write (therewith),

Text1: And naught hindereth mankind from believing when the guidance cometh unto them, and from asking forgiveness of their Lord unless (it be that they wish) that the judgment of the men of old should come upon them or (that) they should be confronted with the Doom.
Text2: On the day when it befalleth in earnest, and they are ordered to prostrate themselves but are not able,

Text1: And (all) those townships! We destroyed them when they did wrong, and We appointed a fixed time for their destruction.
Text2: Or dost thou (Muhammad) ask a fee from them so that they are heavily taxed?

Text1: And verily We have displayed for mankind in this Quran all manner of similitudes, but man is more than anything contentious.
Text2: Or have they other gods? Then let them bring their other gods if they are truthful

Text1: And (be mindful of) the Day when He will say: Call those partners of Mine whom ye pretended. Then they will cry unto them, but they will not hear their prayer, and We shall set a gulf of doom between them.
Text2: Or have ye a covenant on oath from Us that reacheth to the Day of Judgment, that yours shall be all that ye ordain?

Text1: And (remember) when We said unto the angels: Fall prostrate before Adam, and they fell prostrate, all save Iblis. He was of the jinn, so he rebelled against his Lord_s command. Will ye choose him and his seed for your protecting friends instead of Me, when they are an enemy unto you? Calamitous is the exchange for evil-doers.
Text2: Or have ye a scripture wherein ye learn

Text1: And when Moses said unto his servant: I will not give up until I reach the point where the two rivers meet, though I march on for ages.
Text2: Or is the Unseen theirs that they can write (thereof)?

Text1: And he went into his garden, while he (thus) wronged himself. He said: I think not that all this will ever perish.
Text2: Saying: Run unto your field if ye would pluck (the fruit).

Text1: And they are set before thy Lord in ranks (and it is said unto them): Now verily have ye come unto Us as We created you at the first. But ye thought that We had set no tryst for you.
Text2: Shall We then treat those who have surrendered as We treat the guilty?

Text1: I think not that the Hour will ever come, and if indeed I am brought back unto my Lord I surely shall find better than this as a resort.
Text2: So they went off, saying one unto another in low tones:

Text1: Wealth and children are an ornament of the life of the world. But the good deeds which endure are better in thy Lord_s sight for reward, and better in respect of hope.
Text2: Such was the punishment. And verily the punishment of the Hereafter is greater if they did but know.

Text1: I made them not to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor their own creation; nor choose I misleaders for (My) helpers.
Text2: That ye shall indeed have all that ye choose?

Text1: Restrain thyself along with those who cry unto their Lord at morn and evening, seeking His Countenance; and let not thine eyes overlook them, desiring the pomp of the life of the world; and obey not him whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance, who followeth his own lust and whose case hath been abandoned.
Text2: That, when Our revelations are recited unto him, he saith: Mere fables of the men of old.

Text1: Or some morning the water thereof will be lost in the earth so that thou canst not make search for it.
Text2: The best among them said: Said I not unto you: Why glorify ye not (Allah)?

Text1: Coin for them a similitude: Two men, unto one of whom We had assigned two gardens of grapes, and We had surrounded both with date-palms and had put between them tillage.
Text2: Then a visitation from thy Lord came upon it while they slept

Text1: And he had no troop of men to help him as against Allah, nor could he save himself.
Text2: Then some of them drew near unto others, self-reproaching.

Text1: And in like manner We disclosed them (to the people of the city) that they might know that the promise of Allah is true, and that, as for the Hour, there is no doubt concerning it. When (the people of the city) disputed of their case among themselves, they said: Build over them a building; their Lord knoweth best concerning them. Those who won their point said: We verily shall build a place of worship over them.
Text2: Therefor obey not thou the rejecters

Text1: In this case is protection only from Allah, the True, He is Best for reward, and best for consequence.
Text2: They said: Alas for us! In truth we were outrageous.

Text1: And his fruit was beset (with destruction). Then began he to wring his hands for all that he had spent upon it, when (now) it was all ruined on its trellises, and to say: Would that I had ascribed no partner to my Lord!
Text2: They said: Glorified be our Lord! Lo! we have been wrong-doers.

Text1: But He is Allah, my Lord, and I ascribe unto my Lord no partner.
Text2: They went betimes, strong in (this) purpose.

Text1: These, our people, have chosen (other) gods beside Him though they bring no clear warrant (vouchsafed) to them. And who doth greater wrong than he who inventeth a lie concerning Allah?
Text2: Thou art not, for thy Lord_s favour unto thee, a madman.

Text1: Say: (It is) the truth from the Lord of you (all). Then whosoever will, let him believe, and whosoever will, let him disbelieve. Lo! We have prepared for disbelievers Fire. Its tent encloseth them. If they ask for showers, they will be showered with water like to molten lead which burneth the faces. Calamitous the drink and ill the resting-place!
Text2: We shall brand him on the nose.

Text1: And the Book is placed, and thou seest the guilty fearful of that which is therein, and they say: What kind of a Book is this that leaveth not a small thing nor a great thing but hath counted it! And they find all that they did confronting them, and thy Lord wrongeth no-one.
Text2: What aileth you? How foolishly ye judge!

Text1: Then found they one of Our slaves, unto whom We had given mercy from Us, and had taught him knowledge from Our presence.
Text2: When it is naught else than a Reminder to creation.

Text1: And in like manner We awakened them that they might question one another. A speaker from among them said: How long have ye tarried? They said: We have tarried a day or some part of a day, (Others) said: Your Lord best knoweth what ye have tarried. Now send one of you with this your silver coin unto the city, and let him see what food is purest there and bring you a supply thereof. Let him be courteous and let no man know of you.
Text2: Which of you is the demented.

Text1: (Some) will say: They were three, their dog the fourth, and (some) say: Five, their dog the sixth, guessing at random; and (some) say: Seven, and their dog the eighth. Say (O Muhammad): My Lord is Best Aware of their number. None knoweth them save a few. So contend not concerning them except with an outward contending, and ask not any of them to pronounce concerning them.
Text2: Who would have had thee compromise, that they may compromise.

Text1: We send not the messengers save as bearers of good news and warners. Those who disbelieve contend with falsehood in order to refute the Truth thereby. And they take Our revelations and that wherewith they are threatened as a jest.
Text2: With eyes downcast, abasement stupefying them. And they had been summoned to prostrate themselves while they were yet unhurt.

Text1: Thy Lord is the Forgiver, Full of Mercy. If He took them to task (now) for what they earn, He would hasten on the doom for them; but theirs is an appointed term from which they will find no escape.
Text2: Yet I bear with them, for lo! My scheme is firm.

Text1: Then he followed a road
Text2: (And it will be said unto those therein): Eat and drink at ease for that which ye sent on before you in past days.

Text1: He said: That wherein my Lord hath established me is better (than your tribute). Do but help me with strength (of men), I will set between you and them a bank.
Text2: (It will be said): Take him and fetter him

Text1: He said: Allah willing, thou shalt find me patient and I shall not in aught gainsay thee.
Text2: (The tribes of) Thamud and A_ad disbelieved in the judgment to come.

Text1: How canst thou bear with that whereof thou canst not compass any knowledge?
Text2: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the reality is!

Text1: Those whose effort goeth astray in the life of the world, and yet they reckon that they do good work.
Text2: And all that ye see not

Text1: So they twain set out till, when they were in the ship, he made a hole therein. (Moses) said: Hast thou made a hole therein to drown the folk thereof? Thou verily hast done a dreadful thing.
Text2: And as for A_ad, they were destroyed by a fierce roaring wind,

Text1: Say: Though the sea became ink for the Words of my Lord, verily the sea would be used up before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even though We brought the like thereof to help.
Text2: And if he had invented false sayings concerning Us,

Text1: So (it was). And We knew all concerning him.
Text2: And knew not what my reckoning!

Text1: So they twain journeyed on till, when they met a lad, he slew him. (Moses) said: What! Hast thou slain an innocent soul who hath slain no man? Verily thou hast done a horrid thing.
Text2: And Pharaoh and those before him, and the communities that were destroyed, brought error,

Text1: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure belonging to them, and their father had been righteous, and thy Lord intended that they should come to their full strength and should bring forth their treasure as a mercy from their Lord; and I did it not upon my own command. Such is the interpretation of that wherewith thou couldst not bear.
Text2: And the angels will be on the sides thereof, and eight will uphold the Throne of thy Lord that day, above them.

Text1: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working on the river, and I wished to mar it, for there was a king behind them who is taking every ship by force.
Text2: And the earth with the mountains shall be lifted up and crushed with one crash,

Text1: And we intended that their Lord should change him for them for one better in purity and nearer to mercy.
Text2: And the heaven will split asunder, for that day it will be frail.

Text1: Give me pieces of iron - till, when he had levelled up (the gap) between the cliffs, he said: Blow! - till, when he had made it a fire, he said: Bring me molten copper to pour thereon.
Text2: And then expose him to hell-fire

Text1: And (Gog and Magog) were not able to surmount, nor could they pierce (it).
Text2: And then insert him in a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits.

Text1: And they were utterly confounded, and they said: Well thou knowest that these speak not.

Text1: They speak not until He hath spoken, and they act by His command.

Text1: They cried: Burn him and stand by your gods, if ye will be doing.

Text1: They said: Bringest thou unto us the truth, or art thou some jester?

Text2: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!

Text1: Those who fear their Lord in secret and who dread the Hour (of doom).

Text2: And gardens of thick foliage.

Text2: Lo! the Garden will be his home.

Text1: O mankind! if ye are in doubt concerning the Resurrection, then lo! We have created you from dust, then from a drop of seed, then from a clot, then from a little lump of flesh shapely and shapeless, that We may make (it) clear for you. And We cause what We will to remain in the wombs for an appointed time, and afterward We bring you forth as infants, then (give you growth) that ye attain your full strength. And among you there is he who dieth (young), and among you there is he who is brought back to the most abject time of life, so that, after knowledge, he knoweth naught. And thou (Muhammad) seest the earth barren, but when We send down water thereon, it doth thrill and swell and put forth every lovely kind (of growth).
Text2: On the day when the first trump resoundeth.

Text1: They are guided unto gentle speech; they are guided unto the path of the Glorious One.

Text2: We shall make thee read (O Muhammad) so that thou shalt not forget

Text1: He who obeyeth Allah and His messenger, and feareth Allah, and keepeth duty (unto Him): such indeed are the victorious.
Text2: Wherein he will neither die nor live.

Text1: Hast thou not seen how Allah wafteth the clouds, then gathereth them, then maketh them layers, and thou seest the rain come forth from between them; He sendeth down from the heaven mountains wherein is hail, and smiteth therewith whom He will, and averteth it from whom He will. The flashing of His lightning all but snatcheth away the sight.
Text2: Who bringeth forth the pasturage,

Text1: Hast thou not seen that Allah, He it is Whom all who are in the heavens and the earth praise, and the birds in their flight? Of each He knoweth verily the worship and the praise; and Allah is Aware of what they do.
Text2: Who createth, then disposeth;

Text1: And unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and unto Allah is the journeying.
Text2: Who measureth, then guideth;

Text1: Make not the calling of the messenger among you as your calling one of another. Allah knoweth those of you who steal away, hiding themselves. And let those who conspire to evade orders beware lest grief or painful punishment befall them.
Text2: Drinking from a boiling spring,

Text1: And when the children among you come to puberty then let them ask leave even as those before them used to ask it. Thus Allah maketh clear His revelations for you. Allah is Knower, Wise.
Text2: Hath there come unto thee tidings of the Overwhelming?

Text1: Lo! verily unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth. He knoweth your condition. And (He knoweth) the Day when they are returned unto Him so that He may inform them of what they did. Allah is Knower of all things.
Text2: No food for them save bitter thorn-fruit

Text1: As for women past child-bearing, who have no hope of marriage, it is no sin for them if they discard their (outer) clothing in such a way as not to show adornment. But to refrain is better for them. Allah is Hearer, Knower.
Text2: On that day (many) faces will be downcast,

Text1: They only are the true believers who believe in Allah and His messenger and, when they are with him on some common errand, go not away until they have asked leave of him. Lo! those who ask leave of thee, those are they who believe in Allah and His messenger. So, if they ask thy leave for some affair of theirs, give leave to whom thou wilt of them, and ask for them forgiveness of Allah. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
Text2: Scorched by burning fire,

Text1: They will say: Be Thou Glorified! it was not for us to choose any protecting friends beside thee; but Thou didst give them and their fathers ease till they forgot the warning and became lost folk.
Text2: Allah will punish him with direst punishment.

Text1: Or (why is not) treasure thrown down unto him, or why hath he not a paradise from whence to eat? And the evil-doers say: Ye are but following a man bewitched.
Text2: And goblets set at hand

Text1: We never sent before thee any messengers but lo! they verily ate food and walked in the markets. And We have appointed some of you a test for others: Will ye be steadfast? And thy Lord is ever Seer.
Text2: And Ours their reckoning.

Text1: Blessed is He Who, if He will, will assign thee better than (all) that - Gardens underneath which rivers flow - and will assign thee mansions.
Text2: And silken carpets spread.

Text2: And the earth, how it is spread?
